translated: ƒÄryadeva states in the Eight Chapters:üîΩThe meaning of this is that through the exertion of striving for the purpose of seeing reality in this life, one does not attain nirvana.

analyzed: brda las byung ba'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de'i brgyud pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: because it is the indirect cause of the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment which arises from signs.

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gang zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the nature of the Bodhisattva?

original: de la lan ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la lan ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The answer is given in the line, ‚ÄúIn the realm of all things,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos rnams kyi dbyings ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dbyings ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The realm of things is emptiness.

original: de dang mnyam pa ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa ni chos thams cad de /
translated: That which is equal to it is all things.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gang yang med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gang yang med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: Just as emptiness has no nature whatsoever, so do all things.

original: mnyam pa nyid de yang tha dad par brtags nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de yang tha dad par brtags nas bstan pa'o //
translated: That equality is taught by analyzing it into different aspects.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pas glo bur du byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pas glo bur du byung ba'o //
translated: It is adventitious, because it is produced by causes and conditions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skyes ma thag tu 'jig pas na mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skyes ma thag tu 'jig pas na mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is not stable, because it is destroyed as soon as it arises.

original: glo bur du byung ba dang / mi gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan de gnyis kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin te /
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba dang / mi gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan de gnyis kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin te /
translated: The reason that they are adventitious and do not endure is that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa dang / mi 'jig pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa dang / mi 'jig pa gang yin pa de rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: That which is not fabricated and does not disintegrate is an essence.

original: des na chos thams cad dbyings dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad dbyings dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are the same as the ultimate expanse.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa ste zhes pa ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa ste zhes pa ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot to be known‚Äù is the probandum.

original: shes par bgyi ba tsam dang zhes pa ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: shes par bgyi ba tsam dang zhes pa ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMere object of knowledge‚Äù is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad zla ba gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa de bzhin du shes par bya ba tsam yin gyi de rnams la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad zla ba gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa de bzhin du shes par bya ba tsam yin gyi de rnams la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because all phenomena are mere objects of knowledge, like the appearance of two moons and so on, they do not have essence.

original: des na shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not to be known.

original: rang bzhin kho na shes par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin kho na shes par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: Only an essence is to be known.

original: shes pa pos stong pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gal te shes pa po yod par gyur na de'i tshe chos thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par shes pa po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad yongs su shes par byaüîΩba ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa pos stong pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gal te shes pa po yod par gyur na de'i tshe chos thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par shes pa po med pa'i phyir chos thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because of being empty of an experiencer. If an experiencer existed, then at that time all phenomena would be fully understood. But because of the nonexistence of an experiencer, as will be explained, all phenomena are not fully understood.

original: 'di'i don ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad shes pas yul du byas pa tsam yin pa dang shes pa pos stong pa de'i phyir chos thams cad chos kyi rang bzhin gyis shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don @11a * //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad shes pas yul du byas pa tsam yin pa dang shes pa pos stong pa de'i phyir chos thams cad chos kyi rang bzhin gyis shes par bya ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don @11a * //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Because all phenomena are merely objects that are taken as objects by consciousness and are empty of an experiencer, therefore all phenomena are not to be understood by way of the nature of phenomena.

original: to ; / chos nyid zhes pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: to ; / chos nyid zhes pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of phenomena is emptiness.

original: 'di lta bu 'di zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa la sogs pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa la sogs pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: This kind of is the realm of phenomena, equality, and so on, and the aspect of all phenomena not being fully understood.

original: sems can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Beings, and so on, are easy to understand.

original: sems can rnams la chos nyid khong du chud par byed pa de yang rang nyid kyis chos nyid khong du chud pa med pas mi srid pas rang gi byang chub shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos nyid khong du chud par byed pa de yang rang nyid kyis chos nyid khong du chud pa med pas mi srid pas rang gi byang chub shugs kyis 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: And that very thing which causes sentient beings to understand reality is impossible without one's own understanding of reality. Therefore, one's own enlightenment is indirectly implied.

original: des na gzhan gyi don gyi ched du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs par mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin can byang chub tu sems bskyed pas bstan no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don gyi ched du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dmigs par mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin can byang chub tu sems bskyed pas bstan no //
translated: Thus, the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment is taught for one who has the nature of aspiring to the aim of others, who has the aim of perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de'i khyad par brjod pa'i sgo nas phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩsems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de'i khyad par brjod pa'i sgo nas phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir / sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the benefit by way of describing the excellence of that Thought of Enlightenment, he says:üîΩThe Thought of Enlightenment of the Bodhisattvas, which is the basis of all benefit and happiness for all sentient beings, is the seed of the Sugata's tree of enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi stobs kyis sems can thams cad la phan pa dang ; bde bar byed pa de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems nyid la phan pa dang bde ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi stobs kyis sems can thams cad la phan pa dang ; bde bar byed pa de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems nyid la phan pa dang bde ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Because by the power of the Thought of Enlightenment, all sentient beings are caused to have benefit and happiness, therefore, the Thought of Enlightenment itself is called the Thought of Benefit and Happiness.

original: de la phan pa'i sems ni sems can rnams bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan pa'i sems ni sems can rnams bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The thought of benefit is that which causes sentient beings to attain happy rebirth and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: bde ba ni skye ba 'di la dge ba'i las la sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni skye ba 'di la dge ba'i las la sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Happiness is that which causes them to engage in virtuous actions in this life.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bla na med pa'i sems phan pa dang bde ba'i sems las gong na sems gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bla na med pa'i sems phan pa dang bde ba'i sems las gong na sems gzhan med pas so //
translated: For that very reason, the unsurpassed thought is the thought of benefit and happiness, because there is no other thought higher than that.

original: gang la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de la tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pas tshad med pa bzhis khyad par du byas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: gang la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de la tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pas tshad med pa bzhis khyad par du byas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach the benefits of the thought of awakening, which is distinguished by the four immeasurables, since it possesses the four immeasurables in regard to those in whom the thought of awakening is generated,

original: byams pas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byams pas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúthrough love,‚Äù and so on.

original: byams pas gnyen pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'i rnam pas byams pa zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pas /
analyzed: byams pas gnyen pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'i rnam pas byams pa zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pas /
translated: The thought of love, which is the antidote to hatred, is the thought that wishes for them to possess happiness.

original: byams pas gnyen por 'gyur ba'i sems zhes smos te /
analyzed: byams pas gnyen por 'gyur ba'i sems zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says ‚Äúthe thought that is the antidote through love.‚Äù

original: gnyen pos dngos po gzhan la gos par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnyen pos dngos po gzhan la gos par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the mind is defiled by the antidote.

original: rtsub pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsub pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the mind is defiled by roughness.

original: de bzhin du byams pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams la sems gos par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du byams pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams la sems gos par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the mind is defiled by sentient beings through the power of love,

original: phyir phyogs pas ni mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go //üîΩsnying rjes mi zlogs pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa @11b can gyi snying rjes sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyis skyo bar mi 'gyur bas snying rje'i stobs kyis mi zlogs pa'i sems dang ldan par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phyir phyogs pas ni mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tha tshig go // snying rjes mi zlogs pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa @11b can gyi snying rjes sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyis skyo bar mi 'gyur bas snying rje'i stobs kyis mi zlogs pa'i sems dang ldan par 'gyur bas so //
translated: but not by turning away from them.üîΩThe mind that is not turned away by compassion is the mind that is not discouraged by the suffering of sentient beings through compassion that has the aspect of wanting to free them from suffering.

original: dga' bas 'gyod pa ma mchis pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can gyi dga' bas phyis 'gyod pa mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: dga' bas 'gyod pa ma mchis pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can gyi dga' bas phyis 'gyod pa mi skye ba'o //
translated: The mind that is free from regret through joy is the mind that does not later regret through joy that has the aspect of wanting sentient beings to never be separated from benefit and happiness.

original: btang snyoms kyi dri ma mchis pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems rnam pa gsum la rim pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i gti mug dang /üîΩzhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid can btang snyoms kyi dri ma med pa'i sems yin te /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dri ma mchis pa'i sems dang zhes pa ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems rnam pa gsum la rim pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i gti mug dang / zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam pa'i mtshan nyid can btang snyoms kyi dri ma med pa'i sems yin te /
translated: The mind that is free of the stain of indifference is characterized by a state of mind that is free of the mental afflictions of delusion,üîΩhatred, and desire, respectively.

original: sems can rnams la sems dri ma med pas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sems dri ma med pas so //
translated: It is a mind that is free of the stain of indifference because it is a mind that is free of the stain of indifference toward sentient beings.

original: gang la byang chub kyi sems skyes pa de la ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sgo nas byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon ston pa ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang la byang chub kyi sems skyes pa de la ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi sgo nas byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon ston pa ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since one who has generated the thought of awakening possesses the three meditative absorptions, the benefits of the thought of awakening are presented in terms of the three meditative absorptions in the lines beginning ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyis mi 'gyur ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med mthong bas sems gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis 'gyur ba med pa'i sems yin te /üîΩrnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pas sems 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma ma mchis pas dmigs pa ma mchis pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid la rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa phung po lnga spangs nas ji lta ba bzhin du zhi bar yid la byed
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis mi 'gyur ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med mthong bas sems gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis 'gyur ba med pa'i sems yin te / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pas sems 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro // mtshan ma ma mchis pas dmigs pa ma mchis pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid la rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa phung po lnga spangs nas ji lta ba bzhin du zhi bar yid la byed
translated: It is the mind of immutability through the meditative stabilization of emptiness, whose nature is the characteristic of the mind‚Äôs stability through the insight into the selflessness of persons and of phenomena, which has the nature of the inexpressible.üîΩThe mind without objective reference through signlessness refers to the mind without objective reference through the meditative stabilization of the absence of objective reference, whose nature is the characteristic of the mind‚Äôs stability through the mental attention to peace just as it is, having abandoned the five aggregates, which are the signs that are the causes of conceptuality in regard to the reality of the inexpressible.

original: pas sems gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa med pa'i sems te /üîΩnyer len gyi phung po lnga la mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: pas sems gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs pa med pa'i sems te /üîΩnyer len gyi phung po lnga la mi dmigs pas so //
translated: It is the mind without objective reference through the meditative stabilization of the absence of objective reference, whose nature is the characteristic of the mind‚Äôs stability through the mental attention to peace just as it is, having abandoned the five aggregates, which are the signs that are the causes of conceptuality in regard to the reality of the inexpressible.üîΩIt is the mind without objective reference through the meditative stabilization of the absence of objective reference, whose nature is the characteristic of the mind‚Äôs stability through the mental attention to peace just as it is, having abandoned the five aggregates, which are the signs that are the causes of conceptuality in regard to the reality of the inexpressible.üîΩIt is the mind without objective reference through the meditative stabilization of the absence of objective reference, whose nature is the characteristic of the mind‚Äôs stability through the mental attention to peace just as it is, having abandoned the five appropriated aggregates.

original: smon pa ma mchis pas mi gnas pa'i sems zhes pa ni brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po de nyid phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pas kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis yongs su bzung bas skyon rnam pa du mas skyon dang ldan par mthong nas phyis kyi dus su de la mi smon pa sngon du 'gro bas sems gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can smon pa ma mchis @12a * //
analyzed: smon pa ma mchis pas mi gnas pa'i sems zhes pa ni brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po de nyid phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pas kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis yongs su bzung bas skyon rnam pa du mas skyon dang ldan par mthong nas phyis kyi dus su de la mi smon pa sngon du 'gro bas sems gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can smon pa ma mchis @12a * //
translated: The mind that does not abide due to the absence of aspiration is the characteristic of the mind that abides, preceded by the absence of aspiration, having seen that very thing which has the nature of the inexpressible is completely taken up by faults in many ways, due to being motivated by afflictions and suffering that arise from distorted conceptualization.

original: pas mi gnas pa'i sems zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pas mi gnas pa'i sems zhes pa'o //
translated: It is called the mind that does not abide due to the absence of aspiration.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the conclusion,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattvas‚Äù and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: de la rin po che'i phreng ba dbang por bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rin po che'i phreng ba dbang por bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the garland of jewels there,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAs it is said‚Äù and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i rtsa ba ni ri rab bzhin du brtan pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / phyogs thams cad du khyab pa'i snying rje dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i ye shes zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i rtsa ba ni ri rab bzhin du brtan pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / phyogs thams cad du khyab pa'i snying rje dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i ye shes zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The root of that bodhisattva is the thought of awakening, which is firm like Mount Meru, compassion that pervades all directions, and wisdom free from the extremes of things and non-things, and so on.

original: gal te gsum ka byang chub sems dpa'i rgyu yin na snying rje la ci'i phyir bstod par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te gsum ka byang chub sems dpa'i rgyu yin na snying rje la ci'i phyir bstod par byed ce na /
translated: If all three are the causes of the bodhisattva, why is compassion praised?

original: de la lan ni byang chub kyi sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: de la lan ni byang chub kyi sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: The answer to that is stated with the thought of awakening, and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: snying rje gtso bor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje gtso bor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that compassion is primary,

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros so //
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros so //
translated: it is said, because, and so on.üîΩBecause compassion alone is the seed of the perfect harvest of the Victorious Ones, therefore compassion is praised first.

original: gang gi phyir rgyal ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa'i sa bon snying rje kho na yin pa de'i phyir dang por snying rje la bstod pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyal ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa'i sa bon snying rje kho na yin pa de'i phyir dang por snying rje la bstod pa dang / de bzhin du rgyal ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa la /
translated: And likewise, for the perfect harvest of the Victorious Ones,

original: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa'i rim pas 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu chu lta bu'i snying rje kho na yin pa dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir rgyal ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa la yun ring du longs spyod pa'i rgyu smin pa dang 'dra ba snying rje kho na dang /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa'i rim pas 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu chu lta bu'i snying rje kho na yin pa dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir rgyal ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa la yun ring du longs spyod pa'i rgyu smin pa dang 'dra ba snying rje kho na dang /
translated: Likewise, it is the sole cause of the ripening of the perfect harvest of the victors, like the cause of long enjoyment.üîΩLikewise, it is the sole cause of the uninterrupted arising of the harvest of the victors from the mindstream through the teaching of the dharma, like the cause of ripening.

original: de bzhin du chos bstan pa'i sgo nas rgyud las rgyal ba'i lo tog rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i rgyu smin pa lta bu snying rje kho na yin pa de'i phyir ngas dang por snying rje kho na la bstod par bgyi'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos bstan pa'i sgo nas rgyud las rgyal ba'i lo tog rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i rgyu smin pa lta bu snying rje kho na yin pa de'i phyir ngas dang por snying rje kho na la bstod par bgyi'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: For that reason, I praise compassion alone at the beginning.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'bras bu'i 'bras bu la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'bras bu'i 'bras bu la sogs pas so //

original: sogs pas ni shing thog la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pas ni shing thog la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //

original: phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam grangs mang po'o //

analyzed: sa bon dang bcas zhes pa la sogs pa ni dang po nye bar mkho ba sa bon yin te /

original: de med na 'bras bu mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de med na 'bras bu mi 'byung bas so //

original: bar du mkho ba chu ste /
analyzed: bar du mkho ba chu ste /

analyzed: de med na myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / yal ga la sogs pa mi 'byung bas so //

original: tha ma nye bar mkho ba smin pa yin te /
analyzed: tha ma nye bar mkho ba smin pa yin te /

original: de med na yun ring du longs spyad du med pa dang / brgyud nas gzhan dang gzhan mi skye bas @12b yun ring du gnas par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de med na yun ring du longs spyad du med pa dang / brgyud nas gzhan dang gzhan mi skye bas @12b yun ring du gnas par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Without it, the fruit cannot be enjoyed for a long time, and it does not last long, because it does not produce other fruits.

original: 'o na bar dang tha mar yang sa bon dang chu nye bar mkho bas bar du chu la tha mar smin pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bar dang tha mar yang sa bon dang chu nye bar mkho bas bar du chu la tha mar smin pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: But since the seed and water are also necessary in the middle and at the end, why is it said that water is necessary in the middle and ripening at the end?

analyzed: de lta bu'i dogs pa bsal ba'i ched du gtso bo zhes smos so //

analyzed: sa bon dang chu bar dang tha mar nye bar mkho ba yin du zin kyang bar du chu dang ; tha mar smin pa gtso bo yin pas de ltar brjod kyi /
translated: Although the seed, water, and so on are necessary in the beginning, middle, and end, still, since the water and so on in the middle and the ripening in the end are the most important, they are mentioned in that order.

original: dus gsum char du yang zhes pa ni dang po dang / bar dang / tha mar ro //
analyzed: dus gsum char du yang zhes pa ni dang po dang / bar dang / tha mar ro //

analyzed: rgyal ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs pa la dus gsum du snying rje nye bar mkho bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di ltar snying rje can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //

original: de la dbang po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dbang po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: zhes pa'i lung 'dis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba can snying rje yin par bstan no //

analyzed: da ni bar du snying rje nye bar mkho ba'i dbang du byas nas /

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: snying rje kho na chu yin pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje kho na chu yin pa'o //

original: yang dang yang du ste skad cig so so la'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du ste skad cig so so la'o //

original: bcus par ma gyur na ste snying rje dang mi ldan na'o //üîΩ'bras bu'i tshogs ni sems can mtha' yas pa'i don byed pa'i phyir /

analyzed: snying rjes yun ring du gnas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that compassion endures for a long time, he says:

analyzed: 'phags pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The great accumulation of the fruits of the noble ones,üîΩwhich has been transmitted in stages from one to another,üîΩwould not increase for a long time,üîΩif it were not for compassion.

translated: because immediately after the manifest enlightenment of the Buddha, there would be no teaching of the Dharma due to his nirvana.üîΩThus, having paid homage by way of demonstrating the reason for compassion being the most important, in two verses,

original: thag pas bcings pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid dang / khron par 'khor bar byed pa dang / 'og tu 'gro ba'i rang bzhin can 'bad pas steng du drang bar bya ba nyid dang / snga ma dang phyi ma dang bar gyi rim pa nges par mi nus pa dang /

analyzed: des dam du bsdams pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba las grol bar mi 'gyur bas so //

original: 'khrul 'khor bskor mkhan rnam par shes pa'i bskyod pa la rag las par 'jug pa zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa nyid 'khrul 'khor bskor mkhan te /

analyzed: de ji ltar bskyod cing bskul ba de la rag las par 'jug pa ste /

original: 'di'i don ni rnam par shes pa gong du 'gro ba der sems can rnams skye bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rnam par shes pa gong du 'gro ba der sems can rnams skye bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //

analyzed: 'phyan pa zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa 'khrul 'khor skor bar byed pa ste 'og tu skor bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: thur du 'gro bar 'jug pa zhes pa ni dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba'i rang bzhin can no //

original: mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum yod kyang zhes bya ba ni de la ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa @14b gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum yod kyang zhes bya ba ni de la ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa @14b gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Ignorance, craving and grasping are defilement by moral defilement.

original: de la bden pa gnyis mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa gnyis mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //

original: khyad par med pa'i srid pa gzhan la mngon par dga' ba ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i srid pa gzhan la mngon par dga' ba ni srid pa'o //
translated: Craving is the delight in other forms of existence without distinction.

original: lha'am klur skye bar gyur cig snyam pa'i khyad par srid pa'i lam la mngon par dga' ba ni len pa'o //
analyzed: lha'am klur skye bar gyur cig snyam pa'i khyad par srid pa'i lam la mngon par dga' ba ni len pa'o //

original: de la ma rig pa ni skye ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni skye ba'i rgyu'o //

original: sred pa dang len pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu'o //

original: nyon mongs pa gsum po de rnams nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gsum po de rnams nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /

original: 'dis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'dis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bas so //

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //

analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i las 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i las khams gsum pa ni 'du byed do //

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i las ni srid pa'o //

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //

original: de skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi zhes pa'i dngos po bdun no //
analyzed: de skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi zhes pa'i dngos po bdun no //

translated: The master Candrakƒ´rti says that the mind that is imbued with the seeds of karma is consciousness conditioned by formations.

translated: The Treasury of Abhidharma says that at the time of conception in the mother‚Äôs womb, the five aggregates are consciousness conditioned by formations.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs te /
translated: Consciousness conditioned by name and form is

analyzed: de kho na la nur nur po'i gnas skabs zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la phung po bzhi po rnams yul la 'dud pa'am srid pa gzhan la 'dud pas ming ste /

analyzed: mngon par phyogs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: gzugs so // ming dang gzugs de 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rim gyis mig la sogs pa skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ste /

analyzed: de'i gnas skabs na skye mched drug yongs su rdzogs pas so //

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i skye ba'i sgo yin pas skye mched do //

original: yang nying mtshams sbyor ba ni skye ba'o //üîΩming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / rga shi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang nying mtshams sbyor ba ni skye ba'o // ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / rga shi zhes bya'o //

original: dngos po bdun po 'di rnams skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po bdun po 'di rnams skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, and old age and death are the seven entities that are the afflictions of birth.

analyzed: dngos po bdun po 'dis skye ba kho na kun nas nyon mongs par byas pa yin pas so //
translated: Since these seven entities are the afflictions of birth alone,

analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga po ni sngon gyi ma rig pa dang / 'du byed kyi 'bras bu yin no //

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang / rga shi ni da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu'o //

original: de ltar mi shes pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar mi shes pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum mo //
translated: Ignorance, etc., are the three afflictions: affliction through afflictions, affliction through karma, and affliction through birth.

analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba yin pas so //

analyzed: de dag gi rgyu yin pas so // 'dis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal yang mtshon par bya ste /

original: de la tshor ba btang @15b snyoms 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba btang @15b snyoms 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba ste /

analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi gzhan dbang du gyur ba de nyid sdug bsngal ba'o //

analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The formative forces that are the cause of this are also suffering due to the formative forces.

analyzed: zo chun brgyud mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gro ba zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor gyi gnas skabs dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du bstan to //

original: de la mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de la mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach the summary of that,

analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù and so on is easy to understand.

analyzed: de ltar sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje la phyag 'tshal nas /

translated: in order to pay homage to compassion that takes phenomena as its object and to nonreferential compassion, he states the connection: ‚ÄúCompassion that takes phenomena as its object, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe line ‚ÄúThe world is seen to be like a water-moon, moving and unstable‚Äù is easy to understand.üîΩThe line ‚ÄúThe world is seen to be like a water-moon, moving and unstable‚Äù is easy to understand.

analyzed: /'gro ba g-yo ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ci ltar rlung gis g-yo bar gyur pa'i chu'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan g-yo ba'i rang bzhin du mthong ba dang / gdung ba sel ba la sogs pa'i don byed mi nus pas rang bzhin med par mthong ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas kyang rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan dang ldan pa'i skad cig ma so so la nus pa tha dad pas 'gro ba
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe world is seen to be like a water-moon, moving and unstable‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: snying rjer gyur gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: snying rjer gyur gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /

analyzed: 'gro la snying rjer gyur gang de la 'dud //

original: ces sngar bstan pa'i tshig rkang de 'dir sbyar ba'o //üîΩde 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ces sngar bstan pa'i tshig rkang de 'dir sbyar ba'o // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: chu rnyog ma can la @16a * //

analyzed: gzugs brnyan mi mthong bas de dgag pa'i phyir /

translated: ‚ÄúPreviously, the basis of the object‚Äù and so on means that prior to seeing the reflection of the moon, the basis of the object, which has the characteristic of water, comes into contact with the wind, and together with it, the reflection of the moon is destroyed in each moment.

analyzed: chu dang zla ba gnyis ka g-yo ba nyid du mthong ba'o //

original: de ltar dpe bstan pa don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dpe bstan pa don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: ci ltar zla ba'i gzugs brnyan la skad cig ma la so so la mi rtag pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mthong ba de ltar ro //

original: 'jig tshogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can phung po lnga la bdag dang @16b bdag gir mthong ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //

original: de nyid mtsho ste /
analyzed: de nyid mtsho ste /

original: de ltar yang rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam 'grel las /

analyzed: ma rig pa'i chu sngon po rgya che ba zhes smos so //

original: de nyid rlung ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni mi shes pa la brjod la /

analyzed: des na bskyod pa zhes smos so //

original: de nyid bdud rtsi'i khyad par can yin te ;

analyzed: 'dis ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi sku bstan te /

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //

original: de ltar snying rje bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar snying rje bstan nas /

analyzed: 'brel pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the connection,

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, those who are under the influence of compassion, and so on.

original: de dag gi zhes pa ni snying rje'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes pa ni snying rje'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who are under the influence of compassion means those who are under the influence of compassion.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi dbye ba rnam pa bcu zhes pa ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu'i dbye bas byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bcu bstan par 'dod @17b pas so ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi dbye ba rnam pa bcu zhes pa ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu'i dbye bas byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bcu bstan par 'dod @17b pas so ;
translated: The ten types of bodhicitta means that it is taught that there are ten types of bodhicitta by dividing it into the ten grounds such as the Joyous.

original: / re zhig byang chub kyi sems dang po'i dbang du byas nas zhes pa ni don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang sa dang po rab tu dga' bas bsdus pa don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems rnams kyi dang po yin pas dang po'i dbang du byasüîΩnas zhes smos so //
analyzed: / re zhig byang chub kyi sems dang po'i dbang du byas nas zhes pa ni don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang sa dang po rab tu dga' bas bsdus pa don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems rnams kyi dang po yin pas dang po'i dbang du byas nas zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ...in terms of the first thought of enlightenment means that, since the ultimate thought of enlightenment is the first of the ultimate thoughts of enlightenment that are included within the first stage, the Joyous, it is referred to as the first.

original: de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The stages are as follows:

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis la theg pa chen po zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis la theg pa chen po zhes kyang bya la /
translated: The twenty-two thoughts of enlightenment are called the Great Vehicle.

original: de nyid la 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: They are also called the path of the bodhisattva who possesses the result.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni 'dun pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems nyi shu rtsa gnyis ni 'dun pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
translated: The twenty-two thoughts of enlightenment are: the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by aspiration, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by intention, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by application, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by superior intention, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by superior dedication, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the immeasurables, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the perfections, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the means of unification, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the factors of enlightenment, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the factors of existence, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the powers, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the forces, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the factors of abandonment, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the result, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the path, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of all aspects, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the sphere of reality, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the absence of characteristics, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the absence of expectancy, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the absence of suffering, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the absence of origination, the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the absence of cessation, and the thought of enlightenment that is accompanied by the knowledge of the path of abandonment.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
translated: It is to be accompanied by the perfection of generosity, the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
translated: the perfection of concentration, the perfection of insight, the four immeasurables, the five higher perceptions,

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / rton pa bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / rton pa bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
translated: It is accompanied by the four means of gathering disciples, the four correct knowledges, the four reliances, and the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang ; zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / gzungs dang spobs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / chos gleng ba bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang ; zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / gzungs dang spobs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / chos gleng ba bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang /
translated: It is accompanied by the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, serenity and insight, retention and eloquence, and the four kinds of fearlessness.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by the path of single progress and skillful means.

original: de la dang po gsum ni smon pa'i sems bskyed do //
analyzed: de la dang po gsum ni smon pa'i sems bskyed do //
translated: The first three of these are the aspirational awakening mind.

original: lhag ma bcu dgu ni 'jug pa'i sems bskyed do //
analyzed: lhag ma bcu dgu ni 'jug pa'i sems bskyed do //
translated: The remaining nineteen are the venturing awakening mind.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam pa gsum ni smon pa'i sems //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni smon pa'i sems //
translated: The three aspects are the aspiration thought.

original: 'dun sogs gsum gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'dun sogs gsum gyi dbye bas so //
translated: They are distinguished by the three: aspiration and so on.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba yi sems //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba yi sems //
translated: The thought called ‚Äúengaged‚Äù

original: bcu dgu dag tu 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bcu dgu dag tu 'dod pa yin // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Is asserted to be nineteen.üîΩThus, the twenty-two thoughts that are accompanied by aspiration are each endowed with the six perfections.

original: @18a * // 'dun pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems bskyed nyi shu rtsa gnyis re re yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pas yod pa nyid do snyam pa'i lhag par mos pa yid ches par skyes shing yon tan dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i lhag

original: 'di nas bzung nas byang chub sems dpa' skyes bu chen po'i rtog pa brgyad mngon du byed de /
analyzed: 'di nas bzung nas byang chub sems dpa' skyes bu chen po'i rtog pa brgyad mngon du byed de /
translated: From this point on, the bodhisattva manifests the eight thoughts of a great being.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are these eight?üîΩWhen will I be able to destroy all the sufferings of all sentient beings?üîΩWhen will I be able to bring all those sentient beings who are tormented by poverty to great prosperity?

original: de yang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad 'joms pa'i nus pa can du nam 'gyur snyam pa dang / dbul bas nyam thag pa'i sems can rnams 'byor pa chen po la bdag gis nam zhig sbyar bar bya snyam pa dang / bdag gi lus kyi sha khrag gis sems can gyi don nam zhig byed snyam pa dang /
analyzed: de yang sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad 'joms pa'i nus pa can du nam 'gyur snyam pa dang / dbul bas nyam thag pa'i sems can rnams 'byor pa chen po la bdag gis nam zhig sbyar bar bya snyam pa dang / bdag gi lus kyi sha khrag gis sems can gyi don nam zhig byed snyam pa dang /
translated: When will I be able to benefit sentient beings with my own flesh and blood?üîΩWhen will I be able to benefit sentient beings even if it means staying in the hells for a long time?

original: yun ring du dmyal bar gnas su zin kyang sems can la phan pa kho na nam zhig byed snyam pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor bas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yid bzhin du rdzogs par nam zhig mthong snyam pa dang /
analyzed: yun ring du dmyal bar gnas su zin kyang sems can la phan pa kho na nam zhig byed snyam pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor bas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yid bzhin du rdzogs par nam zhig mthong snyam pa dang /
translated: When will I be able to fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings by means of mundane and supramundane activities?

original: sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las nam 'dren par 'gyur snyam pa dang / sems can la phan pa dang bral ba'i sems skye ba dang / yang sems can gyi don la sbyar ba dang bral ba'i sems dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las nam 'dren par 'gyur snyam pa dang / sems can la phan pa dang bral ba'i sems skye ba dang / yang sems can gyi don la sbyar ba dang bral ba'i sems dang /
translated: When the thought of being free from benefiting sentient beings arises, the thought of being free from applying oneself to the welfare of sentient beings,

original: gzhan gyi don la ro gcig pa ma yin pa'i lus kyi bya ba dang / sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa'i ngag dang / gzhan gyi don dang bral ba'i son pa dang / gzhan la phan pa @18b la stobs chung ba'i lus dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la ro gcig pa ma yin pa'i lus kyi bya ba dang / sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa'i ngag dang / gzhan gyi don dang bral ba'i son pa dang / gzhan la phan pa @18b la stobs chung ba'i lus dang /
translated: the physical action of not being of one taste with the welfare of others, speech that does not delight all sentient beings, the mind that is not of one taste with the welfare of others, the body that is weak in benefiting others,

original: gzhan la phan pa mi sems pa'i blo dang / sems can la phan par mi 'gyur ba'i rdzas dang / 'gro ba'i don spyod pa dang bral ba'i dbang che ba nyid dang / gzhan la 'tshe ba la dga' ba skye zhing skye bar ma gyur cig snyam pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa mi sems pa'i blo dang / sems can la phan par mi 'gyur ba'i rdzas dang / 'gro ba'i don spyod pa dang bral ba'i dbang che ba nyid dang / gzhan la 'tshe ba la dga' ba skye zhing skye bar ma gyur cig snyam pa dang /
translated: the mind that does not think of benefiting others, the substance that does not benefit sentient beings, the great power that is free from engaging in the welfare of the world, and the joy of harming others, may they never arise.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdig pa'i las kyi 'bras bu bdag la smin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / bdag gis legs par spyad pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu sems can thams cad la smin par gyur cig snyam pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdig pa'i las kyi 'bras bu bdag la smin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / bdag gis legs par spyad pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu sems can thams cad la smin par gyur cig snyam pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the thought: ‚ÄúMay the results of the evil actions of all sentient beings come to me, and may the results of all my good actions go to all sentient beings.

original: bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni gser bzang po lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni gser bzang po lta bu ste /
translated: The thought that is like good gold is the thought that is constant.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su rnam par 'gyur ba dang mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su rnam par 'gyur ba dang mi ldan pas so //
translated: The thought of benefit and happiness endowed with the six perfections is constant, because it does not change in the future and present.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And that is threefold:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / sems can rnams bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / sems can rnams bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: the thought of completing worship of the Tathagatas, the thought of purifying the field, and the thought of bringing happiness to sentient beings.

original: dang po la gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po la gnyis te /
translated: The first is twofold:

original: bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'o //
translated: with and without superior thought.

original: bla na yod pa ni gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'dul bar bya ba nye bar mi gnas pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ma mthong bas 'das pa dang / gang yang gdul bar bya ba rnams kyis mthong bar 'gyur bas da ltar ba dang //
analyzed: bla na yod pa ni gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'dul bar bya ba nye bar mi gnas pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ma mthong bas 'das pa dang / gang yang gdul bar bya ba rnams kyis mthong bar 'gyur bas da ltar ba dang //
translated: The highest worship is that which is not seen by others, because the Buddhas, the Lords of the ten directions, have entered Nirvana, since they are not present to convert; and that which is seen by those who are to be converted, because it is present.

original: gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur pas tshogs bsags pa myur du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa de rnams la bdag gis bla na med pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur pas tshogs bsags pa myur du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa de rnams la bdag gis bla na med pa'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: And that which is not yet present, because it is not yet fully enlightened, in order that those who have accumulated the equipment may quickly become fully enlightened.üîΩAnd for that purpose, I will worship with the highest worship, with images, with stupas, and in the sky.

original: yang de'i ched du sku gzugs dang / mchod rten dang / nam mkha' la yang mchod par bya'o snyam pa ni mchod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa bla na yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang de'i ched du sku gzugs dang / mchod rten dang / nam mkha' la yang mchod par bya'o snyam pa ni mchod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa bla na yod pa'o //
translated: This is the highest thought of perfect worship.

original: bla na med pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnams yongs su sgrub pa ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnams yongs su sgrub pa ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa ste /
translated: The unsurpassed is the practice of the thought of enlightenment and the ten perfections such as generosity.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa'o //üîΩzhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i bsam pa ni bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / 'bur ba dang / tsher @19a * //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bsam pa'o // zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i bsam pa ni bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / 'bur ba dang / tsher @19a * //
translated: The thought of perfecting them is the worship of practice.

original: ma dang ; gyo dum dang / bong pa dang / gcan gzan dang / rkun ma dang / mu ge dang / chu dang / nad kyi gnod pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: ma dang ; gyo dum dang / bong pa dang / gcan gzan dang / rkun ma dang / mu ge dang / chu dang / nad kyi gnod pa dang bral ba /
translated: The thought of purifying the field is the thought that one will have a Buddha-field free from high and low, from elevations and depressions, from thorns, potsherds, pebbles, wild beasts, thieves, famine, water, and disease,

original: mnyam pa rnam par dag pa lag pa'i mthil dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: mnyam pa rnam par dag pa lag pa'i mthil dang 'dra ba /
translated: even and pure like the palm of the hand,

original: ras bal gyi 'da' ba ltar 'jam pa /
analyzed: ras bal gyi 'da' ba ltar 'jam pa /
translated: soft like cotton-wool,

original: dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa dang ldan pa /
translated: with wish-granting trees, etc.,

original: ngan song gi g-yang sa dang bral ba /
analyzed: ngan song gi g-yang sa dang bral ba /
translated: free from the abysses of the unfortunate realms,

original: shel dang / aindra n'i la dang / bee d'u r+ya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur cig snyam pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: shel dang / aindra n'i la dang / bee d'u r+ya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur cig snyam pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought May they have the nature of crystal, sapphire, lapis lazuli, and so on.

original: sems can bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing der khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / ji snyed sems can gyi ris su gtogs pa thams cad ngan song du yod du zin kyang lha dang mi'i mchog tu gyur pa'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bde bar gyur cig snyam pa dang /
analyzed: sems can bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing der khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / ji snyed sems can gyi ris su gtogs pa thams cad ngan song du yod du zin kyang lha dang mi'i mchog tu gyur pa'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bde bar gyur cig snyam pa dang /
translated: The thought of bringing happiness to sentient beings is the thought, ‚ÄúMay all those included in the classes of sentient beings, in the realms, migrations, birthplaces, and however many there are, even if they are in the lower realms, have the happiness of the highest gods and humans, uninterrupted happiness.‚Äù

original: lus dang sems kyi nad dang bral ba dang / nye bar mkho ba gang dang gang gis de rnams la de lta bur bde ba'i nye bar mkho ba mngon par 'dod pa de dang de rnams bdag gi bde pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi nad dang bral ba dang / nye bar mkho ba gang dang gang gis de rnams la de lta bur bde ba'i nye bar mkho ba mngon par 'dod pa de dang de rnams bdag gi bde pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas 'byung ba dang /
translated: The thought of bringing benefit is the thought, ‚ÄúMay they be free from physical and mental illness, and by the ripening of my happy karma, may they obtain whatever they need, whatever they desire for such happiness.‚Äù

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba dang / de ltar de rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod du rung bar byas nas yid la 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs pa'i bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ldan par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa'o //üîΩlhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni zla ba tshes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba dang / de ltar de rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod du rung bar byas nas yid la 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs pa'i bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ldan par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa'o // lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni zla ba tshes pa lta bu ste /
translated: Having made them fit vessels for the Buddha qualities, he thinks, I will endow them with the unexcelled Buddha qualities, just as they desire.

original: des dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'phel bar byed pas so //
analyzed: des dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'phel bar byed pas so //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is like the moon in the first day of the lunar month, because it is the basis of the increase of the roots of virtue.

original: khyad par du rtogs pa'i phyir lhag par rtogs pa'i bsam pa yin pas na lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du rtogs pa'i phyir lhag par rtogs pa'i bsam pa yin pas na lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the thought of superior intention, because it is the superior understanding of the perfections.

original: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sems bskyed pa gsum pa'i gnas skabs su des byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par bya'o zhes pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'iüîΩbar du gsungs so //
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sems bskyed pa gsum pa'i gnas skabs su des byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par bya'o zhes pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom states that at the time of the third generation of the thought of enlightenment, one should cultivate the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, and so on, up to:üîΩone should cultivate the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: des na lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the thought of enlightenment which is accompanied by superior attitude is also a preparation.

original: gal te sngar sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i rjes la lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems skye bar brjod la /
analyzed: gal te sngar sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i rjes la lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems skye bar brjod la /
translated: If it is said that the thought of enlightenment which is accompanied by superior attitude arises after the preparation,

original: 'dir bshad pa'i dus su sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sngar lhag @19b pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa'i dus su sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sngar lhag @19b pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: why is it said here that the preparation is accompanied by superior attitude?

original: de la lan ni gnyis ka gnyis ka la yod par bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la lan ni gnyis ka gnyis ka la yod par bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The answer is: in order to show that both are present in both.

original: 'di ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur ba la yang sbyor ba yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur ba la yang sbyor ba yod la /
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with superior intention also has application.

original: sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa la yang lhag pa'i bsam pa yod pas so ;
analyzed: sbyor ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pa la yang lhag pa'i bsam pa yod pas so ;
translated: Thus, the superior attitude is present in one who is engaged, and engagement is present in one who has the superior attitude.

original: / des na sngar dang phyis mi 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: / des na sngar dang phyis mi 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the former is not the same as the latter.

original: de la sems bskyed pa gsum po de thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi gnas skabs dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa gsum po de thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi gnas skabs dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of generation of the Thought are the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, because they are associated with faith, vigor, mindfulness, samadhi, and wisdom that are conducive to liberation, and because they are the occasion of the wisdom that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: thar pa ni 'dir bral ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: thar pa ni 'dir bral ba'i khyad par te /
translated: Liberation is a special separation here,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: separation from the obscurations of afflictions and of the knowable.

original: de dang cha mthun pa ni thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dang cha mthun pa ni thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That which is conducive to it is that which is in accord with liberation.

original: gsum po de la las dang po pa'i sa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: gsum po de la las dang po pa'i sa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: These three are also called the level of the beginner.

original: sa'i sgras shes pa khyad par can ston la /
analyzed: sa'i sgras shes pa khyad par can ston la /
translated: The term level indicates a special consciousness.

original: des na las dang po pa thog mar 'jug pa rnams kyi shes pa gsum mo zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na las dang po pa thog mar 'jug pa rnams kyi shes pa gsum mo zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, they are called the three consciousnesses of beginners who are initially engaged.

original: tshogs kyi lam zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: They are also called the path of accumulation.

original: 'di'i gnas skabs na thar pa thob par byed pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshogs yod pas na tshogs kyi lam ste /
analyzed: 'di'i gnas skabs na thar pa thob par byed pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshogs yod pas na tshogs kyi lam ste /
translated: Since the accumulation of ethics and so on that cause the attainment of liberation exist on this level, it is called the path of accumulation.üîΩThus, since ethics and so on are perfected, the cause of seeing the four truths in one's mindstream through the stages of heat and so on and the cause of abandoning their obscurations is obtained.

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pas dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rang gi rgyud la bden pa mthong ba dang / de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu rung ba thob pa nyid yin pas tshul khrims la sogs pa la tshogs kyi lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pas dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rang gi rgyud la bden pa mthong ba dang / de'i sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu rung ba thob pa nyid yin pas tshul khrims la sogs pa la tshogs kyi lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore ethics and so on are called the path of accumulation.

original: des na chos mngon pa mdzod las tshogs kyi lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: des na chos mngon pa mdzod las tshogs kyi lam gang zhe na /
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa declares: What is the path of accumulation?

original: so so'i skye bo'i tshul khrims dang / dbang po sbas pa'i sgo nyid dang / kha zas tshod shes pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la gnyid mi log pa dang / shes bzhin la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i tshul khrims dang / dbang po sbas pa'i sgo nyid dang / kha zas tshod shes pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la gnyid mi log pa dang / shes bzhin la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The morality of ordinary people, the guarding of the sense-doors, moderation in eating, not sleeping in the first or last part of the night, and the practice of vigilance.

original: de la rma med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims ni so so'i skye bo'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la rma med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims ni so so'i skye bo'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Among them, the morality of ordinary people is the pure morality endowed with the qualities of being without wounds, etc.

original: de las 'das pa la ltos pa'i sred pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa dang / da lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sred pa khyad par gyis 'bigs par mi nus pas rma med pa'i tshul khrims so /
analyzed: de las 'das pa la ltos pa'i sred pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa dang / da lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sred pa khyad par gyis 'bigs par mi nus pas rma med pa'i tshul khrims so /
translated: It is the morality without wounds, because craving for the past and future, and craving for attachment to the present, cannot pierce it.

original: @20a * // ltung ba kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: @20a * // ltung ba kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ma nyams pa'o //
translated: It is the morality without deterioration, because one does not commit any transgressions.

original: bslab pa gcig kyang nyams pa med pa'i phyir mi dma' ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gcig kyang nyams pa med pa'i phyir mi dma' ba'o //
translated: It is the morality without decline, because one does not let any of the precepts decline.

original: mi dge ba dang ma 'dres pas ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang ma 'dres pas ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is the morality without mixture, because it is not mixed with the non-virtuous.

original: srid pa'i longs spyod kyi don du yongs su ma bsdos pas ma sbags pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i longs spyod kyi don du yongs su ma bsdos pas ma sbags pa'o //
translated: It is not defiled by not being completely dedicated to the enjoyments of existence.

original: de lta bu dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshogs kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni tshogs kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Morality endowed with these qualities is included in the path of equipment.

original: de yang slob dpon dpa' bos /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon dpa' bos /
translated: Moreover, the master Vira declares:

original: lus dang ngag las yid las sdom pa gang //
analyzed: lus dang ngag las yid las sdom pa gang //
translated: Whatever restraint there is of body, speech, and mind,

original: mdor na 'dir ni tshul khrims yin par gsungs //
analyzed: mdor na 'dir ni tshul khrims yin par gsungs //
translated: in brief, that is morality here.

original: 'di la gnas pa'i 'gro la phan don du //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa'i 'gro la phan don du //
translated: For the sake of the welfare of beings who abide in this,

original: bsam pa'i khyad par 'bras bu bcas par 'gyur ;üîΩ/ zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par 'bras bu bcas par 'gyur ; / zhes gsungs so //
translated: the distinctive thought and its fruit will come to be.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims byang chub kyi tshogs su bstan no //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims byang chub kyi tshogs su bstan no //
translated: By this he shows that morality is a requisite for enlightenment.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar gnod pa'i gnyen por mig la sogs pa'i dbang po sbas pa'i sgo nyid bstan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar gnod pa'i gnyen por mig la sogs pa'i dbang po sbas pa'i sgo nyid bstan no //
translated: The remedy for the harm of discursive thought is the very concealment of the doors of the sense faculties of the eye, etc.

original: rten las su mi rung ba'i gnyen por zas tshod zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rten las su mi rung ba'i gnyen por zas tshod zin pa nyid do //
translated: The remedy for the unserviceability of the basis is the very moderation in eating.

original: 'di ltar zas nyung bar zos na rten nyam chung bas spro ba med pa dang / zas lhag par zos na gnyid la sogs pa'i skyon kun du spyod pa la rten las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zas nyung bar zos na rten nyam chung bas spro ba med pa dang / zas lhag par zos na gnyid la sogs pa'i skyon kun du spyod pa la rten las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: If one eats too much food, one is not fit for action because of the fault of sleepiness, etc.

original: des na rten las su mi rung ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po zas tshod zin par bstan to //
analyzed: des na rten las su mi rung ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po zas tshod zin par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the remedy for the harm of unfitness of the basis is taught as moderation in eating.

original: mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnyen por nam gyi cha stod cha smad la gnyid mi log par bstan no //
analyzed: mngon par mi brtson pa'i gnyen por nam gyi cha stod cha smad la gnyid mi log par bstan no //
translated: The remedy for lack of effort is taught as not sleeping in the first or last part of the night.

original: 'gyod pa'i nye bar gnod pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin la gnas par bstan no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i nye bar gnod pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin la gnas par bstan no //
translated: The remedy for the harm of regret is taught as abiding in vigilance.

original: de la sems bskyed pa dang po na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa dang po na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms la /
translated: In the first production of the thought, one cultivates the applications of mindfulness.

original: gnyis pa na yang dag par spong ba /
analyzed: gnyis pa na yang dag par spong ba /
translated: In the second, the right efforts.

original: gsum pa na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o//
analyzed: gsum pa na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o//
translated: In the third, the bases of psychic power.

original: de yang dran pa'i stobs kyis nye bar gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: de yang dran pa'i stobs kyis nye bar gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'am /
translated: Moreover, since one abides by the power of mindfulness, it is the application of mindfulness.

original: yang na 'dis dran pa nye bar gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dis dran pa nye bar gnas pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the establishment of mindfulness because it causes mindfulness to be present.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rnam gzhag lnga ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la rnam gzhag lnga ste /
translated: There are five topics in the establishment of mindfulness:

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: object, nature, companion, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: de la dmigs pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos so //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos so //
translated: The object is the body, feelings, thought, and entities.

original: ci'i phyir dmigs pa'i rnam gzhag bzhi yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dmigs pa'i rnam gzhag bzhi yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there four topics of the object?

original: lan ni byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams kyis sems kyi rang bzhin gyis bdag dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rten la brten nas @20b bde ba la sogs pa nye bar longs spyod cing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos kyis kun nas nyon mongs
analyzed: lan ni byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams kyis sems kyi rang bzhin gyis bdag dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rten la brten nas @20b bde ba la sogs pa nye bar longs spyod cing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos kyis kun nas nyon mongs
translated: The answer is that foolish people with perverted minds imagine that the nature of mind, in dependence on the support of the body with faculties, experiences pleasure and so on, and that it is defiled by the phenomena of attachment and so on,

original: pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i chos kyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro snyam du rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i chos kyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro snyam du rnam par rtog go //
translated: and that it is purified by the phenomena of faith and so on.

original: des na dang por bdag gi rkyen gyi dngos por lus dang / bdag gis longs spyod par bya ba'i dngos por tshor ba dang / sems kyi rang bzhin gyis bdag dang / bdag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po'i chos yang dag par yongs su spyad pa'i don du dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na dang por bdag gi rkyen gyi dngos por lus dang / bdag gis longs spyod par bya ba'i dngos por tshor ba dang / sems kyi rang bzhin gyis bdag dang / bdag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po'i chos yang dag par yongs su spyad pa'i don du dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the four kinds of objects should be understood as follows: the body is the condition for the self; feeling is the object of enjoyment for the self; the mind is the nature of the self; and the dharmas are the objects of the self‚Äôs defilement and purification.

original: ngo bo rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ngo bo rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The essence is twofold:

original: shes rab dang dran pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa'o //
translated: wisdom and mindfulness.

original: grogs ni shes rab dang dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: grogs ni shes rab dang dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The associates are the mind and mental factors such as feeling, which are concomitant with wisdom and mindfulness.

original: de la sgom pa ni nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dang / phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dang / phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la sgom pa ni nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dang / phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dang / phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: The cultivation is the observation of the internal body, the observation of the external body, and the observation of the internal and external body.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same is to be applied to feeling, etc.

original: de la nang gi lus gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi lus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal body?

original: gang 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched gzugs can mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: gang 'di la nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched gzugs can mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po ste /
translated: It is the internal sense-spheres of form, namely, the eye, ear, nose, tongue and body.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pas so //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pas so //
translated: It is included in the internal sense-spheres and is counted as a living being.

original: phyi'i lus gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i lus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the external body?

original: phyi'i gzugs can gyi skye mched gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs can gyi skye mched gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the external sense-spheres of form, namely, visible form, sound, odor, taste and tactility.

original: phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pas so //
translated: It is included in the external sense-spheres and is not counted as a living being.
