original: phyi nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the internal and external body?

original: nang gi skye mched kyi bdag nyid dang 'brel pa phyi'i skye mched dbang po'i rten gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched kyi bdag nyid dang 'brel pa phyi'i skye mched dbang po'i rten gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the external sense-spheres of form, namely, visible form, sound, odor, taste and tactility, which are related to the internal sense-spheres and are the basis of the sense faculties.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched dang 'brel pa yin pas sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang po'i yul yin pas phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin pas so //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched dang 'brel pa yin pas sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang po'i yul yin pas phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin pas so //
translated: It is included in the internal sense bases because it is related to the internal sense bases, and it is included in the external sense bases because it is the object of the external sense bases.

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nang gi bdag nyid skye mched gzugs can mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyang nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nang gi bdag nyid skye mched gzugs can mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyang nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Moreover, the physical sense bases that are included in another‚Äôs stream of consciousness, such as the eye faculty, are form that is included in the internal and external sense bases.

original: rang gi rgyud la ltos nas nang yin la /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la ltos nas nang yin la /
translated: They are internal in relation to one‚Äôs own stream of consciousness,

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la ltos nas phyi'i gzugs yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la ltos nas phyi'i gzugs yin pas so //
translated: but they are external form in relation to another‚Äôs stream of consciousness.

original: @21a * // lus kyi rjes su lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: @21a * // lus kyi rjes su lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the observation of the body?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus dang / rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus dag pa mnyam pa nyid du lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus dang / rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus dag pa mnyam pa nyid du lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the observation of the body as an image of conceptualization and as the natural body, as being the same in sameness.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang nas rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus nges pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang nas rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus nges pa ste /
translated: The body of the reflection of conceptualization is seen, and then the natural body is ascertained.

original: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste /
translated: It is empty of the nature of wisdom.

original: mthong ba gang yin pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba gang yin pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúwhat is seen.‚Äù

original: nang gi tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is internal feeling?

original: nang gi lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
translated: Feeling that arises in dependence on the internal body.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la brten nas sam dmigs nas 'byung bas so //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la brten nas sam dmigs nas 'byung bas so //
translated: It arises in dependence on the internal sense bases such as the eyes.

original: phyi'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is external feeling?

original: phyi'i lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: phyi'i lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
translated: Feeling that arises in dependence on the external body.

original: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas 'byung bas so //
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs nas 'byung bas so //
translated: It arises in dependence on external form and so on.

original: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is internal and external feeling?

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i tshor ba ste /
translated: Feeling that arises in dependence on the internal and external body.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dbang po'i rten dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa la dmigs nas byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dbang po'i rten dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa la dmigs nas byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is any feeling that arises in dependence on the faculties that are in one‚Äôs own continuum, or that arises in dependence on the eyes, etc. that are in another‚Äôs continuum.

original: tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The contemplation of feelings is the insight that they are empty of the nature of wisdom.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sems ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa la brten nas sam dmigs nas byung ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sems ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa la brten nas sam dmigs nas byung ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: The internal mind is the mind that arises in dependence on the eyes, etc. that are internal to one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: phyi'i bdag nyid kyi sems ni phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched la dmigs nas byung ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i bdag nyid kyi sems ni phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched la dmigs nas byung ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: The external mind is the mind that arises in dependence on the external sense-spheres of form, etc.

original: nang dang phyi'i sems ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po'i rten dang / gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po la dmigs nas byung ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i sems ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po'i rten dang / gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po la dmigs nas byung ba'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: The internal-external mind is the mind that arises in dependence on the faculties that are in one‚Äôs own continuum, and on the faculties that are in another‚Äôs continuum.

original: sems kyi rjes su lta ba ni ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su lta ba ni ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The contemplation of the mind is the insight that the nature of consciousness is empty.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa la brten nas sam dmigs nas 'byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa la brten nas sam dmigs nas 'byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The contemplation of internal phenomena is the insight that the perceptions and so forth that arise in dependence on the internal eyes and so forth are empty.

original: phyi'i bdag nyid kyi chos ni phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas 'byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i bdag nyid kyi chos ni phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas 'byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The contemplation of external phenomena is the insight that the perceptions and so forth that arise in dependence on external forms and so forth are empty.

original: phyi dang nang gi chos ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po'i rten dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i dbang po la dmigs nas @21b byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi chos ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i dbang po'i rten dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i dbang po la dmigs nas @21b byung ba'i 'du shes la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The contemplation of internal and external phenomena is the insight that the perceptions and so forth that arise in dependence on the sense faculties of one‚Äôs own continuum and the sense faculties of others are empty.

original: chos kyi rjes su lta ba ni chos gang yin pa de shes rab kyis ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su lta ba ni chos gang yin pa de shes rab kyis ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The contemplation of phenomena is the insight that the nature of any phenomenon is empty of inherent nature.

original: yang bsgom pa ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / rtsol ba dang / spro ba dang / ma than pa dang / phyir nur ba med pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa'i sgom pa'o //
analyzed: yang bsgom pa ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / rtsol ba dang / spro ba dang / ma than pa dang / phyir nur ba med pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa'i sgom pa'o //
translated: Moreover, meditation is the meditation of aspiration, of striving, of effort, of enthusiasm, of non-remorse, of non-retrogression, of mindfulness, of full awareness, and of non-complacency.

original: de la yid la mi byed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'dun pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: de la yid la mi byed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'dun pa bsgom ste /
translated: Of these, the meditation of aspiration is the antidote to the minor defilement of non-exertion.

original: ngas 'di bya'o snyam pa'i rtsom pa'i brtson 'grus kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la yid la mi byed pa mi 'jug pas so //
analyzed: ngas 'di bya'o snyam pa'i rtsom pa'i brtson 'grus kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la yid la mi byed pa mi 'jug pas so //
translated: For non-exertion does not occur in the application of mindfulness of the striving of undertaking, thinking, ‚ÄúI must do this.‚Äù

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa le lo'i gnyen por brtson 'grus bsgom ste //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa le lo'i gnyen por brtson 'grus bsgom ste //
translated: The meditation of striving is the antidote to the minor defilement of laziness.

original: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi le lor ldog par 'gyur bas so //üîΩnye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen por rtsol ba bsgom ste //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi le lor ldog par 'gyur bas so // nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang rgod pa'i gnyen por rtsol ba bsgom ste //
translated: For laziness is overcome by the striving of application.üîΩThe meditation of effort is the antidote to the minor defilements of depression and excitement.

original: skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bying ba dang / rgod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis bying ba dang / rgod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: For depression and excitement are calmed by the striving of non-discouragement.

original: de la rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi zil gyis mnan pas sems kyi rgyu ba mi gsal ba yin pas sems bying ba'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi zil gyis mnan pas sems kyi rgyu ba mi gsal ba yin pas sems bying ba'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is a lack of clarity of mental activity due to being overcome by lethargy and sleep, it should be understood as ‚Äúmental sinking. ‚Äù

original: sngar nyams su myong ba'i yul 'dod pas bar bar du sems gzhan du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: sngar nyams su myong ba'i yul 'dod pas bar bar du sems gzhan du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rgod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Mental excitement‚Äù is the intermittent engagement of the mind with other things due to longing for previously experienced objects.

original: de de gnyis zhi ba ni rab tu dga' bar byed pa sangs rgyas kyi sku yid la byed pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgom pas so //
analyzed: de de gnyis zhi ba ni rab tu dga' bar byed pa sangs rgyas kyi sku yid la byed pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgom pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Pacification of those two‚Äù is the mental attention to the body of the Buddha, which causes delight, and the meditation on impermanence, etc.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sems zhum pa'i gnyen por spro ba bsgom ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sems zhum pa'i gnyen por spro ba bsgom ste /
translated: ‚Äú Meditation on enthusiasm‚Äù is the antidote to the secondary affliction of mental sinking.

original: thabs kyi brtson 'grus kyis sems zhum pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs kyi brtson 'grus kyis sems zhum pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Mental sinking is pacified by the enthusiasm of skillful means.

original: sems zhum pa ni khyad par rtogs pa'i ched du bdag nyid smad pa'i sgo nas sems zhum pa skye ba'o ;
analyzed: sems zhum pa ni khyad par rtogs pa'i ched du bdag nyid smad pa'i sgo nas sems zhum pa skye ba'o ;
translated: Mental sinking arises from self-contempt in order to realize the distinction.

original: / de zhi ba ni sbrang bu sha sbrang la sogs pas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob na snyam pa'i don yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: / de zhi ba ni sbrang bu sha sbrang la sogs pas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob na snyam pa'i don yid la byed pas so //
translated: Its pacification is by mental attention to the fact that even a gadfly can attain buddhahood.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnod pas yongs su skyo ba'i gnyen por ma than pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnod pas yongs su skyo ba'i gnyen por ma than pa bsgom ste /
translated: The antidote to the secondary defilement of being wearied by harm is the cultivation of patience.

original: gnod pas yongs su skyo ba ni sha sbrang dang mchu rings la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba mi bzod pa'o ;
analyzed: gnod pas yongs su skyo ba ni sha sbrang dang mchu rings la sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba mi bzod pa'o ;
translated: Being wearied by harm is the inability to tolerate the harmfulness of flies, mosquitoes, etc.

original: / de'i gnyen por ma than pa ste bzod pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i gnyen por ma than pa ste bzod pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is patience.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por phyir nur ba med par bsgom ste /
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por phyir nur ba med par bsgom ste /
translated: The antidote to the secondary defilement of being satisfied with a little is the cultivation of non-regression.

original: cung zad kyis chog par 'dzin pa ni gnyen po 'di tsam gyis chog gi gzhan mi dgos so zhes pa'o //üîΩgdams ngag brjed @22a * //üîΩpa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por dran pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: cung zad kyis chog par 'dzin pa ni gnyen po 'di tsam gyis chog gi gzhan mi dgos so zhes pa'o // gdams ngag brjed @22a * // pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por dran pa bsgom mo //
translated: Being satisfied with a little is thinking that this much of an antidote is sufficient and that nothing else is necessary.üîΩThe antidote to the secondary defilement of forgetting the instruction is the cultivation of mindfulness.

original: ltung ba yid la gcags pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin bsgom ste /
analyzed: ltung ba yid la gcags pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin bsgom ste /
translated: The antidote to the secondary defilement of regretting a downfall is the cultivation of vigilance.

original: ltung ba yid la gcags pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa shes bzhin pa yin par spyod pas bslab pa las 'das pa sngon du 'gro ba can 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yid la gcags pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa shes bzhin pa yin par spyod pas bslab pa las 'das pa sngon du 'gro ba can 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret for a transgression is remorse that is preceded by a transgression of the precepts, and is a form of introspection that is aware of going and returning.

original: brtson pa 'dor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por bag yod pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: brtson pa 'dor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por bag yod pa bsgom ste /
translated: One cultivates heedfulness as the counteragent to the secondary defilement of abandoning striving.

original: brtson pa 'dor ba ni bag med pa'i skyon gyis ji lta ba bzhin du brtsams pa'i dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la sogs pa mi sgrub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa 'dor ba ni bag med pa'i skyon gyis ji lta ba bzhin du brtsams pa'i dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la sogs pa mi sgrub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Abandoning striving is the failure to accomplish the application, etc., to the wholesome side that one has undertaken, due to the fault of heedlessness.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni phyin ci log spong ba dang / bden pa la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni phyin ci log spong ba dang / bden pa la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The result of cultivation is the abandonment of erroneous inversion, the entry into the truths and the freedom from the body, etc.

original: de la kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lus mi sdug par bsgoms pas gtsang bar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spong ngo //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lus mi sdug par bsgoms pas gtsang bar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spong ngo //
translated: In this respect, through the application of the mindfulness of the body, one cultivates the body as being ugly and thereby abandons the grasping at what is impure as being pure.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bde bar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spong ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bde bar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spong ste /
translated: Through the application of the mindfulness of the feelings, one abandons the grasping at what is painful as being pleasurable.

original: gang cung zad tshor ba de sdug bsngal gsum gyis sdug bsngal ba'o zhes shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad tshor ba de sdug bsngal gsum gyis sdug bsngal ba'o zhes shes pa'o //
translated: Whatever is felt is suffering because of the three kinds of suffering.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas rtag par phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spong ste /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas rtag par phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa spong ste /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mind eliminates the false notion of permanence,

original: rten mig la sogs pa dang / dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pas skad cig ma so so la rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid du shes pas so //
analyzed: rten mig la sogs pa dang / dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pas skad cig ma so so la rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid du shes pas so //
translated: because one knows that the mind is momentary, since the basis, i.e., the eye, etc., and the objective supports, i.e., form, etc., are different, and because consciousness is different in each moment.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bdag tu phyin ci log 'dzin pa spongs pa ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bdag tu phyin ci log 'dzin pa spongs pa ste /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mental qualities eliminates the false notion of self,

original: bdag dang bral ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba tsam mo zhes shes pas so //
analyzed: bdag dang bral ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba tsam mo zhes shes pas so //
translated: because one knows that there is only defilement and purification without a self.

original: gzhan yang bden pa la 'jug pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bden pa la 'jug pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Moreover, these applications of mindfulness are the results of the truths.

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the body is the result of the truth of suffering,üîΩbecause the body is the basis of suffering.

original: phal cher 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can gnas ngan len dang lus ldan par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: phal cher 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can gnas ngan len dang lus ldan par rtogs pas so //
translated: It is realized that the characteristic of the suffering of conditionality is the possession of the body of negative conditioning.

original: de la 'du byed ni dngos po skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed ni dngos po skye ba'o //
translated: Conditioning is the arising of entities.

original: de yang don dam ma yin pa thams cad kyi gnas yin pas gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: de yang don dam ma yin pa thams cad kyi gnas yin pas gnas ngan len no //
translated: And since it is the basis of all that is not ultimate, it is negative conditioning.

original: 'phags pa rnams dang rjes su mi mthun pas sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams dang rjes su mi mthun pas sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: And since it is not in accord with the noble ones, it is suffering.

original: de yang ji ltar /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar /
translated: And how is that?

original: don med pa yi skye ba 'di //
analyzed: don med pa yi skye ba 'di //
translated: This birth is meaningless.

original: skye ba yod na dgra yod do //
analyzed: skye ba yod na dgra yod do //
translated: If there is birth, there is an enemy.

original: rga dang 'chi dang nad dang phongs //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi dang nad dang phongs //
translated: Aging, death, sickness, and poverty,

original: gsod dang 'ching ba la @22b sogs pa //
analyzed: gsod dang 'ching ba la @22b sogs pa //
translated: Killing, binding, and so forth,

original: gal te don med skye med na //
analyzed: gal te don med skye med na //
translated: If there were no meaningless birth,

original: 'jigs pa de ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jigs pa de ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: Those fears would not occur.

original: nags kyi me dang rlung dag la //
analyzed: nags kyi me dang rlung dag la //
translated: In the case of forest fires and winds,

original: ma skyes pa yi shing mi ltung //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yi shing mi ltung //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: Trees that have not arisen do not fall.

original: des na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis lus sdug bsngal ba nyid du mthong bas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis lus sdug bsngal ba nyid du mthong bas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by seeing the body as suffering through the suffering of conditioned states, one enters into the truth of suffering through the application of the mindfulness of the body.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug pa ste //
translated: One enters into the truth of origination through the application of the mindfulness of feeling.

original: tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa ni ldan pa la sogs pa'i srid pa'i rten yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa ni ldan pa la sogs pa'i srid pa'i rten yin te /
translated: Pleasant, etc., feeling is the basis of existence, i.e., of the possession of, etc.

original: de ltar tshor ba bde ba bde ba dang ldan pa dang mi 'bral ba'i sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba bde ba bde ba dang ldan pa dang mi 'bral ba'i sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, pleasant feeling is the cause of craving for the possession of pleasure and for non-separation from it.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal sdug bsngal dang mi ldan pa dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal sdug bsngal dang mi ldan pa dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sred pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Unpleasant feeling is the cause of craving for the non-possession of suffering and for separation from it.

original: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gnas skabs de la mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gnas skabs de la mngon par dga' ba'i srid pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling is the cause of craving for the delight in that state.

original: des na tshor ba'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam par dpyad na kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: des na tshor ba'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam par dpyad na kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, by analyzing feeling from the point of view of its result, one enters into the truth of origination.

original: mdo las / kun 'byung gi bden pa gang zhe na //üîΩsred pa dang yang srid pa dang // len pa la 'dun pa /
analyzed: mdo las / kun 'byung gi bden pa gang zhe na // sred pa dang yang srid pa dang // len pa la 'dun pa /
translated: What is the truth of origination?

original: dga' ba 'dod chags dang lhan cig tu gyur pa de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba 'dod chags dang lhan cig tu gyur pa de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: It is craving, which is accompanied by pleasure and passion, relishing the pleasures of this and that.

original: zhes gsungs pas sred pa kun 'byung gi bden par bstan no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas sred pa kun 'byung gi bden par bstan no //
translated: Thus craving is taught to be the truth of origination.

original: de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, through the close placement of mindfulness of feeling, one enters the truth of origination.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa ste /üîΩbdag med pa'i rnal 'byor par shes pa tsam phyis 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du mthong bas bdag chad par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa ste / bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor par shes pa tsam phyis 'byung ba ma yin no snyam du mthong bas bdag chad par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa med pa ste /
translated: Through the close placement of mindfulness of mind, one enters the truth of cessation.

original: de ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la spyad pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ldog la /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la spyad pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ldog la /
translated: Thus, through the practice of impermanence and so on, one stops conceiving a self.

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes kyang skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes kyang skye'o //
translated: And the idea of suffering arises.

original: des na bdag chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal tsam 'chad pa yin pas 'gog pa'i bden pa zhi ba nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: des na bdag chad par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal tsam 'chad pa yin pas 'gog pa'i bden pa zhi ba nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, since there is no fear of the annihilation of the self and since there is the mere cessation of suffering, one sees the truth of cessation as peace.

original: des na 'gog pa la skrag pa med pas sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'gog pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'gog pa la skrag pa med pas sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas 'gog pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, since one is not afraid of cessation, one enters into cessation through the application of mindfulness to the mind.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: One enters into the truth of the path through the application of mindfulness to the dharmas.

original: mi mthun pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa @23a * //üîΩspong ba'i don du gnyen po'i chos rnam par byang ba brten pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa @23a * // spong ba'i don du gnyen po'i chos rnam par byang ba brten pa ste /
translated: The path is the antidote to the dharmas that are adverse,üîΩi.e., to the afflictions.

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the dharmas that are adverse are the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa mi sdug pa dang / byams pa la sogs pa dang ; dngos po med par bsgom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa mi sdug pa dang / byams pa la sogs pa dang ; dngos po med par bsgom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dharmas that are purifying are the antidotes to those, i.e., the meditation on foulness, love, etc., and the meditation on non-existence, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i ngo bor rtogs nas nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad shin tu spangs pa'i thabs yin no snyam nas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i ngo bor rtogs nas nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad shin tu spangs pa'i thabs yin no snyam nas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having realized that those addictions and their opposites are the essence of the resistances and the remedies, one enters the truth of the path, thinking that it is the means of completely abandoning all injuries.

original: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, by the application of mindfulness to the teaching, one enters the truth of the path.

original: yang 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu lus la sogs pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu lus la sogs pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the result of these is the separation from the body, etc.

original: stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas lus la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa med pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas lus la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa med pas so //
translated: Because, by the cultivation of the application of mindfulness to the body, etc. through the door of emptiness, one is not attached to the body, etc.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yang lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yang lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: And the result of the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is the separation from the body, etc.

original: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la yang dag par spong ba sgom pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la yang dag par spong ba sgom pa ste /
translated: In the second production of the thought, one cultivates the correct exertions.

original: gang gi phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i chos yongs su shes pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po'i chos 'phel bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i chos yongs su shes pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / gnyen po'i chos 'phel bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Because, by means of the application of mindfulness to the factors of existence, one understands the factors of existence that are adverse and the factors of existence that are remedial, therefore, in order to abandon the adverse and to increase the remedial, one exerts vigour.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rjes la yang dag par spong ba sgom pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rjes la yang dag par spong ba sgom pa'o //
translated: After the application of mindfulness, the cultivation of the correct exertions is mentioned in regard to the undertaking of vigour.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams la yang rnam gzhag lnga ste /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams la yang rnam gzhag lnga ste /
translated: There are five topics in regard to the correct exertions:

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang ; bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang ; bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: object, nature, friend, cultivation and fruit of cultivation.

original: de la dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Herein, the object is the adverse and the remedial, whether arisen or not.

original: de la dang po'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa ste /
translated: Of these, the object of the first is the adverse element that has arisen,

original: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i don du 'dun pa skyes bas so ;
analyzed: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i don du 'dun pa skyes bas so ;
translated: because it is the cause of the generation of will for the abandonment of the evil, unwholesome factors that have arisen.

original: / gnyis pa'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: / gnyis pa'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa ste /
translated: The object of the second is the non-arising of the adverse,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i don du 'dun pa bskyed pas so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i don du 'dun pa bskyed pas so //
translated: because one generates will for the non-arising of evil, unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: gsum pa'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po'i chos ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po'i chos ma skyes pa ste /
translated: The object of the third is the non-arising of the antidote dharma,

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i don du 'dun pa @23b bskyed pas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i don du 'dun pa @23b bskyed pas so //
translated: because one generates will for the arising of wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: bzhi ba'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po'i chos skyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi ba'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po'i chos skyes pa rnams te /
translated: The object of the fourth is the arising of the antidote dharma,

original: des dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams bstan pa'i don du 'dun pa bskyed pas so //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams bstan pa'i don du 'dun pa bskyed pas so //
translated: because one generates will for the maintenance of wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: ngo bo ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: ngo bo ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The essence is vigor.

original: grogs ni brtson 'grus dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so ;
analyzed: grogs ni brtson 'grus dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so ;
translated: The aid is the mind and mental factors associated with vigor.

original: / bsgom pa ni 'dun pa bskyed do //
analyzed: / bsgom pa ni 'dun pa bskyed do //
translated: Cultivation is the generation of will.

original: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One strives, exerts vigor,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to //
translated: holds the mind in check,

original: yang dag par 'jog go zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog go zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and rightly establishes it.

original: 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi brtson 'grus bsgom pa gnas dang bcas pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi brtson 'grus bsgom pa gnas dang bcas pa brjod do //
translated: The words ‚Äúarousing zeal‚Äù and so on express the cultivation of effort together with its basis.

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi gnas ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi gnas ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: Among them, zeal is the basis of effort.

original: 'dun pa sngon du 'gro ba can brtson 'grus yin pas so //üîΩ'bad pa ni zhig gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa sngon du 'gro ba can brtson 'grus yin pas so // 'bad pa ni zhig gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Because effort is preceded by zeal.üîΩExertion is the mental attention to the signs of serenity, full attention, and equanimity.

original: gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas skyon dang bral ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa de'i tshe 'bad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas skyon dang bral ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa de'i tshe 'bad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When one cultivates the antidote free from faults by means of mental attention to the signs of serenity, full attention, and equanimity, then it is called exertion.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lhag mthong bsgoms pas shes rab phul du byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe zhi gnas shas chung ba'i phyir rlung gi nang na gnas pa'i mar me bzhin du sems rab tu g-yo bas de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar mthong bar mi
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lhag mthong bsgoms pas shes rab phul du byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe zhi gnas shas chung ba'i phyir rlung gi nang na gnas pa'i mar me bzhin du sems rab tu g-yo bas de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar mthong bar mi
translated: Thus, when through cultivating insight, wisdom becomes outstanding, then, because calm abiding is weak, the mind is very unsteady, like a lamp in the wind, and one does not clearly see reality.

original: 'gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o //
translated: At that time, one should attend to the causal signs of calm abiding.

original: gang gi tshe zhi gnas lhag par gyur pas skyes bu gnyid log pa bzhin du de kho na nyid gsal bar mi mthong ba de'i tshe rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi gnas lhag par gyur pas skyes bu gnyid log pa bzhin du de kho na nyid gsal bar mi mthong ba de'i tshe rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o //
translated: When calm abiding predominates, one does not clearly see reality, like a sleeping person. At that time, one should attend to the causal signs of full attention.

original: gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rang gi ngang gi 'jug pa de'i tshe btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rang gi ngang gi 'jug pa de'i tshe btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o //
translated: When calm abiding and insight function naturally, at that time one should attend to the causal signs of equanimity.

original: de ltar gnyen po bsgom pa la 'bad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyen po bsgom pa la 'bad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should strive to cultivate the antidotes.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa sel ba'i don du rtsom pa gang yin pa de la brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa sel ba'i don du rtsom pa gang yin pa de la brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is undertaken for the purpose of eliminating laxity and excitement is called the undertaking of effort.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa byid pa skye bas de bsal ba'i don du dang ba skye ba'i rgyu sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la sogs pa yid la byed pas sems gzengs bstod pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgod pa skyes na 'khor ba la yid byung ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa na nang gi bdag nyid du bsdus pa'i sgo nas sems 'dzin par byed pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa byid pa skye bas de bsal ba'i don du dang ba skye ba'i rgyu sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la sogs pa yid la byed pas sems gzengs bstod pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgod pa skyes na 'khor ba la yid byung ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa na nang gi bdag nyid du bsdus pa'i sgo nas sems 'dzin par byed pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, when laxity arises as a secondary affliction, in order to eliminate it, one should uplift the mind by attending to the causes of clarity, such as images of the Buddha, etc. When excitement arises as a secondary affliction, one should focus the mind internally by attending to the things that cause disgust with cyclic existence. At that time, it is called the undertaking of effort.

original: @24a * // de nyid kyi phyir bying ba dang rgod pa spang ba'i thabs mi spong ba'i don du sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: @24a * // de nyid kyi phyir bying ba dang rgod pa spang ba'i thabs mi spong ba'i don du sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should focus the mind and correctly stabilize it in order to eliminate the means of eliminating laxity and excitement.

original: 'bras bu ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa 'grib pa dang gnyen po thob pa dang 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa 'grib pa dang gnyen po thob pa dang 'phel ba'o //
translated: The result is the decrease of all adverse factors, the attainment of the counteragent, and the increase of the latter.

original: de la yang dag par spong ba dang po dang / gnyis pa'i 'bras bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par 'grib pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par spong ba dang po dang / gnyis pa'i 'bras bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par 'grib pa ste /
translated: The result of the first and second right efforts is the decrease of all adverse factors.

original: de dag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams rab tu spong bas so //
analyzed: de dag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams rab tu spong bas so //
translated: By means of them one abandons the evil unwholesome factors that have arisen and those that have not yet arisen.

original: gsum pa'i 'bras bu ni gnyen po thob pa ste des dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pas so ;
analyzed: gsum pa'i 'bras bu ni gnyen po thob pa ste des dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pas so ;
translated: The result of the third is the attainment of the counteragent, because by means of it one generates the wholesome factors that have not yet arisen.

original: / bzhi pa'i 'bras bu ni gnyen po 'phel ba ste /
analyzed: / bzhi pa'i 'bras bu ni gnyen po 'phel ba ste /
translated: The result of the fourth is the increase of the counteragent.

original: des dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams rgyas par byed pas so //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams rgyas par byed pas so //
translated: By means of it one causes the wholesome factors that have arisen to increase.

original: sems bskyed pa gsum pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gsum pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should cultivate the third production of the thought, the four bases of supernormal power.

original: gang gi phyir brtson 'grus brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtson 'grus brtsams te /
translated: Because one should generate the four bases of supernormal power after having begun striving.

original: sems gnas par gyur pas don thams cad 'grub par rung ba'i mtshan nyid can du gyur pa de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba'i rjes la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: sems gnas par gyur pas don thams cad 'grub par rung ba'i mtshan nyid can du gyur pa de'i phyir yang dag par spong ba'i rjes la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam par bsgom pa ste /
translated: Since the mind becomes serviceable, characterized by the ability to accomplish all aims, therefore, after the correct abandonings, the bases of supernatural powers are cultivated.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i don thams cad grub pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i don thams cad grub pa'o //
translated: Supernatural power is the accomplishment of all aims such as the superknowledges.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pas rkang pa ste ting nge 'dzin bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pas rkang pa ste ting nge 'dzin bzhi'o //
translated: Since they are the cause of that, they are the bases, which are the four concentrations.

original: de rnams la yang rnam gzhag lnga ste /
analyzed: de rnams la yang rnam gzhag lnga ste /
translated: There are five topics in those:

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: object, nature, companion, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin 'grub pas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin 'grub pas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The object of the bases of supernatural power is the activity of supernatural power such as the superknowledges, which is accomplished by concentration.

original: ngo bo ni sems gnas pa ste ting nge 'dzin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo ni sems gnas pa ste ting nge 'dzin zhes pa'o //
translated: The nature is mental stability, which is concentration.

original: grogs ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: grogs ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Its associates are will, effort, mind, and investigation, and the mind and mental factors associated with them.

original: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gus par sbyor pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gus par sbyor pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
translated: Among them, the concentration of will is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on devoted application.

original: de la gus par sbyor ba ni shin tu gus pas sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la gus par sbyor ba ni shin tu gus pas sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: Among them, devoted application is the very application with great respect.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
translated: The concentration of effort is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on continuous application.

original: gang rtag tu 'bad la nam yang mi 'bad pa med pa de la brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rtag tu 'bad la nam yang mi 'bad pa med pa de la brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: That which always strives and never does not strive is called effort.

original: sems kyi ting @24b nge 'dzin ni gang sngon ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi ting @24b nge 'dzin ni gang sngon ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
translated: The concentration of mind is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on previously cultivated concentration.

original: sngon skye ba gzhan du ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas de'i sa bon rgyas pas rang gi ngang gis sems ting nge 'dzin la rjes su mthun par gyur pas ting nge 'dzin la reg pas so //
analyzed: sngon skye ba gzhan du ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas de'i sa bon rgyas pas rang gi ngang gis sems ting nge 'dzin la rjes su mthun par gyur pas ting nge 'dzin la reg pas so //
translated: The concentration of spontaneous attention is the concentration that one experiences through the development of the seed of concentration from the practice of concentration in previous lives.

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gzhan gyi gdams ngag la brten nas chos rab tu rnam par phye ba'i sgo nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gzhan gyi gdams ngag la brten nas chos rab tu rnam par phye ba'i sgo nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //
translated: The concentration of analysis is the one-pointedness of mind that one experiences through the discrimination of phenomena on the basis of the instructions of others.

original: bsgom pa ni spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad goms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad goms par byed pa ste /
translated: Cultivation is the cultivation of the eight formative factors of abandonment.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ni 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ni 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: The eight formative factors of abandonment are will, effort, confidence, fitness, mindfulness, clear comprehension, volition, and equanimity.

original: spong ba'i don du 'du byed pa yin pas spong ba'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: spong ba'i don du 'du byed pa yin pas spong ba'i 'du byed do //
translated: They are formative factors of abandonment because they are formative factors for the sake of abandonment.

original: 'di rnams gang spong ba'i don gyis 'du byed yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di rnams gang spong ba'i don gyis 'du byed yin zhe na /
translated: For what purpose are they formative factors?üîΩThey are formative factors for the sake of abandoning the five faults.

original: skyon lngas te /
analyzed: skyon lngas te /
translated: What are the five faults?

original: de la skyon lnga ni le lo dang / gdams ngag brjed pa dang ; bying rgod dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la skyon lnga ni le lo dang / gdams ngag brjed pa dang ; bying rgod dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / 'du byed pa'o //
translated: The five faults are laziness, forgetting the instruction, laxity and excitement, lack of motivating factors and motivating factors.

original: de la bying rgod ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la bying rgod ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Laxity and excitement have already been explained.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Lack of motivating factors is equanimity.

original: 'du byed pa ni yul gzhan yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed pa ni yul gzhan yid la byed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Motivating factors is the intention that directs the mind to another object.

original: de la le lo ni sbyor ba'i dus na skyon yin te /
analyzed: de la le lo ni sbyor ba'i dus na skyon yin te /
translated: Laziness is a fault at the time of preparation.

original: des sbyor ba mi byed pas so //
analyzed: des sbyor ba mi byed pas so //
translated: Because it does not prepare.

original: sbyor ba byed pa'i dus su gdams ngag brjed pa skyon yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba byed pa'i dus su gdams ngag brjed pa skyon yin te /
translated: Forgetting the instruction is a fault at the time of preparation.

original: des sems mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: des sems mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because it does not cause the mind to rest in equipoise.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su bying rgod skyon yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su bying rgod skyon yin te /
translated: Laxity and excitement are faults at the time of equipoise.

original: de rnams las su rung bar mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de rnams las su rung bar mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because they do not make the mind serviceable.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa'i dus su mngon par 'du mi byed pa skyon yin te /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa'i dus su mngon par 'du mi byed pa skyon yin te /
translated: Lack of motivating factors is a fault at the time of laxity and excitement.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pas bying rgod kyi gnyen po yid la mi byed pa'i phyir bying rgod zhi bar mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pas bying rgod kyi gnyen po yid la mi byed pa'i phyir bying rgod zhi bar mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because of non-application, the antidote to laxity and excitement is not applied, and so laxity and excitement are not pacified.

original: bying rgod zhi ba'i dus su 'du byed pa skyon yin te /
analyzed: bying rgod zhi ba'i dus su 'du byed pa skyon yin te /
translated: When laxity and excitement are pacified, application is a fault.

original: bying rgod dang bral bas sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba zhes brjod pa yin pas de ltar gyur pa'i tshe bying rgod kyi gnyen po mngon du byed pa skyon yin no //
analyzed: bying rgod dang bral bas sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba zhes brjod pa yin pas de ltar gyur pa'i tshe bying rgod kyi gnyen po mngon du byed pa skyon yin no //
translated: Since the mind is in equipoise, free from laxity and excitement, it is called ‚Äúpacified.‚Äù When it is in that state, the application of the antidote to laxity and excitement is a fault.

original: 'di rnams ni skyon lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni skyon lnga'o //
translated: These are the five faults.

original: skye ni lnga po de rnams spong ba'i don du spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad rnam gzhag byed pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar le lo spang ba'i don du 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs @25a * //
analyzed: skye ni lnga po de rnams spong ba'i don du spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad rnam gzhag byed pa yin te / 'di ltar le lo spang ba'i don du 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs @25a * //
translated: The eight formative factors of abandonment are posited for the purpose of abandoning those five.

original: pa dang ; spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi'o //
analyzed: pa dang ; spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, for the purpose of abandoning laziness, there are four formative factors of abandonment: aspiration, effort, faith, and pliancy.

original: de la 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire for meditative concentration.

original: rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Effort is vigor.

original: dad pa ni mngon par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni mngon par yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is full confidence.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus dang sems las su rung ba'o //
translated: Pliancy is the serviceability of the body and mind.

original: bzhi po 'di rnams rim pa ci lta ba bzhin du rten dang / brten pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bur rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams rim pa ci lta ba bzhin du rten dang / brten pa dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bur rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: These four are respectively determined as the basis, that which is based on it, the cause, and the result.

original: de la 'dun pa ni rtsol ba'i rten yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni rtsol ba'i rten yin no //
translated: Among them, aspiration is the basis of effort.

original: brten pa ni rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: brten pa ni rtsol ba ste /
translated: That which is based on it is effort.

original: rtsol ba'i sngon du 'gro ba mngon par 'dod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rtsol ba'i sngon du 'gro ba mngon par 'dod pa yin pas so //
translated: Since aspiration precedes effort, it is the cause of effort.

original: rten 'dun pa'i rgyu ni dad pa yin te /
analyzed: rten 'dun pa'i rgyu ni dad pa yin te /
translated: The cause of the basis, aspiration, is faith.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la dad pa yod na mnyam par 'jog pa'i bya ba 'dod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la dad pa yod na mnyam par 'jog pa'i bya ba 'dod pa yin pas so //
translated: Since there is aspiration for the activity of meditative equipoise when there is faith in the cause and result,

original: rten rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: rten rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: the result of the basis, effort, is pliancy.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral nas dga' ba skye la dga' ba skyes pa las lus dang sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can shin tu sbyangs pa skye bas so ;
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral nas dga' ba skye la dga' ba skyes pa las lus dang sems las su rung ba'i mtshan nyid can shin tu sbyangs pa skye bas so ;
translated: Since joy arises when one is free from faults such as discursiveness through the practice of effort, and since pliancy, which is characterized by the serviceability of the body and mind, arises from the arising of joy,

original: /'dir rtsol ba rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa le lo'i gnyen po nyid du bstan no //
analyzed: /'dir rtsol ba rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa le lo'i gnyen po nyid du bstan no //
translated: Here, effort with its cause and result is taught as the antidote to laziness.

original: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms ni skyon bzhi'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms ni skyon bzhi'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Mindfulness, vigilance, intention, and equanimity are the antidotes to the four faults.

original: de la dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Among them, mindfulness is the antidote to forgetting the instruction.

original: shes bzhin ni dran pa yod pa'i dus su bying rgod rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni dran pa yod pa'i dus su bying rgod rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Vigilance is the recognition of laxity and excitement when mindfulness is present.

original: sems pa ni bying rgod rtogs nas de spang ba'i don du gnyen po mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni bying rgod rtogs nas de spang ba'i don du gnyen po mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Intention is the motivation to apply the antidotes in order to eliminate laxity and excitement that have been recognized.

original: btang snyoms ni bying rgod zhi ba'i dus kyi sems rang gi ngang gis mnyam par 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bying rgod zhi ba'i dus kyi sems rang gi ngang gis mnyam par 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the mind resting in its natural state when laxity and excitement have been pacified.

original: de la dran pa ni gdams ngag brjed pa'i gnyen po ste ;
analyzed: de la dran pa ni gdams ngag brjed pa'i gnyen po ste ;
translated: Among them, mindfulness is the antidote to forgetting the instruction.

original: des gdams ngag brjed par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: des gdams ngag brjed par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: By that, one does not forget the instruction.

original: shes bzhin ni bying rgod kyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni bying rgod kyi gnyen po ste /
translated: Vigilance is the antidote to laxity and excitement.

original: des bying rgod shes pa yin pas so //
analyzed: des bying rgod shes pa yin pas so //
translated: By that, one recognizes laxity and excitement.

original: sems pa ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidote to non-application is will.

original: des bying rgod kyi gnyen po mngon par 'du byed pas so //
analyzed: des bying rgod kyi gnyen po mngon par 'du byed pas so //
translated: Since it is the application of the antidote to laxity and excitement,

original: btang snyoms ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: the antidote to application is equanimity.

original: sems rang gi ngang gis mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe gnyen po mngon par 'du byed pa btang snyoms su 'jog pas so //
analyzed: sems rang gi ngang gis mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe gnyen po mngon par 'du byed pa btang snyoms su 'jog pas so //
translated: When the mind is naturally concentrated, one should apply the antidote and rest in equanimity.

original: des ni sgom pa bstan no //
analyzed: des ni sgom pa bstan no //
translated: This explains the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'bras bu ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi yon tan grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi yon tan grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The result is the accomplishment of the qualities of spiritual power such as the superknowledges.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa gsum @25b gyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bcu gnyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa gsum @25b gyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bcu gnyis bsdus so //
translated: Thus, the three productions of the thought include the twelve factors of enlightenment.

original: sems bskyed pa gsum po 'di rnams la cho ga'i sgrub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gsum po 'di rnams la cho ga'i sgrub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These three productions of the thought are called the accomplishment of the rite,

original: 'di ltar dper na rgyal rigs gang zhig rgyal srid 'dod pa de la phan par 'dod pas bskul ba na dang po go gyon par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na rgyal rigs gang zhig rgyal srid 'dod pa de la phan par 'dod pas bskul ba na dang po go gyon par byed do //
translated: just as, for example, when a member of the warrior caste who desires kingship is urged by those who desire his welfare, he first dons the armor.

original: de nas 'jug pa ste glang po la sogs pa la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'jug pa ste glang po la sogs pa la zhon pa'o //
translated: Then he sets out, riding on elephants and so on.

original: de nas dpung gi tshogs sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de nas dpung gi tshogs sdud par byed do //
translated: Then he gathers his army.

original: de nas nges par 'byung ba'i sa nas nges par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas nges par 'byung ba'i sa nas nges par 'byung ste /
translated: Then he sets out from the land of certainty,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal bar byas nas rgyal srid thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal bar byas nas rgyal srid thob pa'o //
translated: having conquered the opposing side, and he attains the kingdom.

original: de ltar rang gi don bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus accomplished his own aim,

original: de'i rjes la snying rje dang ldan pas ci ltar rigs par skye dgu yongs su skyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes la snying rje dang ldan pas ci ltar rigs par skye dgu yongs su skyong bar byed do //
translated: he then protects the people as best he can, out of compassion.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa'i go cha gyon pas sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i go cha gyon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa'i go cha gyon pas sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i go cha gyon par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva who has put on the armor of accomplishing the six perfections puts on the armor of not objectifying the gift and so on.

original: gnas skabs 'dir bar du gcod pa'i mda' thams cad kyis mi phigs pas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir bar du gcod pa'i mda' thams cad kyis mi phigs pas so //
translated: Because in this situation, all the arrows of the obstacles cannot penetrate him.

original: de ltar go bgos pas rnam pa thams cad du bsgom pa la brtson par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar go bgos pas rnam pa thams cad du bsgom pa la brtson par 'jug ste /
translated: Thus armored, he engages in the effort to cultivate in all ways.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos ma lus pa la lhag par 'dzeg go //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos ma lus pa la lhag par 'dzeg go //
translated: He ascends to the higher and higher stages of the Great Vehicle, such as the stages of concentration, etc.

original: de nas rgyu'i mthar thug pa thob par 'dod pas tshogs sog go //
analyzed: de nas rgyu'i mthar thug pa thob par 'dod pas tshogs sog go //
translated: Then, desiring to attain the ultimate cause, he accumulates the collections.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa'i don du nges par 'byung ba'i sa nas nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa'i don du nges par 'byung ba'i sa nas nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of attaining the stage of Buddhahood, he emerges from the stage of certain conduct.

original: de nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam thob nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pa las byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi sa yang
analyzed: de nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam thob nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pa las byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi sa yang
translated: Then, having attained the path of no obstacles called the diamond-like concentration, he attains the stage of Buddhahood, which is the nature of the realization of the limit of reality, by completely abandoning all the resistances, the afflictions and the obstructions to omniscience, along with their instincts.

original: dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas pa'i rang bzhin can chos kyi rgyal po thob bo //
analyzed: dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas pa'i rang bzhin can chos kyi rgyal po thob bo //
translated: He becomes the king of Dharma.

original: de nas ci ltar rigs par sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: de nas ci ltar rigs par sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: Then, he acts for the welfare of living beings in whatever way is appropriate.

original: de ltar go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba bsgrub pa'i nang nas sems bskyed pa gsum gyi gnas skabs la go cha'i sgrub pa rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de ltar go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba bsgrub pa'i nang nas sems bskyed pa gsum gyi gnas skabs la go cha'i sgrub pa rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Thus, from among the armor, entry, collection, and definite emergence practices, the armor practice is posited as the occasion of the three arousals of mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis gzhung 'grel las go cha chen po bgos pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bar la bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis gzhung 'grel las go cha chen po bgos pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bar la bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, Master Vasubandhu says in his commentary: ‚ÄúThe great armor is donned from the first arousal of mind up to the superior intention.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa bcu'i mdo bshad pa las go cha'i smon pa'o zhes gsungs so //üîΩbcom ldan 'das @26a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa bcu'i mdo bshad pa las go cha'i smon pa'o zhes gsungs so // bcom ldan 'das @26a * //
translated: For that very reason, the Ten Grounds Sutra Explanation says: ‚ÄúThe armor is the aspiration.‚Äù

original: kyis kyang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa'i dus su sems bskyed pa dang po nas bzung ste thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa sbyin gyi /
analyzed: kyis kyang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa'i dus su sems bskyed pa dang po nas bzung ste thabs la mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa sbyin gyi /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also taught the armor practice in the context of teaching the factors conducive to liberation, saying: ‚ÄúFrom the first arousal of mind, give gifts without being separated from skill in means.

original: mtshan mar ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa go cha'i bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan mar ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa go cha'i bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Do not make signs, and so on.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa las ma gtogs pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa las ma gtogs pa'i go cha'i sgrub pa gzhan med pas so //
translated: because there is no armoring practice other than the practice of generosity and so on.

original: de ni tshogs lam gyi rang bzhin can sems bskyed pa gsum pa bstan no //
analyzed: de ni tshogs lam gyi rang bzhin can sems bskyed pa gsum pa bstan no //
translated: This is the teaching of the third generation of the Thought, which has the nature of the path of accumulation.

original: de ltar tshogs kyi lam du dad pa la sogs pa'i dge bas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs dang ldan pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs pas ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i don du bskal pa grangs med pa gcig las byung nas chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas sangs rgyas las gdams ngag thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshogs kyi lam du dad pa la sogs pa'i dge bas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs dang ldan pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs pas ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i don du bskal pa grangs med pa gcig las byung nas chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pas sangs rgyas las gdams ngag thob ste /
translated: Thus, one who has a mind imbued with the virtues of faith and so on in the path of accumulation, and who is endowed with the collection of virtues of generosity and so on, completes the collection of merit. In order to accumulate the collection of knowledge, one emerges after one incalculable eon, and obtains the concentration of the stream of Dharma. Thus, one obtains the precepts from the Buddha.

original: gdams ngag gis bstan pa mngon par shes /
analyzed: gdams ngag gis bstan pa mngon par shes /
translated: By the precepts, one manifests the superknowledges.

original: spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug ces gsungs pas lhag par mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug ces gsungs pas lhag par mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: One enters the ground of engagement through belief.

original: de nas sems bskyed pa bzhi pa lhag par mos pa'i sa dang sbyor ba'i lam dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ; dbang po dang / stobs dang /
analyzed: de nas sems bskyed pa bzhi pa lhag par mos pa'i sa dang sbyor ba'i lam dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ; dbang po dang / stobs dang /
translated: Then, the fourth generation of the mind of enlightenment is connected with the stage of the special belief, the path of connection, the path of meditation with contamination, the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetration, the faculties, the powers,

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can /
translated: and the nature of the practice of engagement.

original: me lta bu'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: me lta bu'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is established as being like fire.

original: de la sems bskyed pa bzhi pa la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye bas bzhi'o /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa bzhi pa la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye bas bzhi'o /
translated: In that regard, the fourth generation of the mind of enlightenment is divided into four: small, middling, great, and great-great.

original: de la dang po la drod rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la dang po la drod rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In that regard, the first is established as heat.

original: gnyis pa la rtse mor rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnyis pa la rtse mor rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The second is established as the peak.

original: gsum pa la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la bzod pa'o //
translated: The third is forbearance.

original: bzhi pa la 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: bzhi pa la 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog go //
translated: The fourth is the supreme mundane quality.

original: ji ltar gtsub shing gtsub gtan la gtsubs pa las me'i snga ltas su gyur pa'i drod 'byung la /
analyzed: ji ltar gtsub shing gtsub gtan la gtsubs pa las me'i snga ltas su gyur pa'i drod 'byung la /
translated: Just as when a stick is rubbed with a stick, the sign of fire is the arising of heat.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam me yin la de'i snga ltas su gyur pa 'di 'byung bas na drod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam me yin la de'i snga ltas su gyur pa 'di 'byung bas na drod do //
translated: Likewise, it is called heat because it is the sign of the arising of the supramundane path, which is like fire.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pas na rtse mo ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pas na rtse mo ste /
translated: It is called summit because it is the peak of the wavering of the roots of virtue.

original: 'di las ltung ba'am rgal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'di las ltung ba'am rgal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: For one can fall from it or transcend it.

original: bden pa bzhi la tsher bzod pas na bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la tsher bzod pas na bzod pa'o //
translated: It is called patience because one has patience with the four truths.

original: zag pa dang bcas pas na 'jig rten pa yin la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pas na 'jig rten pa yin la /
translated: It is called mundane because it is associated with the outflows.

original: de'i de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam skye bas @26b chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam skye bas @26b chos kyi mchog go //
translated: It is called supreme mundane state because the path of insight arises immediately after it.

original: de la drod ni bden pa so so'i bdag nyid la snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la drod ni bden pa so so'i bdag nyid la snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: In this context, heat is the meditative concentration and wisdom that are associated with the attainment of the light of the individual truths.

original: de la bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truths are the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: de la gang skye ba sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / gang du skye ba snod kyi 'jig rten dag la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang skye ba sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / gang du skye ba snod kyi 'jig rten dag la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The world of sentient beings that is born there and the receptacle world where it is born are called the truth of suffering.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byas pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byas pa'o //
translated: They are produced by action and affliction and are made by the power of action and affliction.

original: gang 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten ni las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten ni las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin /
translated: The world of sentient beings and the receptacle world in a pure world-realm are not produced by action and affliction.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba yang ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not made by the power of action and affliction.

original: 'on kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i smon lam las nges par 'byung bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i smon lam las nges par 'byung bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, since they arise from inconceivable vows, they are not the truth of suffering.

original: de la nyan thos pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid du sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de la nyan thos pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid du sgom par byed do //
translated: The Sravakas cultivate the truth of suffering as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni de bzhin du yang sgom pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni de bzhin du yang sgom pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva cultivates in the same way.

original: nyan thos rnams 'dul ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams 'dul ba'i don du'o //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas cultivate in order to subdue.

original: rnam pa de rnams mi dmigs pas kyang ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de rnams mi dmigs pas kyang ste /
translated: They cultivate by not apprehending those aspects.

original: rang gi lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rang gi lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: They cultivate in order to complete their own path.

original: yang na nyan thos rnams kyang mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgom ste /
analyzed: yang na nyan thos rnams kyang mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas bsgom ste /
translated: Or else, the ≈õrƒÅvakas cultivate by not apprehending.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i 'thad pa phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i 'thad pa phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: The justification for cultivating in that way will be explained later.

original: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa logs su sgom par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa logs su sgom par mi byed kyi /
translated: There, they do not cultivate the aspects of impermanence, etc. separately.

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa sgom pa'i nang du 'dus pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa sgom pa'i nang du 'dus pas so //
