translated: However, since the non-apprehension of impermanence, etc. is included in the cultivation,

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos kyi lam ldog pa'i sgo nas 'phangs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos kyi lam ldog pa'i sgo nas 'phangs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: therefore it is said that they are distinguished by the reversal of the ≈õrƒÅvaka path.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sngar med pa 'byung ba dang / byung ba med par 'gyur bas mi rtag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sngar med pa 'byung ba dang / byung ba med par 'gyur bas mi rtag par shes par bya'o //
translated: There, the truth of suffering should be known as impermanent because it arises without having existed before and because what has arisen will cease to be.

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid gsum dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa brgyad po'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid gsum dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa brgyad po'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of suffering and the eight kinds of suffering should be understood as the aspects of suffering in the truth of suffering because they are suffering by the very nature of suffering.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal nyid gsum bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal nyid gsum bshad zin to //
translated: Thus the three kinds of suffering have been explained.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni mdor bsdu na drug ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni mdor bsdu na drug ste /
translated: The eight kinds of suffering are included in six kinds:üîΩthe suffering of the good,

original: dge ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur @27a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur @27a * //
translated: the suffering of change,üîΩthe suffering of meeting,üîΩthe suffering of separation,

original: ba'i sdug bsngal dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: ba'i sdug bsngal dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of not obtaining what is desired, and the suffering of the process of total affliction.

original: de la 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The suffering of change is threefold:üîΩthe suffering of change of pleasure,üîΩthe suffering of change of the elements, and

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ; khams 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / srog 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang ; khams 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / srog 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of change of life.

original: de la skye ba ni dog pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: de la skye ba ni dog pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Birth is suffering because of the suffering of being confined.

original: ma'i mngal na zhu ba dang / ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: ma'i mngal na zhu ba dang / ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug pa'am /
translated: Because he experiences the suffering of being in the womb, between the digested and undigested food in the mother's stomach,

original: mngal nas byung ba na mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs kyis gzir ba dang / lus kyi yan lag kun du btsir ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngal nas byung ba na mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sna tshogs kyis gzir ba dang / lus kyi yan lag kun du btsir ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he experiences the suffering of being squeezed in the birth canal when he comes out of the womb, and the suffering of being squeezed in all the limbs of his body.

original: rgas pa ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: rgas pa ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Old age is suffering because of the suffering of change.

original: na ba ni khams yongs su gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: na ba ni khams yongs su gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Sickness is suffering because of the suffering of the transformation of the elements.

original: 'chi ba ni srog yongs su gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni srog yongs su gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Death is suffering because of the suffering of the transformation of life.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa ni phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa ni phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Association with what is not loved is suffering because of the suffering of association.

original: mdza' ba dang bral ba ni 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang bral ba ni 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Separation from what is loved is suffering because of the suffering of separation.

original: 'dod pa ma thob pa ni re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ma thob pa ni re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Not obtaining what one longs for is suffering because of the suffering of the non-attainment of what one longs for.

original: gnas ngan len gyis sdug bsngal ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyis sdug bsngal ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do /
translated: The suffering of the negative reflex actions is the suffering of the formative forces.

original: sdug bsngal brgyad po 'di rnams sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgyad po 'di rnams sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyis bsdus te /
translated: These eight sufferings are included in the three kinds of suffering.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal zhes gang gsungs pa des sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal zhes gang gsungs pa des sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid rab tu bstan te /
translated: The suffering of suffering is indicated by the statement: ‚ÄúThe suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and encountering what is unpleasant.‚Äù

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can yin pas so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid can yin pas so //
translated: Because they have the characteristics of suffering such as birth, etc.

original: mdza' ba dang bral bas gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa des 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: mdza' ba dang bral bas gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa des 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan te /
translated: The suffering of change is indicated by the statement: ‚ÄúThe suffering of being separated from what is pleasant and not obtaining what one desires, despite searching for it.‚Äù

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa tshor ba bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pas so //
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa tshor ba bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pas so //
translated: Because they have the characteristics of the transformation of the attainment and non-attainment of the Dharma which is experienced as pleasant feeling.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa des 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa des 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu bstan te /
translated: In brief, the statement, ‚ÄúThe five appropriated aggregates are suffering‚Äù teaches the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: ma byung ba byung ba dang / byung ba med par gyur pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pas @27b so ;
analyzed: ma byung ba byung ba dang / byung ba med par gyur pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pas @27b so ;
translated: Because they have the nature of suffering due to the occurrence of what has not occurred and the non-occurrence of what has occurred.

original: / yang na gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / yang na gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Or, it should be understood that whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye ba'i char gyur pa dang / 'jig pa'i char gyur pa dang / gnyis ka'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas gang mi rtag pa de la sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gyur pa dang / 'jig pa'i char gyur pa dang / gnyis ka'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas gang mi rtag pa de la sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that whatever is impermanent is suffering because of the impermanence that is the aspect of arising, the impermanence that is the aspect of destruction, and the impermanence that is the aspect of both.

original: de la skye ba'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni med pa'i dngos po byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni med pa'i dngos po byung ba yin la /
translated: Among them, impermanence that is the aspect of arising is the occurrence of a nonexistent thing.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams byung ba de yang gnod par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams byung ba de yang gnod par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The arising of the formations on the side of suffering is also of the nature of harm. Therefore, based on impermanence, it is called the suffering of suffering.

original: 'jig pa'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
translated: Based on impermanence that is a part of destruction, there is the suffering of change.

original: 'jig pa'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni byung ba med par gyur pa la bya la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni byung ba med par gyur pa la bya la /
translated: Impermanence that is a part of destruction is the non-existence of what has arisen.

original: de yang bde ba'i phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams la mi 'dod pa yin pas de la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bde ba'i phyogs kyi 'du byed rnams la mi 'dod pa yin pas de la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that is undesirable for the formations on the side of pleasure, based on that, it is called suffering due to the suffering of change.

original: gnyis ka'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i char gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: and that which is both are suffering due to the suffering of conditioned states, because they are associated with the inauspiciousness of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: de'i phyir gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: de ltar na yang mi rtag pa skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na yang mi rtag pa skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: However, it is impermanence that is associated with origination, etc. that is to be known as suffering,

original: mi rtag pa spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: not impermanence in general,

original: de ltar lam yang sdug bsngal ba nyid du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de ltar lam yang sdug bsngal ba nyid du 'gyur bas so //
translated: because in that case the path would also be suffering.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bstan no //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bstan no //
translated: Thus, the suffering aspect of the truth of suffering has been explained.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / yongs su gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / yongs su gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa'o //
translated: The aspect of emptiness of the truth of suffering is the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, which are not permanent, stable, enduring, or subject to reversal, and which are devoid of a self and anything that belongs to a self.

original: de ltar na bdag med kyi bdag med pa ni yod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag med kyi bdag med pa ni yod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Thus, the non-existence of a self is the emptiness of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should understand the aspect of emptiness of the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po la sogs pa mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phung po la sogs pa mi ldan pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the absence of a self of the truth of suffering is the absence of the characteristics imputed as a self by those who propound the existence of a self, and the absence of the aggregates, etc.,

original: phung po la sogs pa bdag gi mtshan nyid can du mi 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa bdag gi mtshan nyid can du mi 'gyur ba'o /
translated: because the aggregates, etc., do not have the characteristics of a self.

original: @28a * // de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bdag med pa'i rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @28a * // de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bdag med pa'i rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should understand the aspect of the absence of a self of the truth of suffering.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bstan no //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bstan no //
translated: Thus the truth of suffering and the aspects of the truth of suffering have been explained.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni nyon mongs pa gang la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de kun 'byung ba de dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i las gang yin pa'o //üîΩgal te de ltar yin na kun 'byung ba bstan pa'i skabs su bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa yang srid pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa de dang de la mngon par dga' ba la kun 'byung ba'i bden par ci'i phyir
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ni nyon mongs pa gang la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de kun 'byung ba de dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i las gang yin pa'o // gal te de ltar yin na kun 'byung ba bstan pa'i skabs su bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa yang srid pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa de dang de la mngon par dga' ba la kun 'byung ba'i bden par ci'i phyir
translated: The truth of origin is the origin of the truth of suffering and the contaminated actions that arise under the influence of the afflictions.

original: bstan ce na /
analyzed: bstan ce na /
translated: If that is so, why did the BhagavƒÅn teach craving as the truth of origin in the context of teaching the truth of origin, since craving arises from existence and is associated with delight and attraction and is pleased with and attached to that and that?

original: kun du 'gro bas gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun du 'gro bas gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the principal and pervasive.

original: 'di ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad la kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad la kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Thus craving is pervasive with regard to all things.

original: thob pa dang / ma thob pa'i bdag gi dngos po dang / yul gyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa dang / ma thob pa'i bdag gi dngos po dang / yul gyi dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pervades all things that are obtained and not obtained, and all objects.

original: de la bdag gi dngos po thob pa la ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi dngos po thob pa la ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for things that are obtained is craving for separation.

original: ma thob pa la ni yang srid pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa la ni yang srid pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Craving for things that are not obtained is craving for union.

original: thob pa'i yul rnams la ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i yul rnams la ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: Craving for obtained objects is craving accompanied by attachment to pleasure.

original: ma thob pa'i yul rnams la ni de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i yul rnams la ni de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: Craving for things that are not obtained is craving for this and that.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa gnas skabs gsum gyi 'du byed rnams la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa gnas skabs gsum gyi 'du byed rnams la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Permeating all states means that it pervades all formations in the three states, such as the state of the suffering of suffering, and so on.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs thob pa la ni bral bar sred de /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi gnas skabs thob pa la ni bral bar sred de /
translated: Craving for separation is craving for things that are obtained in the state of the suffering of suffering.

original: ma thob pa la ni mi phrad par sred do //
analyzed: ma thob pa la ni mi phrad par sred do //
translated: Craving for union is craving for things that are not obtained.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i bye brag gis mi 'bral ba'i sred pa dang / phrad pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i bye brag gis mi 'bral ba'i sred pa dang / phrad pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: In the case of the suffering of change, craving is the craving for non-separation and the craving for union, respectively, due to the distinction between what has been obtained and what has not been obtained.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la ni gti mug gi sred pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs la ni gti mug gi sred pa ste /
translated: In the case of the suffering of the formative forces, craving is the craving for delusion.

original: de rnams la gti mug gi sgo nas sred pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la gti mug gi sgo nas sred pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Craving engages these three types of suffering through delusion.

original: dus thams cad du 'gro ba ni sred pa dang dus gsum po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'gro ba ni sred pa dang dus gsum po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to pervade all times because it is associated with the three times.

original: de la 'das pa'i dus la ni ltos pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i dus la ni ltos pa'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: In this respect, it is associated with the past time through the mode of reliance.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ni mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ni mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is associated with the future time through the mode of delight.

original: da ltar byung ba la ni lhag par chags pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la ni lhag par chags pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is associated with the present time through the mode of attachment.

original: khams gsum du 'gro ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs @28b dang ; gzugs med pa dag gi sred pas khams gsum la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum du 'gro ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs @28b dang ; gzugs med pa dag gi sred pas khams gsum la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to pervade the three realms because craving for the desire, form and formless realms pervades the three realms.

original: tshor ba thams cad du 'gro ba ni des 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / log par tshangs par spyod pa la tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad du 'gro ba ni des 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / log par tshangs par spyod pa la tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The feeling that goes everywhere is the search for pleasure, existence, and false liberation.

original: de la 'dod pa tshol bas ni 'dod pa'i khams las yongs su ma grol bar de nyid du sdug bsngal grub par byed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa tshol bas ni 'dod pa'i khams las yongs su ma grol bar de nyid du sdug bsngal grub par byed do //
translated: By the search for pleasure, one is not liberated from the realm of desire, and one creates suffering right there.

original: de bzhin du srid pa tshol bas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su sdug bsngal 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa tshol bas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su sdug bsngal 'grub par byed do //
translated: Similarly, by the search for existence, one creates suffering in the form and formless realms.

original: srid pa'i sgras gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams bsten pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i sgras gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams bsten pa'o //
translated: Existence is the support of the form and formless realms.

original: log par tshangs par spyod pa tshol bas ni 'khor ba las yongs su ma grol bar de nyid du 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: log par tshangs par spyod pa tshol bas ni 'khor ba las yongs su ma grol bar de nyid du 'khor bar byed do //
translated: By the search for false liberation, one is not liberated from cyclic existence, and one circles right there.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba ni srid pa dang / srid pa ma yin pa la srid pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba ni srid pa dang / srid pa ma yin pa la srid pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i rnam pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The feeling that goes everywhere is the search for existence and non-existence, because it pervades the aspects of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: de ltar mdo las sred pa gtso bo yin pas kun 'byung gi bden par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar mdo las sred pa gtso bo yin pas kun 'byung gi bden par bstan to //
translated: Thus, craving is taught to be the truth of origination in the sutra, because it is the chief.

original: de la nyan thos rnams kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa'i sgo nas sgom mo //
analyzed: de la nyan thos rnams kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa'i sgo nas sgom mo //
translated: The sravakas cultivate the truth of origination from the viewpoint of cause, origination, strong generation, and condition.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
translated: The bodhisattvas cultivate it in the manner previously explained.

original: de la rgyu'i rnam pa ni yang srid pa'i bag chags 'joms pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rnam pa ni yang srid pa'i bag chags 'joms pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of cause is the cause for the destruction of the latent propensities for renewed existence.

original: kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni sems can bag chags bsags pa rnams kyi lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi ris su de'i cha byad dang / rang bzhin dang 'dra bar bsdus nas 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni sems can bag chags bsags pa rnams kyi lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi ris su de'i cha byad dang / rang bzhin dang 'dra bar bsdus nas 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na'o //
translated: The aspect of origination is the cause for the origination of the latent propensities of sentient beings, since it causes the collection of the various types of sentient beings, such as gods, in the form of that collection and its nature.

original: rab tu skye ba ni so sor rang gi rgyud nges pa dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du dang / mchog tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gro ba'i bar du 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni so sor rang gi rgyud nges pa dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du dang / mchog tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gro ba'i bar du 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: The cause of complete arising is the cause of the arising of all aspects of the individual destinies, birth processes, and so forth, up to the peak of existence.

original: rkyen ni sngon ma byung ba'i lus gzhan dang gzhan thob pa dang / sngon thob pa'i dus 'das par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni sngon ma byung ba'i lus gzhan dang gzhan thob pa dang / sngon thob pa'i dus 'das par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The condition is the cause of obtaining another body that was not previously obtained and the cause of making the previously obtained body pass away.

original: de ltar kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhir shes par bya'o /
analyzed: de ltar kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhir shes par bya'o /
translated: Thus, the four aspects of the truth of origin should be understood.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni gang du 'gog pa dang / gang 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni gang du 'gog pa dang / gang 'gog pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is that in which there is cessation and that which ceases.

original: gang du 'gog na de bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: gang du 'gog na de bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: In which there is cessation? In suchness.

original: gang 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: That which ceases is the non-arising of afflictions.

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: These two are cessation.

original: 'di yang 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi @29a * //
analyzed: 'di yang 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi @29a * //
translated: This also has four aspects: cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive release.

original: sngar bzhin du sgom mo //
analyzed: sngar bzhin du sgom mo //
translated: As before, one meditates on these.

original: de la 'gog pa'i rnam pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba la brten nas so //
analyzed: de la 'gog pa'i rnam pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba la brten nas so //
translated: The aspect of cessation is based on freedom from the aspect of the defilement.

original: zhi ba'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba la brten pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba la brten pa ste /
translated: The aspect of peace is based on freedom from suffering.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i nyer len gyi phung po lnga dang bral bas so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i nyer len gyi phung po lnga dang bral bas so //
translated: It is free from the five appropriating aggregates, which are not peaceful because of the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: gya nom pa'i rnam pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba yin pas bdag nyid gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i dngos po nyid la brten nas so //
analyzed: gya nom pa'i rnam pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba yin pas bdag nyid gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i dngos po nyid la brten nas so //
translated: The aspect of excellence is based on the entity of purity and bliss, because it is free from suffering and the defilements.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni rtag pa dang phan pa'i rang bzhin nyid la brten nas phyir mi ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni rtag pa dang phan pa'i rang bzhin nyid la brten nas phyir mi ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The aspect of definite emergence is based on the nature of permanence and benefit, because it is the nature of non-regression.

original: de ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four aspects of the truth of cessation should be understood in this way.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni lam gang gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung spong ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du byed pa dang / lam sgom pa ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni lam gang gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung spong ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du byed pa dang / lam sgom pa ste /
translated: The truth of the path is that path by which one fully understands suffering, abandons the origin, manifests cessation, and cultivates the path.

original: 'dis ni bya ba'i sgo nas lam gyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bya ba'i sgo nas lam gyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the concise characteristic of the path in terms of function.

original: tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa la yang lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa la yang lam gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of accumulation and so on are also called the truth of the path.

original: de yang lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa bzhis sngar bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa bzhis sngar bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be cultivated as before through the four aspects of path, correctness, accomplishment, and definite emergence.

original: de la lam gyi rnam pa ni de kho na'i don yongs su tshol ba la brten nas te /
analyzed: de la lam gyi rnam pa ni de kho na'i don yongs su tshol ba la brten nas te /
translated: Among them, the aspect of path is based on the investigation of the meaning of reality.

original: lam 'dis de kho na nyid kyi don tshol ba yin pas so //
analyzed: lam 'dis de kho na nyid kyi don tshol ba yin pas so //
translated: Because this path seeks the meaning of reality.

original: rigs pa'i rnam pa ni mi rigs par 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rnam pa ni mi rigs par 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'gyur bas so //
translated: The aspect of correctness is the antidote to the afflictions that would become incorrect.

original: sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i skyon gyis rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gis phyin ci log pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa de kho na nyid rtogs pa sgrub pa yin pas na sgrub pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa'i skyon gyis rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gis phyin ci log pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa de kho na nyid rtogs pa sgrub pa yin pas na sgrub pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of achievement is the achievement of the nonerroneous mind that is free from the error of permanence, etc. due to the fault of not understanding reality, and the achievement of the nonerroneous understanding of reality.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa ni rtag pa nges par 'byung ba'i gnas su 'gro ba yin pas na nges par 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa ni rtag pa nges par 'byung ba'i gnas su 'gro ba yin pas na nges par 'byin pa'o //
translated: The aspect of definite emergence is definite emergence, since it goes to the state of definite emergence.

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi la rnam pa bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi la rnam pa bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four truths should be understood as having sixteen aspects.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i bden pa la gang snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa de drod de /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i bden pa la gang snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa de drod de /
translated: The heat of the four truths is the meditative stabilization and wisdom that are concurrent with the attainment of the appearance of those aspects.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe bden pa bzhi chos thams cad bdag med pa'i sgo nas sgom pa de'i tshe don tha dad du mngon par zhen pa med pas cung zad gsal ba'i ye shes kyi snang bas sems tsam mthong ba de drod kyi gnas skabs kyang yin la
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe bden pa bzhi chos thams cad bdag med pa'i sgo nas sgom pa de'i tshe don tha dad du mngon par zhen pa med pas cung zad gsal ba'i ye shes kyi snang bas sems tsam mthong ba de drod kyi gnas skabs kyang yin la
translated: Thus, when one meditates on all phenomena of the four noble truths from the perspective of selflessness, then, since one does not conceive of them as having different meanings, one sees mind only through the light of slightly clear transcendent wisdom. That is the stage of heat.

original: / @29b snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: / @29b snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the concentration of obtaining light,

original: cung zad gsal ba'i ye shes mthong bas so //
analyzed: cung zad gsal ba'i ye shes mthong bas so //
translated: because one sees slightly clear transcendent wisdom.

original: drod bstan zin to //
analyzed: drod bstan zin to //
translated: The explanation of heat is finished.

original: snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rgyas pa la rtse mo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rgyas pa la rtse mo zhes bya ste /
translated: That concentration of obtaining light is called the peak when it expands,

original: drod kyi de ma thag pa gsal ba 'bring po rtse mo zhes bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: drod kyi de ma thag pa gsal ba 'bring po rtse mo zhes bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because it is the peak, which is the clarity of the medium stage immediately after heat.

original: de ni snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is the concentration of the increase of light.

original: rtse mo bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtse mo bstan zin to //
translated: The explanation of the peak is finished.

original: bzod pa ni bden pa so so'i phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang / rjes su song ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni bden pa so so'i phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang / rjes su song ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Acceptance is the meditative stabilization and wisdom, together with their associated factors, that are engaged in one part of the truth and that conform to the part.

original: gang gi tshe sems tsam la gnas pas shin tu gsal ba'i phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba skye ba de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems tsam la gnas pas shin tu gsal ba'i phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba skye ba de'i tshe bzod pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: When the light of transcendent wisdom arises, free from attachment to external objects, by abiding in mind only, then one is in the state of acceptance.

original: gcig tu nges par gzung ba rang bzhin med par rtogs pas phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang / 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i rjes su mthun par gnas pa yin pa phyogs gcig la rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par gzung ba rang bzhin med par rtogs pas phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang / 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i rjes su mthun par gnas pa yin pa phyogs gcig la rjes su song ba'o //
translated: It is engaged in one part because it is ascertained as one, and it conforms to one part because it conforms to the realization that the nature of the apprehender does not exist.

original: bzod pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: bzod pa bstan zin to //
translated: Acceptance has been explained.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ni bden pa so so la de ma thag pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ni bden pa so so la de ma thag pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The supreme mundane state is the meditative stabilization and wisdom, together with their associated factors, that are the mind immediately preceding the four truths.

original: gang gis 'dzin par byed pa la snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rdzogs pa de'i tshe 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin par byed pa la snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rdzogs pa de'i tshe 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
translated: When the appearance of the pristine wisdom that is free from the appearance of the apprehended and apprehender is perfected, that is the stage of the supreme mundane quality.

original: de yang bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: de yang bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: That is also the uninterrupted meditative stabilization.

original: de'i de ma thag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthong ba'i lam skye bas so //
analyzed: de'i de ma thag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthong ba'i lam skye bas so //
translated: Because immediately after that, the supramundane path of seeing arises.

original: drod la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: drod la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: The abandonment of the conception of apprehendeds and apprehenders in the stages of heat and so forth is explained from the perspective of mere superior belief in the reality of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya bas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam kho na yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya bas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam kho na yin no //
translated: The antidote to the afflictions subsumed by the factors to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the path of seeing alone.

original: des na mthong ba'i lam kho nar spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i lam kho nar spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore they are abandoned only on the path of seeing.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog bstan zin to //
translated: The supreme mundane qualities have been explained.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa 'di la lhag par mos pas spyod pa 'di la lhag par mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa 'di la lhag par mos pas spyod pa 'di la lhag par mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: This fourth generation of the Thought is also called the stage of practice through special belief, because one practices through special belief in this practice.

original: drod la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams lhag par mos pa la brtan pa dang / yon tan gyi gnas su gyur pa yin pas so //
analyzed: drod la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams lhag par mos pa la brtan pa dang / yon tan gyi gnas su gyur pa yin pas so //
translated: These four, heat, etc., are special beliefs, and are the basis of good qualities.

original: sbyor ba'i lam zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the path of application.

original: @30a * // ji lta bur bud shing gi khyad par gyis me bzhin du de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i sbyor ba gong nas gong du khyad par du gyur pa la bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam la shin tu nye bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: @30a * // ji lta bur bud shing gi khyad par gyis me bzhin du de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i sbyor ba gong nas gong du khyad par du gyur pa la bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam la shin tu nye bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Just as fire is by the difference of fuel, so the application to manifest thatness becomes more and more distinguished, and if there is no obstacle, one comes very near to the path of insight.

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called the path of cultivation with outflows and with addictions.

original: des nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: des nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the root of merit that is conducive to penetration.

original: nges par 'byed pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: Penetration is the path of insight.

original: de'i cha ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: de'i cha ni thob pa ste /
translated: Its part is acquisition,

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in conformity with that.

original: gnas skabs 'di la dbang po dang stobs zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di la dbang po dang stobs zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: This stage is also called the faculties and the powers.

original: de la drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na dad pa la sogs pa la dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na dad pa la sogs pa la dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: In the stages of heat and summit, faith, etc. are called faculties.

original: bzod pa dang 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: In the stages of receptivity and the supreme mundane state, they are called powers.

original: dbang po lnga po la rnam gzhag lnga ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga po la rnam gzhag lnga ste /
translated: There are five topics concerning the five faculties.

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: They are: object, nature, companion, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: The object is the four noble truths.

original: bden par mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pas bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa can yin pas so //
analyzed: bden par mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pas bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa can yin pas so //
translated: They have the aspect of the four noble truths, because they are included in the preparation for realization of the truths.

original: ngo bo ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: ngo bo ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab bo //
translated: Their nature is faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: grogs ni de rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o //üîΩsgom pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos bden pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i tshul gyis sgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs ni de rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o // sgom pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos bden pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i tshul gyis sgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: The associates are the mind and mental factors that are concomitant with those.üîΩCultivation is the cultivation of the five faculties in the manner of clear faith in the truths.

original: mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa ni bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir spro ba'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa ni bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir spro ba'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has generated clear faith cultivates the five powers in the manner of exertion in order to realize the truths.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa mi brjed pa'i tshul gyis sgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni bden pa rnams la nye bar gnas pa'i dran pa mi brjed pa'i tshul gyis sgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has generated exertion cultivates the seven branches of enlightenment in the manner of mindfulness that is not forgetful of the truths.

original: bden pa rnams la dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin sgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin sgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has generated mindfulness cultivates the eight branches of the ƒÅrya path in the manner of one pointed mind in meditative equipoise on the truths.

original: bden pa rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis shes rab sgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul gyis shes rab sgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has generated meditative concentration cultivates the three foundations of mindfulness in the manner of thorough differentiation of the truths.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i dbang gis myur du mthong ba'i lam thob pa dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog rnams thob pa ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i dbang gis myur du mthong ba'i lam thob pa dang / dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog rnams thob pa ste /
translated: The result of cultivation is that one quickly attains the path of insight through the power of that, and one attains the stages of heat, peak, patience, and supreme mundane phenomena.

original: @30b dus de nyid du rgyud la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yod par gyur pas so //
analyzed: @30b dus de nyid du rgyud la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yod par gyur pas so //
translated: At that time, the aids to penetration definitely exist in one's life stream.

original: de ltar dbang po bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po bstan zin to //
translated: Thus the faculties have been explained.

original: dbang po rnams ci lta ba de bzhin du stobs rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ci lta ba de bzhin du stobs rnams la yang ngo //
translated: The powers are just like the faculties.

original: 'di ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par yin te /
translated: This is the difference:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nges par bsrabs pas mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs rnams so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nges par bsrabs pas mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs rnams so //
translated: The powers are not overwhelmed by adverse factors because they have definitely reduced them.

original: de la stobs rnams kyi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la stobs rnams kyi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams dang mtshungs so //
translated: The objective supports of the powers and so on are the same as those of the faculties.

original: 'bras bu la ni bye brag yod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu la ni bye brag yod de /
translated: There is a difference in result.

original: 'di ltar stobs rnams la dbang po ji ltar bstan pa'i 'bras bu de yang yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs rnams la dbang po ji ltar bstan pa'i 'bras bu de yang yod la /
translated: The result of the powers is just as the result of the faculties has been explained.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsrabs par lhag pa'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsrabs par lhag pa'o //
translated: The adverse side, such as lack of faith, is reduced.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams la dmigs pa dang // ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mtshungs pa yod du zin kyang brdzi bar mi nus pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs tha dad par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams la dmigs pa dang // ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mtshungs pa yod du zin kyang brdzi bar mi nus pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs tha dad par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, even though there is similarity of objective, nature, etc., they are explained as separate elements leading to enlightenment because they cannot be reduced to one.

original: stobs bshad zin to //
analyzed: stobs bshad zin to //
translated: The powers have been explained.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa bzhi pas byang chub kyi phyogs bcu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa bzhi pas byang chub kyi phyogs bcu bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, the four kinds of generation of the will include the thirty-seven elements of enlightenment.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa 'di la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste /üîΩde la 'jug pa ni lam de la 'gro bar rtsom pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'dzegs nas 'gro bar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / rab tu dga' ba nas brtsams te sa bdun pa'i bar du dang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa 'di la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste / de la 'jug pa ni lam de la 'gro bar rtsom pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'dzegs nas 'gro bar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / rab tu dga' ba nas brtsams te sa bdun pa'i bar du dang /
translated: This fourth generation of the will is also called the ‚Äúentrance into practice.‚ÄùüîΩIn this regard, the master Vasubandhu explains that ‚Äúentrance‚Äù is the beginning of the path, the path itself, and the path of progress, respectively, on the stage of action in faith, on the first seven stages beginning with the stage of joy,

original: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen bzhed do //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes slob dpon dbyig gnyen bzhed do //
translated: and on the immovable stage, etc.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sar lhag par mos pas 'gro ba rtsom mo //
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sar lhag par mos pas 'gro ba rtsom mo //
translated: One proceeds by way of superior devotion on the stage of action in faith.

original: sa bdun du rtsol ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sa bdun du rtsol ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: One proceeds by way of effort on the seven stages.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs par rtsol ba med par shing rta legs par drangs pa bzhin du 'gro'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs par rtsol ba med par shing rta legs par drangs pa bzhin du 'gro'o //
translated: One proceeds without effort on the eighth stage, like a well-driven chariot.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa bzhi pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa bzhi pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with the fourth generation of the Thought,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: the establishment of the entrance is up to the stage of Buddha.

original: des na sems bskyed pa bzhi pa la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sems bskyed pa bzhi pa la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the entrance is made in the fourth generation of the Thought.

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos mchog nas brtsams te sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la gzhag ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos mchog nas brtsams te sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la gzhag ste /
translated: The establishment of the equipment is from the supreme mundane qualities up to the stage of Buddha.

original: 'dis byang chub chen po rdzogs par byed pa'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis byang chub chen po rdzogs par byed pa'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the equipment which perfects the great enlightenment.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, in brief, it is twofold:

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: the equipment of merit and the equipment of knowledge.

original: de dag sgrub pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sgrub pa ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of those is the establishment of the equipment.

original: bsod nams dang @31a * //
analyzed: bsod nams dang @31a * //
translated: The equipment of merit is the equipment of the six perfections.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs sngar sems bskyed pa gsum pa drod la sogs pa gsum gyi gnas skabs su bsags su zin kyang de ltar na yang 'jig rten chos mchog nas brtsams te rab tu son pa yin pas 'di nas bzung ste tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i rnam gzhag byed
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs sngar sems bskyed pa gsum pa drod la sogs pa gsum gyi gnas skabs su bsags su zin kyang de ltar na yang 'jig rten chos mchog nas brtsams te rab tu son pa yin pas 'di nas bzung ste tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i rnam gzhag byed
translated: However, since one has now reached the stage beginning with the supreme mundane quality, from here on the presentation of the accumulation is made.

original: do // sems bskyed pa bzhi pa 'di me lta bu yang yin te /
analyzed: do // sems bskyed pa bzhi pa 'di me lta bu yang yin te /
translated: This fourth arousal of mind is also like fire.

original: des khyad par du rtogs pa mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: des khyad par du rtogs pa mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the supreme realization by that means.

original: ji lta bur bud shing gi khyad par gyis me mchog tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji lta bur bud shing gi khyad par gyis me mchog tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as fire becomes supreme through the particular quality of its fuel.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi po 'di rnams la brda las byung ba dang / kun rdzob kyi dang / 'jig rten pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi po 'di rnams la brda las byung ba dang / kun rdzob kyi dang / 'jig rten pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: These four arousals of mind are called the one arisen from signs, the conventional, and the mundane.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the ultimate and the supramundane.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi dang / sbyor ba'i lam bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi dang / sbyor ba'i lam bshad zin to //
translated: The four arousals of mind and the path of preparation have been explained.

original: de la sems bskyed pa lnga ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid can dang / sa rab tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid can dang / 'jug pa dang ; tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid can dang /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa lnga ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid can dang / sa rab tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid can dang / 'jug pa dang ; tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid can dang /
translated: The five kinds of generation of the Thought are: that which is of the nature of the Path of Seeing, that which is of the nature of the Ground of Joy, that which is of the nature of the entrance, that which is of the nature of the practice of the accumulation, and that which is of the nature of the branches of enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / gter chen po lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / gter chen po lta bu'o //
translated: It is accompanied by the perfection of giving, and is like a great treasure.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi de ma thag tu mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyi mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi de ma thag tu mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: In brief, the Path of Seeing is the non-apprehending samadhi and the wisdom that is concomitant with it, immediately after the supreme mundane qualities.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid can no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid can no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood to have the characteristic of non-conceptual calm abiding and special insight.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam par shes pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam par shes pa yang de yin te /
translated: It is also the knowledge of equality, because the object of observation and the observer are equalized.

original: de yang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa de kho na nyid mngon du byas pas so //
analyzed: de yang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa de kho na nyid mngon du byas pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is by the realization of the reality of the apprehended and apprehender.üîΩ

original: rang gi rgyud la sems can gyi brda dang / chos kyi brda gsal ba dang / thams cad du gnyis ka'i brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'ang de yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la sems can gyi brda dang / chos kyi brda gsal ba dang / thams cad du gnyis ka'i brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'ang de yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the knowledge of the teaching that has as its object the manifestation of the conventional symbols of sentient beings, the manifestation of the conventional symbol of the teaching, and the manifestation of the conventional symbols of both in all their aspects, through the realization of the reality of the grasped and grasper.

original: des rang gi rgyud la bdag gis mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa med pas sems can gyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: des rang gi rgyud la bdag gis mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa med pas sems can gyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the teaching that has as its object the manifestation of the conventional symbol of sentient beings in one's own mental continuum, because one does not conceive of the signs of self.

original: rang gi rgyud la chos la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog pas chos kyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la chos la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi rtog pas chos kyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the teaching that has as its object the manifestation of the conventional symbol of the teaching in one's own mental continuum, because one does not conceive of the signs of the teaching, etc.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud gnyis ka la khyad par med par bdag dang / chos mtshan mar mi rtog pas thams cad du @31b gnyis ka'i brda gsal bas dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud gnyis ka la khyad par med par bdag dang / chos mtshan mar mi rtog pas thams cad du @31b gnyis ka'i brda gsal bas dmigs pa'i chos shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the teaching that has as its object the manifestation of the conventional symbols of both in all their aspects in one's own mental continuum and in the mental continua of others, because one does not conceive of the signs of self and of the teaching in either one's own or in others' mental continua.

analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang /

analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o zhes pa ni skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of cessation, the subsequent knowledge of cessation, the acceptance of the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to the path, the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to the path, the acceptance of the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path, and the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the acceptance of the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to suffering is the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi chos ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas chos bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi chos ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas chos bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The doctrine of suffering is the teaching of the doctrine that is based on the truth of suffering.

original: shes pa ni sbyor ba'i lam du sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'i chos la spyod pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni sbyor ba'i lam du sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'i chos la spyod pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the knowledge of the teaching that is based on the truth of suffering in the path of application.

original: bzod pa ni sngar rnam par dpyad pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bdag nyid mngon du gyur pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni sngar rnam par dpyad pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i bdag nyid mngon du gyur pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Acceptance is the uncontaminated wisdom that is the realization of the truth of suffering through the power of previous analysis.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal mthong ba'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal mthong ba'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching on suffering is the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam du sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa'i chos la tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa'i dbang du byas pa 'dis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du gyur pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i rang bzhin shes rab skyes pa ste /

original: gang gis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad spong ba de nyid du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad spong ba de nyid du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching on suffering is the abandonment of the twenty-eight negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni shes pa gang gis bzod pa'i de ma thag rnam par grol ba mngon du @32a * //üîΩbyed pa ste /

original: bzod pa des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas rten gnas gyur te ye shes gang gis gnas gyur pa /
analyzed: bzod pa des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas rten gnas gyur te ye shes gang gis gnas gyur pa /

original: rtogs pa de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that realizes the transformation of the basis is called Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

translated: Subsequent perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering is the uncontaminated wisdom that is individually cognized immediately after Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, thinking, these two, perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering are the causes of arya Dharmas.

original: bzod pa dang shes rab 'di gnyis slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes rab 'di gnyis slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /

analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi lam gyi yul de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The object of the path of the side of the knowledge of the doctrine is suchness.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyi lam gyi yul yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyi lam gyi yul yang dag pa'i ye shes so //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ni gzung bar rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, by means of the perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine and the knowledge of the doctrine, one realizes the apprehended.

analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis ni 'dzin par rtogs so //
translated: By means of the perseverance for subsequent knowledge and the subsequent knowledge, one realizes the apprehender.

analyzed: zhes bya'o // bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad la mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i rnal 'byor can du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that all the perseverance and knowledge are practitioners who abide in the signless.

original: sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po 'di rnams ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po 'di rnams ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: These sixteen moments of mind are the path of seeing.

original: des sngar ma mthong ba'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: des sngar ma mthong ba'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba ste /
translated: By means of that, one sees the four truths that were not seen before.

original: mngon sum du byas pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one actualizes them.

original: 'dir sems kyi skad cig ni sngar ma skyes pa skyes pa tsam la sems kyi skad @32b cig ces brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir sems kyi skad cig ni sngar ma skyes pa skyes pa tsam la sems kyi skad @32b cig ces brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the moment of mind is not to be called the moment of mind merely in terms of the arising of what has not arisen before.

original: 'on kyang dus ji srid du shes bya la shes pa 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de la sems kyi skad cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dus ji srid du shes bya la shes pa 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de la sems kyi skad cig ces bya'o //
translated: But the time when the arising of consciousness in regard to the object of knowledge is complete is called a moment of mind.

original: gzhan gyi ni gzhan du 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni gzhan du 'dod do //
translated: Others believe that it is different.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin can sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba brgyad la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin can sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba brgyad la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because the latter are the path of immediate succession to the relinquishment of moral defilement, the eight, such as the perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching with regard to suffering, are described as the path of immediate succession.

original: de la sdug bsngal la sogs pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la sogs pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By means of the perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching with regard to suffering, etc., the moral defilements of the desire realm that are to be relinquished by means of vision are completely relinquished.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By means of the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, etc., the moral defilements of the realms of form and formlessness that are to be relinquished by means of vision are completely relinquished.

original: des na bzod pa brgyad nyon mongs pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: des na bzod pa brgyad nyon mongs pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Thus, the eight perseverances are of the nature of the path of immediate succession to the relinquishment of moral defilement.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin can nyon mongs pa dang bral ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa brgyad la chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin can nyon mongs pa dang bral ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa brgyad la chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eight knowledges that manifest the support that is free from the afflictions, which have the nature of the liberated paths, are called the knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge.

original: de la chos shes pa rnams kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rten mngon du byed do //
analyzed: de la chos shes pa rnams kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rten mngon du byed do //
translated: The knowledge of the doctrine manifest the support that is free from the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rten mngon du byed do //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rten mngon du byed do //
translated: Subsequent knowledge manifests the support that is free from the afflictions of the form and formless realms that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de dang lhan cig tu spyod pa brgyad kyi nang nas chos shes pa'i bzod pa rtogs pa'i nges pa'i shes pa bzhi la chos shes pa zhes rnam gzhag bya'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu spyod pa brgyad kyi nang nas chos shes pa'i bzod pa rtogs pa'i nges pa'i shes pa bzhi la chos shes pa zhes rnam gzhag bya'o //
translated: From among the eight that accompany those, the four definite knowledges that realize the perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine are posited as the knowledge of the doctrine.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rtogs pa'i nges pa'i shes pa bzhi la rjes su shes pa zhes rnam gzhag bya na 'o na gzhan du rnam par grol ba'i mngon du byed pa'i shes pa kho na la chos shes pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rtogs pa'i nges pa'i shes pa bzhi la rjes su shes pa zhes rnam gzhag bya na 'o na gzhan du rnam par grol ba'i mngon du byed pa'i shes pa kho na la chos shes pa zhes brjod la /
translated: If the four subsequent knowledges are posited as subsequent patience and subsequent definite knowledge, then it would contradict other sources, which state that the knowledge that directly manifests liberation is Dharma knowledge.

original: chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges pa'i shes pa la yang 'gal lo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges pa'i shes pa la yang 'gal lo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: And it would contradict the statement that Dharma patience is definite knowledge.

original: gnas skabs 'dir shin tu goms pa'i gnas skabs ma yin pas shin tu gsal ba med pa'i phyir snang ba dang nges pa dag gis bzod pas de kho na nyid mngon du byas so zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir shin tu goms pa'i gnas skabs ma yin pas shin tu gsal ba med pa'i phyir snang ba dang nges pa dag gis bzod pas de kho na nyid mngon du byas so zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: But that is not so, because at this stage it is not a stage of complete familiarity and thus it is not very clear. Therefore it is posited that it is patience that manifests thatness through appearance and definite knowledge.

original: de nas bzod pa'i de ma thag tu nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig tu spyod pa'i nges pa'i shes pa yang khas len dgos kyi chos shes pa'i bzod pa la nges pa khas mi len pa rigs @33a

translated: Then immediately after patience, it is necessary to accept that it is definite knowledge that accompanies the knowledge that directly manifests liberation from affliction. It is not logical to accept that Dharma patience is definite knowledge.

analyzed: * // pa ma yin no //

translated: If one does not accept that there is a certitude with regard to the receptivity to the cognition of the factors,

analyzed: shes pa gang gis rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa nges par byed pa de la /
