original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa yang nges par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa yang nges par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: there will be no certitude with regard to the receptivity to the subsequent cognition.

original: de'i phyir chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges pa chos shes pas bsdus pa yin no //üîΩgal te de ltar mi 'dod na chos shes pa'i bzod pa la nges pa yod dam med /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges pa chos shes pas bsdus pa yin no // gal te de ltar mi 'dod na chos shes pa'i bzod pa la nges pa yod dam med /
translated: Thus, the certitude with regard to the receptivity to the cognition of the factors is included in the cognition of the factors.üîΩIf one does not accept this, is there or is there not a certitude with regard to the receptivity to the cognition of the factors?

original: gal te yod na chos shes pa la mi brjod na gang la brjod /
analyzed: gal te yod na chos shes pa la mi brjod na gang la brjod /
translated: If there is, why not say that it is the cognition of the factors?

original: gal te med na mngon du byed do zhes ji ltar tha snyad 'dogs /
analyzed: gal te med na mngon du byed do zhes ji ltar tha snyad 'dogs /
translated: If there is not, how can one say that it is realized?

original: gal te shin tu gsal ba yin pas bzod pa dang shes pas mngon du byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shin tu gsal ba yin pas bzod pa dang shes pas mngon du byed do zhe na /
translated: If one says that it is very clear and is realized by the receptivity and the cognition,

original: 'o na rjes su shes pa rnams kyang mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su shes pa rnams kyang mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Well, then, subsequent cognition would have the nature of manifesting,

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but would not have the nature of ascertaining.

original: gzhan yang shin tu gsal ba khas mi len na rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa med pas da ltar nyid du rtogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin pas sangs rgyas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang shin tu gsal ba khas mi len na rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa med pas da ltar nyid du rtogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin pas sangs rgyas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you do not accept that it is very clear, then since there would be no affliction and no obscuration to omniscience that has the nature of conception, all realizations would be completely perfect in the present and it would follow that there would be buddhahood.

original: gal te shin tu gsal ba med kyang nges pa yod de /
analyzed: gal te shin tu gsal ba med kyang nges pa yod de /
translated: If you say that even though it is not very clear, it is ascertained,

original: de la bzod pa yang mi zer chos shes pa yang mi zer zhe na /
analyzed: de la bzod pa yang mi zer chos shes pa yang mi zer zhe na /
translated: then it is not called acceptance and it is not called Dharma knowledge.

original: 'o na rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la nges pa la yang rjes su shes pa zhes mi zer bas mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la nges pa la yang rjes su shes pa zhes mi zer bas mthong ba'i lam skad cig bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Well, then, since it is not called subsequent cognition with regard to subsequent cognition that is acceptance, the path of seeing would have the nature of twelve moments.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa las grol ba mngon du byed pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa nges pa'i shes pa brgyad la yang chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa zhes brjod dgos so //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir mngon pa la sogs pa gang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la nges pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa las grol ba mngon du byed pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa nges pa'i shes pa brgyad la yang chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa zhes brjod dgos so // de nyid kyi phyir mngon pa la sogs pa gang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la nges pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the direct realization of liberation from the afflictions and the eight knowledges that definitely accompany it must be called knowledge of the truth and subsequent knowledge.üîΩTherefore, the Abhidharmasamuccaya and so on teach that the knowledge of the truth of suffering is definite in the perseverance for subsequent knowledge.

original: chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges pa'i nye bar mtshon pa nyid du bstan pas 'gal ba med do ;
analyzed: chos shes pa'i bzod pa nges pa'i nye bar mtshon pa nyid du bstan pas 'gal ba med do ;
translated: But this does not contradict the explanation that the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering is definite in the knowledge of the truth of suffering, because it is taught as an illustration.

original: /'di'i gdams ngag 'di yin te /
analyzed: /'di'i gdams ngag 'di yin te /
translated: The instruction here is as follows.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa so sor rtog pas sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa so sor rtog pas sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The discernment that forms and so on are primordially unarisen is called the moment of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering and the nature of the nonobservation of the characteristics of suffering.

original: de kho @33b na la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de kho @33b na la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: That is also called perseverance for the nonarising of that truth.

original: skad cig ma de yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'brel ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma de yang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin zung du 'brel ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: And that moment is free from the union of wisdom and samadhi.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de'i rjes thob la chos 'di rnams ni stong pa nyid kho na'o zhes rnam par dag pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rang gi rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa gang skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rten mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de'i rjes thob la chos 'di rnams ni stong pa nyid kho na'o zhes rnam par dag pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rang gi rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa gang skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rten mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that arises in the post-meditation of that supramundane wisdom, which ascertains one's realization through the characteristic of pure emptiness, thinking, These phenomena are only emptiness, and the knowledge that actualizes the basis free from the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the suffering of the desire realm, is the knowledge of phenomena with regard to suffering.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin dang / dngos po dang dngos po med par brjod du med pa'o snyam du rab tu shes nas yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye ba de nyid rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin dang / dngos po dang dngos po med par brjod du med pa'o snyam du rab tu shes nas yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab skye ba de nyid rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Having understood thus, the subsequent acquiescence in the knowledge of the path is the arising of that very supramundane wisdom which is inexpressible.

original: de'i tshe khams gsum pa'i chos rnams la brjod du med pa nyid so sor rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe khams gsum pa'i chos rnams la brjod du med pa nyid so sor rtogs te /
translated: At that time, one realizes the inexpressibility of the phenomena of the three realms,

original: skad cig ma gnyis kyis thob pas shes rab tu gyur pa yin pas so //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis kyis thob pas shes rab tu gyur pa yin pas so //
translated: because one has attained them by means of two moments, and they have become wisdom.

original: sngar ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal shin tu drag pa yin pa dang / shes rab tu gyur pa med pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi chos rnams kho na la brjod du med pa nyid so sor rtogs so //
analyzed: sngar ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal shin tu drag pa yin pa dang / shes rab tu gyur pa med pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi chos rnams kho na la brjod du med pa nyid so sor rtogs so //
translated: Previously, one realized the inexpressibility of the phenomena of the desire realm alone, because the suffering of the desire realm is very intense, and because the phenomena of the desire realm have not become wisdom.

original: 'di yang de dag dang mtshungs pa dang / de'i rgyu can yin pa dang / de shes pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang de dag dang mtshungs pa dang / de'i rgyu can yin pa dang / de shes pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is similar to those, and it is called subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path because it is the cause of those, and because it is the pursuit of the knowledge of that.

original: de nas de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i de kho na nyid nges pa'i shes pa gang skye ba de'i rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i de kho na nyid nges pa'i shes pa gang skye ba de'i rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, the knowledge that ascertains the inexpressible reality of all phenomena that arises in the same way is called subsequent knowledge.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la yang bzod pa dang / shes pa shes par bya'o //üîΩsngar chos shes pa'i bzod pa khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la yang bzod pa dang / shes pa shes par bya'o // sngar chos shes pa'i bzod pa khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po nyid du bstan la /
translated: Similarly, one should understand the knowledge and perseverance of the truths of origin, cessation and path.üîΩPreviously, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge was taught to be the antidote of the three realms to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: phyis ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen por bstan no //
analyzed: phyis ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen por bstan no //
translated: Later, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge was taught to be the antidote of the desire realm to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rnams gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen por bstan no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rnams gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen por bstan no //
translated: The subsequent receptivities are taught as the antidotes to the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that are related to the form and formless realms.

original: de la bzod pa brgyad ni nyon mongs pa srang ba la rkun po 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bya ba byed do //üîΩshes @34a * //
analyzed: de la bzod pa brgyad ni nyon mongs pa srang ba la rkun po 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bya ba byed do // shes @34a * //
translated: Among those, the eight receptivities function like thieves who steal the afflictions.

original: pa brgyad ni sgo 'phar gcod pa'i tshul gyis bya ba byed do //
analyzed: pa brgyad ni sgo 'phar gcod pa'i tshul gyis bya ba byed do //
translated: The eight knowledges function like a doorkeeper.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang /
translated: In the desire realm, there are five views: attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, and doubt.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas so sor bcu bcur spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bzhi bcu chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas so sor bcu bcur spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bzhi bcu chos shes pa'i bzod pa bzhis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The four forbearing-knowledges of dharma eliminate the forty views of the self, the extreme views, the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices, and the esteeming of views, which are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: de la 'dod chags ni khams gsum pa'i rjes su chags pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ni khams gsum pa'i rjes su chags pa ste /
translated: Desire is the attachment of the three realms.

original: sred pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga grub par byed pas sdug bsngal skyed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: sred pa'i dbang gis nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga grub par byed pas sdug bsngal skyed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of producing suffering, because it causes the five aggregates to be established through the power of craving.

original: khong khro ba ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas su gyur ba'i chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas su gyur ba'i chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
translated: Anger is the complete irritation of sentient beings toward suffering and the phenomena that are the basis of suffering.

original: reg par mi gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: reg par mi gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: It has the function of supporting the performance of evil actions, because it does not allow one to remain in contact with others.

original: kun nas mnar sems pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas pas reg par mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas pas reg par mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It does not allow one to remain in contact with others, because it is the basis of the suffering of complete irritation.

original: nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas sems khengs pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas sems khengs pa ste /
translated: Arrogance is the inflation of the mind based on the false view of individuality.

original: mi gus pa dang / sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: mi gus pa dang / sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to serve as the basis for disrespect and for the arising of suffering.

original: de la mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang yon tan can rnams la gyong ba'o //
analyzed: de la mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang yon tan can rnams la gyong ba'o //
translated: Disrespect is the lack of reverence for gurus and those who have good qualities.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni yang srid par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni yang srid par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The arising of suffering should be understood as the arising of future suffering.

original: ma rig pa ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa ste /
translated: Ignorance is the lack of understanding in the three realms.

original: chos rnams la log par nges pa dang / the tshom dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: chos rnams la log par nges pa dang / the tshom dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to serve as the basis for the arising of false certainty, doubt, and affliction.

original: log par nges pa ni phyin ci log tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: log par nges pa ni phyin ci log tu nges pa'o //
translated: False certainty is the certainty of error.

original: the tshom ni som nyi'o //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba //
analyzed: the tshom ni som nyi'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung ba //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty.üîΩThe arising of affliction is the arising of the afflictions such as desire.

original: de'i rten byed pa ni rmongs par gyur na nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten byed pa ni rmongs par gyur na nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It serves as the basis for the arising of affliction because when one is confused, all the afflictions arise.

original: the tshom ni bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom ni bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba ste /
translated: Doubt is a two-pointedness of mind with regard to the truths.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support non-engagement in virtue.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa ni des dge ba'i phyogs lam gyi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i @34b bden pa la ji ltar rigs par mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa ni des dge ba'i phyogs lam gyi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i @34b bden pa la ji ltar rigs par mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Non-engagement in virtue means not engaging in the side of virtue, the truth of the path and the truth of cessation, as is appropriate.

original: de'i rten byed pa ni nges pa ma skyes na mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten byed pa ni nges pa ma skyes na mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It supports that because, if certainty has not arisen, one does not engage in virtue.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su mthong bas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su mthong bas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The afflicted view of the self is the view that sees the appropriated aggregates as a self or that which belongs to the self.

original: lta ba thams cad brten pa'i las can no ;üîΩ/ mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la rtag pa 'am /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad brten pa'i las can no ; / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la rtag pa 'am /
translated: Its action is to support all views.üîΩThe view holding to an extreme is the view that sees the five appropriated aggregates as permanent or

original: chad bar yang dag par rjes su mthong nas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chad bar yang dag par rjes su mthong nas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: as annihilated.

original: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct the path of the middle way.

original: dbu ma'i lam ni rtag pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa spangs nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam ni rtag pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa spangs nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: The path of the middle way is the knowledge of dependent origination, which avoids the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba dang lta ba'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam par yang dag par rjes su mthong bas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba dang lta ba'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam par yang dag par rjes su mthong bas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The grasping of false views as supreme is the view that the five aggregates which are the basis of the false views are supreme, foremost, superior, and the best.

original: lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to serve as the basis for attachment to false views.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i yang dag par rjes su mthong nas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i yang dag par rjes su mthong nas lta ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the view that one should hold that morality and asceticism are supreme, and that the five appropriated aggregates which are the basis of morality and asceticism are pure, liberating, and conducive to definite release.

original: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It functions as the basis for fruitless striving.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni lta ba ngan pa sngon du song bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni lta ba ngan pa sngon du song bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Morality and asceticism are preceded by wrong views.

original: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa ni des nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngal ba 'bras bu med pa ni des nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is fruitless striving because it does not lead to definite release.

original: log par lta ba ni rgyu 'am ;
analyzed: log par lta ba ni rgyu 'am ;
translated: Wrong view is the view that there is no cause, no effect,üîΩno asceticism, no knower,

original: 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'am /
translated: no realization,üîΩno attainment, no nonattainment.

original: bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par log pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dam du 'dzin pa'i rten byed pa'i las can dang /
analyzed: bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po 'jig par log pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dam du 'dzin pa'i rten byed pa'i las can dang /
translated: It has the function of supporting the false conception that denies action and the false conception that denies things that exist, and it supports the cutting off of the roots of virtue and the intensification of the roots of evil.

original: mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang / dge ba la mi 'jug pa'i las can no //
analyzed: mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang / dge ba la mi 'jug pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of engaging in evil and not engaging in virtue.

original: de la sbyin pa med do //üîΩmchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa med do // mchod sbyin med do //
translated: In this regard, the denial of giving,

original: sbyin sreg med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do //
translated: denial of sacrifice,üîΩdenial of offerings to spiritual benefactors,

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: denial of good conduct,

original: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes pa 'di ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs so //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do zhes pa 'di ni rgyu la skur pa 'debs so //
translated: and denial of evil conduct is the denial of cause.

original: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes pa @35a * //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes pa @35a * //
translated: The denial that there is any result of good or evil conduct

original: 'di ni 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'o //üîΩ'jig rten 'di ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'o // 'jig rten 'di ni med do //
translated: is the denial of result.üîΩThe denial of this world and the next

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //üîΩpha med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do // pha med do //
translated: is the denial of reality.

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: The denial of father and motherüîΩis the denial of spiritual benefactors.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i bya ba dang ; sa bon 'debs pa'i bya ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i bya ba dang ; sa bon 'debs pa'i bya ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i bya ba la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is a denial of action, because it denies the action of going to another world, the action of planting seeds, and the action of linking.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'o //
translated: The denial that there are arhats in the world, etc., is the destruction of an existent thing.

original: de las gzhan tshangs pa la sogs pa byed pa po yin no zhes phyin ci log tu rtog pa thams cad la log par rnam par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan tshangs pa la sogs pa byed pa po yin no zhes phyin ci log tu rtog pa thams cad la log par rnam par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: All other wrong views, such as the belief that Brahma, etc., is the creator, should be understood as wrong imagination.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni log par lta ba khyad par can las 'byung gi / thams cad las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni log par lta ba khyad par can las 'byung gi / thams cad las ni ma yin no //
translated: The severance of the wholesome roots occurs through a special kind of wrong view, not through any other.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Among the views of individuality and the views concerning the extremes, there are two kinds:

original: brtags pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: imaginative and innate.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni brtags pa'o //
translated: The investigation is that which is preceded by listening to non-sacred teachings, etc.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bde bar gyur cig sdug bsngal bar ma gyur cig snyam pa'i sred pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bde bar gyur cig sdug bsngal bar ma gyur cig snyam pa'i sred pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The innate identity view is associated with the craving that thinks, ‚ÄúMay I be happy! May I not suffer!‚Äù

original: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gros gang //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i blo gros gang //
translated: The innate identity view is the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de ni lhan skyes 'jig tshogs lta //
analyzed: de ni lhan skyes 'jig tshogs lta //
translated: This is the innate identity view.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni gang gis mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba byed pa la skrag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni gang gis mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba byed pa la skrag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The innate view grasping an extreme is that by which one is frightened by the practice of realization.

original: lta ba gzhan ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
translated: The other views are fully discriminated.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Among them, the innate identity view and the view grasping an extreme are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pas lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs yun ring po nas gnas pa yin pas bsgom pa'i lam kho nas spang bar bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas goms pa yin pas lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs yun ring po nas gnas pa yin pas bsgom pa'i lam kho nas spang bar bya ba yin pas so //
translated: Since it is cultivated from beginningless time, the innate afflicted view of the self and so on are abandoned by the path of meditation alone because they abide for a long time.

original: de la rtag pa'i lta ba dang / brtags pa'i lta ba la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba la gegs byed pa yin pas chos shes pa'i bzod pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa bzhi bcu spong bar @35b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i lta ba dang / brtags pa'i lta ba la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba la gegs byed pa yin pas chos shes pa'i bzod pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa bzhi bcu spong bar @35b 'gyur ro //
translated: Attachment, anger, pride, ignorance and doubt that focus on the view of permanence and the view of imputation obstruct the path of seeing that is the truths of suffering, origin, cessation and path. Therefore the perseverance for Dharma knowledge abandons the forty afflictions of the desire realm.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas nyon mongs pa bcu po de rnams la khong khro phri bas gzugs kyi khams na sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba so sor dgu dgu yin pas sum cu rtsa drug spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas nyon mongs pa bcu po de rnams la khong khro phri bas gzugs kyi khams na sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba so sor dgu dgu yin pas sum cu rtsa drug spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The subsequent perseverance for knowing, by subtracting anger from those ten afflictions, abandons thirty six: nine objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, origin, path and cessation in the form realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su yang sum cu rtsa drug yin pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nyon mongs pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis spong bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su yang sum cu rtsa drug yin pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su nyon mongs pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis spong bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Similarly, since there are thirty six in the formless realm, it abandons seventy two afflictions in the form and formless realms.

original: de ltar bsdoms na nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa gnyis mthong ba'i lam gyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsdoms na nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa gnyis mthong ba'i lam gyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when combined, the path of seeing abandons eighty two afflictions.

analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug bshad pa la phyogs dang po ji ltar byas nas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa kho nas 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba yin pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa so sor 'dod pa'i khams kyi bcu dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi dgu dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dgu ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad spong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho nas nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa gnyis spong bar 'gyur bas so // de ltar skad cig ma bcu drug ni mthong ba'i lam mo //

analyzed: lam la yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med par yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de la lam @36a * //

analyzed: de ltar yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i spyod yul bstan pa'i mdo las 'jam dpal 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the four noble truths be understood?

analyzed: lha'i bu 'dir gang gis 'du byed thams cad rang bzhin gyis skye ba med par mthong ba des sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o // gang gis chos thams cad tshad pa med par mthong ba des kun 'byung spang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Divine son, whoever sees all conditioned things as not intrinsically arising fully understands suffering.üîΩWhoever sees all phenomena as immeasurable abandons the origins of suffering.

original: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu mya ngan las 'das bar mthong ba des 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu mya ngan las 'das bar mthong ba des 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly nirvƒÅ·πáa actualizes cessation.

original: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu stong zhing ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med par mthong ba des lam bsgoms pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad shin tu stong zhing ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med par mthong ba des lam bsgoms pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly empty and intrinsically non-arisen cultivates the path.

original: des na chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho nas skad cig ma gcig la de kho na nyid rtogs pas blta bar bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la skad cig ma bcu drug gi rnam gzhag ci ltar byed /

translated: Why is there a presentation of sixteen moments on the path of seeing?

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason it is said:üîΩThe single entity of the object‚Äôs own nature

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la //
translated: is directly perceived by the self.üîΩWhat is there to be analyzed

original: tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
translated: by other valid knowledges?

original: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod // ces gsungs so //
translated: What other part is not seen?

original: 'di'i don ni sngon po la sogs pa cha dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po gcig la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sngon po la sogs pa cha dang bral ba rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du byas pa'i dngos po gcig la /
translated: The meaning of this is that in one thing, such as blue, which is free from parts and is directly perceived in all aspects,

original: cha gzhan mi rtag pa la sogs pa ma mthong bar 'gyur ba gang la rjes dpag la sogs pa'i tshad mas rtogs par byed /
analyzed: cha gzhan mi rtag pa la sogs pa ma mthong bar 'gyur ba gang la rjes dpag la sogs pa'i tshad mas rtogs par byed /
translated: what other part, such as impermanence, is not seen that is to be realized by other valid knowledges, such as inference?

original: des na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i yul can rjes su dpag pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i yul can rjes su dpag pa don med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it is pointless to have a subject, such as impermanence, that is inferred.

original: mngon sum kho nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa rtags pas so zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum kho nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa rtags pas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that impermanence and so on are realized by direct perception alone,

original: de kho na nyid la cha shas med pas skad cig ma gcig la de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas pas so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas na mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma gcig kho na yin pa de bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la cha shas med pas skad cig ma gcig la de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas pas so sor rtog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas na mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma gcig kho na yin pa de bden mod kyi /
translated: it is true that, from the perspective of the manifest realization of the individual investigation of the mode of being of things, the path of seeing is a single moment, since the mode of being of things is not divisible into parts.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i rnam pa gzhan gsal ba'i sgo nas nges pa la ltos te skad cig ma bcu drug gi rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i rnam pa gzhan gsal ba'i sgo nas nges pa la ltos te skad cig ma bcu drug gi rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
translated: However, from the perspective of the ascertainment of the mode of being of things by means of the elimination of other superimposed features, the path of seeing is posited as being sixteen moments.

original: dper na sngon po dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'tsher ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can autpala mthong nas rnam par rtog pa rim par skye par yod du zin kyang rtog med kyi shes pa des yul rnam pa thams cad du mngon du byas pa la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: dper na sngon po dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'tsher ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can autpala mthong nas rnam par rtog pa rim par skye par yod du zin kyang rtog med kyi shes pa des yul rnam pa thams cad du mngon du byas pa la gnod pa med do //
translated: For example, even though the cognition of a blue lotus with its features, such as impermanence and radiance, arises in sequence, this does not undermine the fact that the nonconceptual cognition has actualized the object in all its aspects.

original: 'di @36b ltar gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas sngon po'i dngos po mthong ba de'i tshe sngon po dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams tha dad med pa ste /
