translated: Thus, when a nonconceptual consciousness sees a blue thing, at that time blue and impermanence and so on are not different,

original: tha dad du snang ba med pas so //
analyzed: tha dad du snang ba med pas so //
translated: because they appear undifferentiable.

original: de'i phyir sngon po dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams tha dad pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams tha dad pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, since blue and impermanence and so on are not different,

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can sngon po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas 'dzin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can sngon po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas 'dzin te /
translated: a nonconceptual consciousness apprehends blue and so on that have such a nature.

original: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa yin pas so //
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa yin pas so //
translated: Since it apprehends things as they are,

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar dngos po la tha mi dad par gnas pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar dngos po la tha mi dad par gnas pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
translated: if blue and so on are not apprehended by a nonconceptual consciousness in accordance with how they exist as undifferentiable from things,

original: rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa 'khrul pa yin pas tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pa 'khrul pa yin pas tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then because that consciousness free from conceptuality would be mistaken, it would not be a valid cognition.

original: des na bdag nyid thams cad kyi cha shas med pa'i dngos po mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid thams cad kyi cha shas med pa'i dngos po mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the thing that is devoid of all parts is perceived.

original: yang phyis kyi dus su sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rnams rim gyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang phyis kyi dus su sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rnams rim gyis 'jug ste /
translated: Later, the conceptual thoughts arise in sequence, by way of eliminating superimpositions.

original: dper na nya phyis la dngul gyi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i sgo nas nya phyis nyid do zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de bzhin du sngon po ma yin pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i sgo nas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rim par 'jug go //
analyzed: dper na nya phyis la dngul gyi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i sgo nas nya phyis nyid do zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de bzhin du sngon po ma yin pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i sgo nas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rim par 'jug go //
translated: For example, the conceptual thought ‚Äúmother-of-pearl is mother-of-pearl‚Äù arises by way of eliminating the superimposition that mother-of-pearl is silver. In the same way, the conceptual thought ‚Äúblue‚Äù arises by way of eliminating the superimposition that it is not blue, permanent, and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya ste /
translated: You should understand this example in the same way here.

original: 'di ltar yang skad cig ma gcig la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang skad cig ma gcig la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: In this way, in a single moment, the reality characterized by the emptiness of the four noble truths is perceived.

original: dus phyis stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad nas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin can rim pa skyes su zin kyang skad cig ma gcig la de kho na nyid mngonüîΩsum du byas pa la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: dus phyis stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa rnam par bcad nas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rang bzhin can rim pa skyes su zin kyang skad cig ma gcig la de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas pa la gnod pa med do //
translated: Even though it arises in stages, there is no contradiction in the direct perception of reality occurring in a single moment.

original: des na dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad kyis rtogs su zin kyang /
analyzed: des na dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad kyis rtogs su zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, even though the nature of things is completely realized,

original: cha shes gang la goms pa dang gsal ba la sogs pas nges pa skye ba'i sgo nas sgro 'dogs pa gcod pa'i nus pa yod pa de kho na la shes pa de tshad mar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: cha shes gang la goms pa dang gsal ba la sogs pas nges pa skye ba'i sgo nas sgro 'dogs pa gcod pa'i nus pa yod pa de kho na la shes pa de tshad mar 'gyur gyi /
translated: the cognition that has the ability to eliminate superimpositions through the generation of ascertainment by way of familiarity and clarity with a portion of that object is valid cognition.

original: gzhan la ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin te /
translated: It is not the other.

original: skad cig ma la sogs pa la'ang de bzhin no //üîΩde ltar nges pa la ltos nas mthong ba'i lam la skad cig ma bcu drug gi @37a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma la sogs pa la'ang de bzhin no // de ltar nges pa la ltos nas mthong ba'i lam la skad cig ma bcu drug gi @37a * //
translated: The same is true of moments and so on.

original: rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
translated: In that way, in dependence on ascertainment, the path of seeing is posited as having sixteen moments.

original: 'o na so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa rnams la khyad par ci yod ces pa brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa rnams la khyad par ci yod ces pa brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Well then, what is the difference between ordinary beings and ƒÅryas?

original: rnam pa ji tsam cig bsal bas de rnams kyis shes pa 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma dang bral ba de tsam gyis 'phags pa rnams la khyad par yod pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa ji tsam cig bsal bas de rnams kyis shes pa 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma dang bral ba de tsam gyis 'phags pa rnams la khyad par yod pas so //
translated: It should not be said that there is no difference, because there is a difference in the extent to which the minds of those ƒÅryas are free from the signs of error.

original: de yang gang gi tshe chos kyi dbyings la cha shas med pas bdag nyid thams cad kyis so sor rtogs su zin kyang nges par skye ba la ltos nas kun du 'gro ba'i don du so sor rtogs pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med par mngon du byed
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe chos kyi dbyings la cha shas med pas bdag nyid thams cad kyis so sor rtogs su zin kyang nges par skye ba la ltos nas kun du 'gro ba'i don du so sor rtogs pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med par mngon du byed
translated: Moreover, when the dharmadhƒÅtu is realized in its entirety, because it is partless, then, in dependence on the arising of the realization of the meaning of the all-pervading, the very clear consciousness that realizes that all phenomena are essenceless

original: pa'i shin tu gsal ba'i shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam thob po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pa'i shin tu gsal ba'i shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam thob po zhes gsungs so //
translated: arises. At that time, it is said that the bodhisattva has attained the path of seeing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma gcig la de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas nas kyang phyin ci log gi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du bsgom pa'i lam yang rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma gcig la de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas nas kyang phyin ci log gi nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du bsgom pa'i lam yang rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is also reasonable that the path of cultivation is for the sake of eliminating superimpositions that are afflicted with error, even though reality is perceived in a single moment.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi dbye ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi dbye ba bshad zin to //
translated: The classification of the path of seeing has been explained.

original: gnas skabs 'di nyid du bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pas byang chub sems dpa' skad cig so so la rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir sa rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di nyid du bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pas byang chub sems dpa' skad cig so so la rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir sa rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Since the supramundane path that accomplishes the aims of self and other is attained in this state, the bodhisattva becomes extremely joyful in each moment. Therefore, it is called the stage of extreme joy.

original: gzhan yang rab tu dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rab tu dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o ;
translated: Moreover, extreme joy is mental satisfaction.

original: / de yang rnam pa dgu ste /üîΩde la dang ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni dkon mchog la'o //
analyzed: / de yang rnam pa dgu ste / de la dang ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni dkon mchog la'o //
translated: It is of nine types.üîΩFaithful extreme joy is with regard to the three jewels.

original: rangs pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni dmigs pa la dga' bas so //
analyzed: rangs pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni dmigs pa la dga' bas so //
translated: Joyful extreme joy is with regard to the focal object.

original: sems pa mthong ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni bdag gi rtogs pa'i khyad par mthong bas so //üîΩmchog tu gyur pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni bdag gi lus dang sems la rjes su bzung bas rgyas par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sems pa mthong ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni bdag gi rtogs pa'i khyad par mthong bas so // mchog tu gyur pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni bdag gi lus dang sems la rjes su bzung bas rgyas par 'gyur bas so //
translated: The joy of seeing the mind is the joy of seeing the distinctive realization of the self.üîΩThe joy of the highest is the joy of the highest, because the body and mind are nourished and grow.

original: rab kyi rab tu dga' ba ni lus dang sems la rjes su bzung bas khyab pas so //
analyzed: rab kyi rab tu dga' ba ni lus dang sems la rjes su bzung bas khyab pas so //
translated: The joy of the best of the best is the joy of the best of the best, because the body and mind are nourished and pervaded.

original: spro ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni byang chub dang nye bar mthong bas so //
analyzed: spro ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni byang chub dang nye bar mthong bas so //
translated: The joy of enthusiasm is the joy of enthusiasm, because one sees that enlightenment is near.

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i don du 'phel ba'i gtam gyis dus su mi 'khrugs pas so //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa'i don du 'phel ba'i gtam gyis dus su mi 'khrugs pas so //
translated: The joy of non-disturbance is the joy of non-disturbance, because one is not disturbed by the talk of growth for the sake of ripening one's own continuum.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni gzhan yongs su smin pa'i don du sems can yongs su sdud pa'i tshe snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni gzhan yongs su smin pa'i don du sems can yongs su sdud pa'i tshe snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The joy of non-violence is the joy of non-violence, because one gathers sentient beings for the sake of ripening others, through compassion and skillful means.

original: mi khro ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni sems can log par sgrub pa'i dus su bzod pas so //
analyzed: mi khro ba'i rab tu dga' ba ni sems can log par sgrub pa'i dus su bzod pas so //
translated: The joy of non-anger is the joy of non-anger, because one is patient when sentient beings act wrongly.

original: de @37b ltar rnam pa dgus rab tu dga' ba yin pas na rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de @37b ltar rnam pa dgus rab tu dga' ba yin pas na rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called the ground of Very Joyful because of these nine aspects.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'di kho na 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa ci ltar 'gyur ba de ltar sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'di kho na 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa ci ltar 'gyur ba de ltar sngar bstan zin to //
translated: This path of seeing is the accomplishment of engagement and the accomplishment of the assembly, as previously explained.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin can zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin can zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The path of seeing is also called the nature of the branches of enlightenment.

original: 'di ltar byang chub ni de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i rtog pa med pa'i ye shes mthong lam gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub ni de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i rtog pa med pa'i ye shes mthong lam gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: Thus, enlightenment is the nature of the path of seeing, the nonconceptual gnosis that is the realization of thatness.

original: dran pa la sogs pa drug gi byang chub dang rjes su mthun pa yin pas byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa drug gi byang chub dang rjes su mthun pa yin pas byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: Since it is concordant with the enlightenment of the six, such as mindfulness, it is a branch of enlightenment.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni byang chub kyi bdag nyid can yin pas byang chub kyang yin la dran pa la sogs pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin pas yan lag kyang yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni byang chub kyi bdag nyid can yin pas byang chub kyang yin la dran pa la sogs pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin pas yan lag kyang yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the discernment of phenomena is enlightenment by nature, it is enlightenment, and since it is the support of mindfulness and so on, it is a branch, and thus it is called the seven branches of enlightenment.

original: gzhan dag ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i chos rab tu 'byed pa la byang chub kyi yan lag ces brjod la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i chos rab tu 'byed pa la byang chub kyi yan lag ces brjod la /
translated: The other factors are called ‚Äúlimbs of enlightenment‚Äù because they are the discernment of dharmas that are included in the uninterrupted path.

original: rnam par grol bas bsdus pa la byang chub ces brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par grol bas bsdus pa la byang chub ces brjod do //
translated: The path of liberation is called ‚Äúenlightenment.‚Äù

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la rnam gzhag lnga ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la rnam gzhag lnga ste /
translated: There are five topics in the presentation of the limbs of enlightenment:

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
translated: the object, the nature, the aids, the cultivation, and the result of cultivation.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag gi de kho na nyid de don dam pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag gi de kho na nyid de don dam pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The object is the reality of the four noble truths. It is said that this is the ultimate.

original: ngo bo ni dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: ngo bo ni dran pa dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: The nature is mindfulness, the discernment of dharmas, effort, joy, pliancy, samƒÅdhi, and equanimity.

original: de la byang chub kyi rten gyi yan lag dran pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi rten gyi yan lag dran pa ste /
translated: Among these, mindfulness is the limb of enlightenment that is the basis.

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa de la yengs par mi 'gyur pas so //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa de la yengs par mi 'gyur pas so //
translated: The power of mindfulness does not allow distraction from that object.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag ni chos rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag ni chos rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: The factor of essence is the differentiation of dharmas.

original: byang chub shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: byang chub shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: It is the essence of enlightenment, of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Exertion is the factor of renunciation.

original: brtson 'grus kyis so so skye bo'i sa las 'da' bar byed pas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis so so skye bo'i sa las 'da' bar byed pas so //
translated: By means of exertion one passes beyond the stage of the common man.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Joy is the factor of benefit.

original: des lus dang sems rjes su 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: des lus dang sems rjes su 'dzin pas so //
translated: By means of it one benefits body and mind.

original: shin tu sbyang pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyang pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Calmness, concentration, and equanimity are the factors of non-defilement.

original: de rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas so //üîΩde la kun nas nyon mongs @38a * //üîΩpa med pa'i gzhi ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas so // de la kun nas nyon mongs @38a * // pa med pa'i gzhi ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: They are the antidotes to defilement.üîΩTherein, the basis of non-defilement is calmness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rten ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rten ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The support of non-defilement is concentration.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni btang snyoms te /
translated: Equanimity is the nature of non-affliction.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: Thus, it is the purity of non-affliction.

original: de'i gzhi ni rgyu ste sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni rgyu ste sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Its basis is the cause, which is purification.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhi'i gnyen po yin pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhi'i gnyen po yin pas na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the antidote to the basis of affliction, it is called the basis of non-affliction.

original: 'di ltar lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'i gnas ngan len gyis sems rtse gcig tu mi gnas pas sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus dang sems las su mi rung ba'i gnas ngan len gyis sems rtse gcig tu mi gnas pas sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mind becomes distracted due to the unserviceability of body and mind, because of the unfitness that the mind does not remain one-pointed.

original: sems g-yengs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu 'jog go //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu 'jog go //
translated: Afflictions such as passion are fully established in a distracted mind.

original: des na lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid kyis gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: des na lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid kyis gnas ngan len no //
translated: Therefore, unfitness of body and mind is unfitness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i de'i gnyen po ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i de'i gnyen po ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the basis of affliction is pliancy.

original: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: And that is the basis of non-affliction.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba las sems mnyam par 'jog pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba las sems mnyam par 'jog pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because one abandons the afflictions through correct knowledge of things as they are, by means of mental equipoise from the serviceability of body and mind.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnyen po yin pas shin tu sbyangs pa la de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnyen po yin pas shin tu sbyangs pa la de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since it is the antidote to the basis of affliction, pliancy is also called the basis of non-affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rten ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rten ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Concentration is the support of non-affliction.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bas so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bas so //
translated: Because one abandons the afflictions through correct knowledge of things as they are, by means of mental equipoise.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin btang snyoms te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rang bzhin btang snyoms te /
translated: Equanimity is the nature of non-affliction.

original: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa dang bral bas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid mnyam pa nyid ma yin pa'i gnyen po yin pas so //
analyzed: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa dang bral bas kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid mnyam pa nyid ma yin pa'i gnyen po yin pas so //
translated: Because it is the antidote to mental equipoise and nonequipoise that are compatible with remaining in an afflicted state, due to being free from covetousness, mental unhappiness, and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas kun nas nyon mongs pa de'i rgyu dang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs nas kun nas nyon mongs pa de'i rgyu dang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa zhes bya la /
translated: Others are called the path of liberation, which is included in the path of seeing, because it is the path of seeing that abandons the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rnam par nges pa'i shes rab skye ba gang yin pa de la btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par nges pa'i shes rab skye ba gang yin pa de la btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
translated: The path of liberation is called equanimity because it is the arising of the wisdom of ascertainment.

original: dgos pa grub pa'i phyir zad do snyam nas btang snyems su 'jug pas so //
analyzed: dgos pa grub pa'i phyir zad do snyam nas btang snyems su 'jug pas so //
translated: It is called equanimity because one enters equanimity thinking, ‚ÄúThe purpose is accomplished‚Äù since the afflictions are exhausted.

original: ngo bo bstan zin to //
analyzed: ngo bo bstan zin to //
translated: The nature has been explained.

original: grogs ni de rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: grogs ni de rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Its companions are the mind and mental factors that are concomitant with those.

original: @38b bsgom pa ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi lam dben ba la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: @38b bsgom pa ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi lam dben ba la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /
translated: Its cultivation is the cultivation of the path of enlightenment that is right mindfulness, which is based on isolation, based on nonattraction,

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa /üîΩrnam par spong bar yongs su bsgyur ba bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa /üîΩrnam par spong bar yongs su bsgyur ba bsgoms pa'o //
translated: based on cessation,üîΩand directed to the relinquishment of worldly desire and attachment.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ji lta bar btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ji lta bar btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the member of enlightenment called right mindfulness, and so on, up to the member of enlightenment called right concentration.

original: bden pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par spong ba yongs su bsgyur ba'i tshig bzhi po 'dis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bden pa bzhi la dmigs nas bsgom pa yin par yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: bden pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par spong ba yongs su bsgyur ba'i tshig bzhi po 'dis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bden pa bzhi la dmigs nas bsgom pa yin par yongs su bstan te /
translated: The four phrases ‚Äúabiding in the truth,‚Äù ‚Äúabiding in detachment,‚Äù ‚Äúabiding in cessation,‚Äù and ‚Äúturning away from discrimination‚Äù show that the members of enlightenment are cultivated by taking the four noble truths as their objects.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal sdug bsngal nyid du dmigs pa ni de dang bral ba tshol ba yin pas sdug bsngal la dmigs pa la dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal sdug bsngal nyid du dmigs pa ni de dang bral ba tshol ba yin pas sdug bsngal la dmigs pa la dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the observation of suffering as suffering is the search for freedom from it. Therefore, the observation of suffering is called ‚Äúabiding in detachment.‚Äù

original: sred pa'i mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal gyi kun 'byung sdug bsngal gyi kun 'byung nyid du dmigs pa na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba tshol ba yin pas de la dmigs pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal gyi kun 'byung sdug bsngal gyi kun 'byung nyid du dmigs pa na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba tshol ba yin pas de la dmigs pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one focuses on the origin of suffering, which is characterized by craving, as the origin of suffering, one seeks freedom from attachment to it. Thus, focusing on that is called ‚Äúabiding in freedom from attachment.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'gog pa sdug bsngal gyi 'gog pa nyid du dmigs pa na de mngon du byed pa tshol ba yin pas de la dmigs pa la 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'gog pa sdug bsngal gyi 'gog pa nyid du dmigs pa na de mngon du byed pa tshol ba yin pas de la dmigs pa la 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one focuses on the cessation of suffering as the cessation of suffering, one seeks to actualize it. Thus, focusing on that is called ‚Äúabiding in cessation.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'gog par 'gro ba sgrub pa la rnam par spong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'gog par 'gro ba sgrub pa la rnam par spong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The practice that leads to the cessation of suffering is called ‚Äúelimination.‚Äù

original: des sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: des sdug bsngal spong bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because suffering is eliminated by that practice.

original: de de bzhin du dmigs pa na sgom pa tshol ba yin pas de la dmigs pa la rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du dmigs pa na sgom pa tshol ba yin pas de la dmigs pa la rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one focuses on that practice, one seeks to cultivate it. Thus, focusing on that is called ‚Äútransformation through elimination.‚Äù

original: bsgom pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: bsgom pa bstan zin to //
translated: The cultivation of the path has now been explained.

original: 'bras bu ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ste /
translated: The result is the elimination of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams mthong lam gyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams mthong lam gyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Because the factors of enlightenment are the essence of the path of seeing.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa lnga pas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsdus so //
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa lnga pas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsdus so //
translated: Thus, the fifth generation of the mind includes the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: des ni sems bskyed pa lnga pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin can nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni sems bskyed pa lnga pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi rang bzhin can nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the fifth generation of the mind has the nature of the factors of enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni de'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par gyur pa yod pas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa ni de'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par gyur pa yod pas so //
translated: It is accompanied by the perfection of generosity because at that time the perfection of generosity becomes extremely prominent.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas @39a * //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems la brten nas @39a * //
translated: Therein, the perfection of generosity is the bodhisattva's generosity that is based on the bodhisattva's abiding in reality and is supported by the mind of enlightenment.

original: snying rje sngon du song ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i dus su lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje sngon du song ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i dus su lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the action of body, speech, and mind when, with a mind preceded by compassion, one gives away all one's possessions.

original: de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid rigs dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dngos po dang / rang bzhin gyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid rigs dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dngos po dang / rang bzhin gyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of generosity should be understood as taught through its family, aspirational prayer, attitude, substance, and nature.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid ni rigs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid ni rigs so //
translated: Among them, the reality of the bodhisattva is the family.

original: smon lam ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: smon lam ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The aspirational prayer is the thought of awakening.

original: bsam pa ni snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i sems so //
analyzed: bsam pa ni snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i sems so //
translated: The attitude is the mind preceded by compassion.

original: dngos po ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: The substance is the giving away of all one's possessions.

original: rang bzhin ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so //
translated: The nature is the action of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the perfection of generosity has been explained together with its auxiliaries.

original: sems bskyed pa lnga pa ni gter chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa lnga pa ni gter chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The fifth generation of the thought is like a great treasure.

original: zang zing gi longs spyod kyi sems can tshad med pa rnams tshim par byed pa dang / mi zad pas so //
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod kyi sems can tshad med pa rnams tshim par byed pa dang / mi zad pas so //
translated: It satisfies countless beings with material goods and it is inexhaustible.

original: sems bskyed pa lnga pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa lnga pa bstan zin to //
translated: The fifth generation of the Thought has been explained.

original: sems bskyed pa drug pa nas nyi shu pa'i bar du sems bskyed pa bco lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgom pa'i lam dang / 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa dang / lam gyi yan lag dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa drug pa nas nyi shu pa'i bar du sems bskyed pa bco lnga ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgom pa'i lam dang / 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa dang / lam gyi yan lag dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The fifteen generations of the Thought from the sixth to the twentieth are called the supramundane path of meditation, the path of preparation, the path of accumulation, and the path with its branches.

original: ji ltar bstan pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi mngon du byas pa'i dngos po las tha mi dad pa la dmigs pas mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam tha mi dad pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi mngon du byas pa'i dngos po las tha mi dad pa la dmigs pas mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam tha mi dad pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam mtshan nyid pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The path of meditation is indeed the real path of meditation, because it is the path of meditation that is not different from the entity that is manifested on the path of seeing as it is taught, and because it is not different from the path of meditation.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen por sgom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dngos po'i gnyen por sgom par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the meditation that is the antidote to the entity that is to be eliminated by the meditation on the reality of dependent origination.

original: des na mthong ba'i don la shes pa rgyun chags pa skye ba ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i don la shes pa rgyun chags pa skye ba ni sgom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the path of meditation is the continuous arising of the knowledge that sees the truth.

original: de yang lam yin pas na bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de yang lam yin pas na bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the path of meditation because it is the path.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa drug dang /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa drug dang /
translated: The path of meditation abandons the sixteen afflictions of the three realms in stages. The path of meditation abandons the six afflictions of the desire realm: connate attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance, and the connate afflicted view of the self and extreme view.üîΩThe five afflictions of the form realm are the same as those except anger is excluded. The five afflictions of the formless realm are the same as those except anger is excluded.

original: drug po de rnams nyid kyis khong khro dor bas gzugs kyi khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga yin bas bsgom @39b pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bcu drug rim gyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug po de rnams nyid kyis khong khro dor bas gzugs kyi khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga yin bas bsgom @39b pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bcu drug rim gyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The path of meditation abandons the sixteen afflictions in stages.

original: de yang bag la nyal spong bar 'gyur gyi mngon du rgyu ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bag la nyal spong bar 'gyur gyi mngon du rgyu ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It abandons their latent states but not their manifest states.

original: sngon nyid du nyams par gyur pas so //
analyzed: sngon nyid du nyams par gyur pas so //
translated: because they have already degenerated.

original: de la yang 'dod khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang ; nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: de la yang 'dod khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang ; nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang /
translated: There are nine stages: the desire realm, and the first, second, third, and fourth concentrations, and the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bye brag gis sa dgu yod do //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bye brag gis sa dgu yod do //
translated: They are divided into nine stages by the distinction of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: de yang re re la yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu yod de /
analyzed: de yang re re la yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu yod de /
translated: And each of those has nine types of afflictions.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa drug la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas gsum yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa drug la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas gsum yod do //
translated: Thus, the six afflictions of the desire realm have three types: small, medium, and great.

original: de la chung ngu la /üîΩchung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: de la chung ngu la / chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: Among those, the smallüîΩhave three types: small of the small, medium of the small, and great of the small.

original: 'bring la 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po ste gsum yod do //
analyzed: 'bring la 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po ste gsum yod do //
translated: The medium have three types: small of the medium, medium of the medium, and great of the medium.

original: chen po la yang chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po ste gsum yod do //
analyzed: chen po la yang chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po ste gsum yod do //
translated: The great has three types: small of the great, middling of the great, and great of the great.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa la rnam pa dgu yod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa la rnam pa dgu yod do //
translated: Thus there are nine types of affliction in the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du sa so so la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu dgur 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa so so la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu dgur 'gyur bas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, there are nine types of affliction for each level, so there are eighty-one afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la yang brgyad cu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la yang brgyad cu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: Similarly, there are also eighty-one paths of meditation that are antidotes to the eighty-one afflictions.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur la /
translated: Thus the path of meditation that is an antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm becomes three types: small, middling, and great.

original: de la yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: And each of those is divided into small of the small and so on, making nine types.

original: de bzhin du so so'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la rnam pa dgu dgur 'gyur bas lam yang brgya bcu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du so so'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la rnam pa dgu dgur 'gyur bas lam yang brgya bcu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, since the path of cultivation of the antidote to each of the defilements is ninefold, the path is of eleven hundred kinds.

original: de la yang khyad par 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yang khyad par 'di yin te /
translated: But there is this difference.

original: sa so so la lam chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po rnam par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa so so la lam chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po rnam par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On each stage, the weak-weak path eliminates the strong-strong defilement.

original: de bzhin du chung ngu'i 'bring gis chen po'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen pos chen po'i chung ngu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chung ngu'i 'bring gis chen po'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen pos chen po'i chung ngu'o //
translated: In the same way, the weak-medium path eliminates the strong-medium defilement, and the weak-strong path eliminates the strong-weak defilement.

original: de bzhin du 'bring gi chung ngus 'bring gi chen po dang / 'bring ge 'bring gis @40a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bring gi chung ngus 'bring gi chen po dang / 'bring ge 'bring gis @40a * //
translated: In the same way, the medium-weak path eliminates the medium-strong defilement, the medium-medium path eliminates the medium-medium defilement, and the medium-strong path eliminates the medium-weak defilement.

original: 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen pos 'bring gi chung ngu'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen pos 'bring gi chung ngu'o //
translated: The strong-weak path eliminates the weak-strong defilement, the strong-medium path eliminates the weak-medium defilement, and the strong-strong path eliminates the weak-weak defilement.

original: de bzhin du chen po'i chung ngus chung ngu'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring gis chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen pos nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spong bar 'gyur ba yin pas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa las bzlog pa'i gnyen po'i rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chen po'i chung ngus chung ngu'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring gis chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen pos nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spong bar 'gyur ba yin pas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa las bzlog pa'i gnyen po'i rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the antidotes should be understood as being established in the opposite way to the aspects of the afflictions.

original: ci'i phyir lam chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does the small of the small path abandon the great of the great aspects of the afflictions?

original: nyon mong pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po rnam par de ngo tsha ba dang / khrel med pa'i rgyu la kun tu spyod pas mtshon pa dang yongs su gcod par sla ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mong pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po rnam par de ngo tsha ba dang / khrel med pa'i rgyu la kun tu spyod pas mtshon pa dang yongs su gcod par sla ba yin no //
translated: Because the great of the great aspects of the afflictions are easy to cut off and destroy by the small of the small path, which is characterized by the practice of shame and embarrassment towards the cause of shamelessness and lack of embarrassment.

original: des na dri ma rags pa bzhin du gnyen po chung ngus spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dri ma rags pa bzhin du gnyen po chung ngus spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like coarse stains, they are abandoned by a small antidote.

original: gang kun du spyod pa yongs su gcod par dka' ba phra ba nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu dri ma phra mo bzhin du gnyen po chen po'i chen po stobs kyis spong bar 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam pa'i rnam gzhagüîΩbzlog nas bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang kun du spyod pa yongs su gcod par dka' ba phra ba nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu dri ma phra mo bzhin du gnyen po chen po'i chen po stobs kyis spong bar 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rnam pa'i rnam gzhag bzlog nas bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of meditation is the antidote to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩThe path of meditation is the antidote to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩThe path of meditation is the antidote to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de la lam gyi rnam pa re re la yang sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin nyid shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la lam gyi rnam pa re re la yang sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin nyid shes par bya ste /
