analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so // de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshad @42a * //
translated: The four immeasurables are friendliness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: med pa bzhi mdor bsdus nas sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa gsum gyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa bzhi mdor bsdus nas sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rnam pa gsum gyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva should cultivate the four immeasurables in brief in three ways: with reference to sentient beings, with reference to the Dharma, and without reference.

original: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' mos pas bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang ; bde ba 'dod pa'i sems can gyi dbang du byas nas bde ba nye bar bsdu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i byams pa'i sems kyis phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams la khyab par gnas pa de ni sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' mos pas bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang ; bde ba 'dod pa'i sems can gyi dbang du byas nas bde ba nye bar bsdu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i byams pa'i sems kyis phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams la khyab par gnas pa de ni sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the love of bodhisattvas that is accompanied by the superior intention to gather beings to oneself, and that is directed toward beings who are happy, who are suffering, and who desire happiness, and that pervades the ten directions, is called the love that takes sentient beings as its object.

original: gang yang chos tsam la nye bar btags par bsams pas mthong nas byams pa de kho na nyid bsgom pa de ni chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang chos tsam la nye bar btags par bsams pas mthong nas byams pa de kho na nyid bsgom pa de ni chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa'o //
translated: The love that is directed toward the mere phenomena of sentient beings, that is cultivated by one who has seen that the self is a mere imputation, is called the love that takes phenomena as its object.

original: gang yang chos kyang rnam par mi rtog par byams pa de kho na nyid sgom par byed pa de ni dmigs pa med pa'i byams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang chos kyang rnam par mi rtog par byams pa de kho na nyid sgom par byed pa de ni dmigs pa med pa'i byams par rig par bya'o //
translated: The love that is directed toward the reality of love, which is free of conceptualization even with regard to phenomena, should be understood as the love that takes no object.

original: ji ltar byams pa la rnam pa gsum bstan pa de bzhin du snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la yang rig par bya'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can la dmigs nas sdug bsngal dang bral bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas phyogs bcu rnams su snying rje dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni snying rje'o
analyzed: ji ltar byams pa la rnam pa gsum bstan pa de bzhin du snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la yang rig par bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can la dmigs nas sdug bsngal dang bral bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas phyogs bcu rnams su snying rje dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems sgom par byed pa gang yin pa de ni snying rje'o
translated: Just as love is shown to have three aspects, so also compassion, joy, and equanimity are to be understood.üîΩCompassion is the thought of a bodhisattva who, focusing on sentient beings who are suffering, cultivates a thought of compassion that is accompanied by a superior intention to remove their suffering.

original: // gang byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems can la dmigs nas bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsam pa lhag pas phyogs bcu rnams su dga' ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pas sems bsgom pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: // gang byang chub sems dpa' bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems can la dmigs nas bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsam pa lhag pas phyogs bcu rnams su dga' ba dang lhan cig tu gyur pas sems bsgom pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the thought of a bodhisattva who, focusing on sentient beings who are happy, cultivates a thought of joy that is accompanied by a superior intention to rejoice in their happiness.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems can de rnams kho na rim pa bzhin du gti mug dang / zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa'i bden pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas phyogs bcu rnams su btang snyoms dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems bsgom pa de ni btang snyoms so ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems can de rnams kho na rim pa bzhin du gti mug dang / zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa'i bden pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas phyogs bcu rnams su btang snyoms dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sems bsgom pa de ni btang snyoms so ;
translated: And for those sentient beings who are neither happy nor unhappy, who are suffering, and who are happy, he cultivates the thought of equanimity, with the superior intention of the truth of the affliction of delusion, hatred, and desire, respectively, in the ten directions.

original: / de la gang byang chub sems dpa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i tshad med pa de ni gzhan mu stegs pa rnams dang thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: / de la gang byang chub sems dpa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i tshad med pa de ni gzhan mu stegs pa rnams dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs immeasurable concern for sentient beings is shared with non-Buddhists.

original: gang chos la dmigs pa'i tshad med pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang chos la dmigs pa'i tshad med pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba yin gyi /
translated: The immeasurable concern for phenomena is shared with the Disciples and Solitary Sages.

original: mu stegs pa gzhan dang ni thun mong ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa gzhan dang ni thun mong ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: But it is not shared with non-Buddhists.

original: gang byang @42b chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa de ni mu stegs pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang byang @42b chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa de ni mu stegs pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the bodhisattva‚Äôs immeasurable that is not an objective support is not common to all the tƒ´rthikas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la tshad med pa bzhi po de yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa na sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshad med pa bzhi po de yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa na sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the four immeasurables are focused on sentient beings on the stage of action from faith.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bdun ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bdun ni chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: On the seven stages beginning with the Joyous, they are focused on the Dharma.

original: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'o //üîΩ'dir chos la dmigs pa mthar son pa la bsams nas tshad med pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'o // 'dir chos la dmigs pa mthar son pa la bsams nas tshad med pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: On the Immovable and so on, they are not focused.üîΩHere, the culmination of the focus on the Dharma is taught to be the immeasurables.

original: tshad med pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: The immeasurables are taught to be the same as the focus on the Dharma.

original: de yang bshes gnyen lta bu ste ;
analyzed: de yang bshes gnyen lta bu ste ;
translated: They are like a friend.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mtshan nyid mi zad pa'i tshad med pa dang ldan pas gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi 'dor bas so //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mtshan nyid mi zad pa'i tshad med pa dang ldan pas gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi 'dor bas so //
translated: He is endowed with the inexhaustible immeasurables of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, and thus he never abandons the welfare of sentient beings in any situation.

original: sems bskyed pa bdun pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur ba dang / mi zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dang yang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bdun pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur ba dang / mi zad pa'i mngon par shes pa dang yang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The seventh generation of the enlightenment mind is accompanied by the perfection of vows and by the inexhaustible superknowledges.

original: de la smon lam ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas du ma yin no //
analyzed: de la smon lam ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas du ma yin no //
translated: Among them, a vow is of the nature of a strong aspiration, and so it is multiple.

original: 'dir ni dge ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i skye ba 'dod pa de la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni dge ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i skye ba 'dod pa de la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the wish for a rebirth that is favorable to virtue is called the perfection of vows.

original: gang gis skye zhing skye bar sangs rgyas 'byung ba la mnyes par byed cing rtag tu sbyin pa la sogs pa la rab tu 'jug pa gang yin pa de las so //
analyzed: gang gis skye zhing skye bar sangs rgyas 'byung ba la mnyes par byed cing rtag tu sbyin pa la sogs pa la rab tu 'jug pa gang yin pa de las so //
translated: It is from that wish that one is born again and again, delights the appearance of the buddhas, and always engages in generosity and so forth.

original: mngon par shes pa drug ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: The six higher perceptions are the higher perception of supernatural power, the higher perception of the divine ear, the higher perception of knowing others' minds, the higher perception of recollecting past lives,

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: the higher perception of death and rebirth, and the higher perception of the destruction of defilements.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Among them, the higher perception of supernatural power is the concentration and wisdom that, based on the absorptions, are the correct attainment of various supernatural manifestations, as well as the mind and mental factors associated with them.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor ba ni sa 'gul bar byed pa dang / gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar @43a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor ba ni sa 'gul bar byed pa dang / gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar @43a * //
translated: The correct attainment of various kinds of magical transformations is the shaking of the earth, becoming one and becoming many, becoming visible and becoming invisible,

original: yang 'gyur ba dang / rtsig pa la yang 'dzul zhing ri la yang mi thogs par 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' la yang 'gro ba dang / sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang / bye'u 'dzul byed pa dang / sa chen po bzhin du chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: yang 'gyur ba dang / rtsig pa la yang 'dzul zhing ri la yang mi thogs par 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' la yang 'gro ba dang / sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang / bye'u 'dzul byed pa dang / sa chen po bzhin du chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ba dang /
translated: penetrating walls and going without impediment through mountains, flying through the sky, diving into the earth as if into water, walking on water as if on the earth,

original: du ba 'thul bar byed cing me 'bar bar yang byed pa dang / bdag gi lus kyang sprin chen po bzhin du gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po gang zhing nub par byed pa'i chu chen po 'brub par byed do //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bar byed cing me 'bar bar yang byed pa dang / bdag gi lus kyang sprin chen po bzhin du gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po gang zhing nub par byed pa'i chu chen po 'brub par byed do //
translated: emitting smoke and flames and radiating light from the body, and raining down great rain from the sky.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba yang lag pas yongs su 'dzin cing kun tu nyug par byed pa dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang sgyur zhing spobs pa bde ba ster bar byed pa dang / 'od kyang spro bar byed do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba yang lag pas yongs su 'dzin cing kun tu nyug par byed pa dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang sgyur zhing spobs pa bde ba ster bar byed pa dang / 'od kyang spro bar byed do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: He can touch the sun and moon with his hand and wander about, and with his body he can control and even reach the Brahma world, and he can emit light.

original: de lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: His superknowledge of the divine ear is the samadhi and wisdom of the correct attainment of listening to various sounds based on dhyana, and the mind and mental factors associated with them.

original: sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes pa ni des rnam par dag pa mi las shin tu 'das pa'i lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis lha dang / mi dang dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi sgra yang thos par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes pa ni des rnam par dag pa mi las shin tu 'das pa'i lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis lha dang / mi dang dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi sgra yang thos par gyur pa ste /
translated: The ‚Äúmastery of hearing various sounds‚Äù is that, by means of the divine ear element that is pure and surpasses the human, one hears the sounds of gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: tha na sha sbrang dang / mchu rings dang / 'bu srin dang / bya dang / bung ba rnams kyi sgra yang sdug bsngal zhing nyam thag pa'i nga ror thos nas sdug bsngal de dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir shin tu 'bad pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha na sha sbrang dang / mchu rings dang / 'bu srin dang / bya dang / bung ba rnams kyi sgra yang sdug bsngal zhing nyam thag pa'i nga ror thos nas sdug bsngal de dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir shin tu 'bad pa byed pa'o //
translated: Even the sounds of flies, mosquitoes, worms, birds, and bees are heard as cries of suffering and distress. Having heard them, one strives with great effort to free them from that suffering.

original: zhing sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos ston pa'i sgra yang 'di kho nar gnas nas thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhing sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos ston pa'i sgra yang 'di kho nar gnas nas thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: One also hears the sounds of the teachings of the Dharma of the buddhas of various realms while remaining right here.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gzhan dag gi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gzhan dag gi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The superknowledge of the knowledge of the categories of mind is the concentration and wisdom in the correct attainment of the mental activities of other sentient beings, based on the dhyanas,üîΩand the mind and mental factors concomitant with them.

original: sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni des sems can gzhan de dag gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sems nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni des sems can gzhan de dag gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sems nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: The correct attainment of the mental activities is the correct knowledge of the minds of other sentient beings, of other persons, by means of their minds.

original: @43b 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes pa dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / skyon dang bcas pa dang / skyon dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: @43b 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes pa dang / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / skyon dang bcas pa dang / skyon dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang /
translated: A mind with attachment is a mind with attachment, and likewise a mind without attachment, a mind with faults, a mind without faults, a mind with delusion, a mind without delusion,

original: bla na med pa'i sems la bla na med pa'i sems so zhes pa'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sems la bla na med pa'i sems so zhes pa'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the mind of another, as it is in reality, up to the knowledge of the mind of another as it is in reality.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The superknowledge of the memory of former abodes is the concentration and wisdom which are applied to the memory of former abodes, and the mind and mental activities associated with them.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni skye ba gcig kyang dran la /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni skye ba gcig kyang dran la /
translated: The memory of former abodes is the memory of one birth,

original: gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / skye ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du yang dag par rjes su dran par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / skye ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du yang dag par rjes su dran par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: two births, three births, up to the memory of a hundred thousand ko·π≠is of niyutas of hundred thousands of births.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du rjes su dran par 'gyur ba ni bdag ni ming 'di zhes bya ba dang / rus ni 'di zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du rjes su dran par 'gyur ba ni bdag ni ming 'di zhes bya ba dang / rus ni 'di zhes bya ba dang /
translated: In the same way, they will remember one day, two days, three days, up to a hundred thousand quintillion eons, thinking, ‚ÄòI was called such-and-such, I was born in such-and-such a place, I was in such-and-such a family, I ate such-and-such food, I experienced such-and-such happiness and suffering, I lived for so long, my life ended in such-and-such a place, and I was reborn in such-and-such a place.‚ÄôüîΩ

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya ba dang / kha zas ni 'di zhes bya ba dang / de ltar yun ring du gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de ltar tshe'i mthar thug par gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de nas 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya ba dang / kha zas ni 'di zhes bya ba dang / de ltar yun ring du gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de ltar tshe'i mthar thug par gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de nas 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: In the same way, they recall one day, two days, three days, up to a hundred thousand quintillion eons, thinking, ‚ÄòI had such and such a name, such and such a family, such and such a caste, such and such food, I lived for so long, I lived for that long, and then I died and was reborn here.‚Äô

original: ming dang bcas pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'i bar du rnam pa sna tshogs dang bcas pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang bcas pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'i bar du rnam pa sna tshogs dang bcas pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: They recall their previous existences in various ways, with their aspects, with their characteristics, and with their causes.

original: gzhan gyi sngon gyi srid pa yang de kho na'i sgo nas dran par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sngon gyi srid pa yang de kho na'i sgo nas dran par byed do //
translated: They also recall the previous existences of others in the same way.

original: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mthong ba'i yang dag pa 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mthong ba'i yang dag pa 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The superknowledge of death and rebirth is the correct attainment of concentration and wisdom based on the dhyanas, which sees the deaths and rebirths of sentient beings,üîΩand the mind and mental factors associated with that.

original: de rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mthong ba'i yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni des lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mthong ba'i yang dag par 'byor ba zhes pa ni des lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ste /
translated: The correct attainment of seeing their deaths and rebirths is the divine eye that sees sentient beings with a purity that surpasses the human,

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / @44a * //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / @44a * //
translated: seeing their deaths and rebirths,

original: skyes pa rnams kyi kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i sems can rnams rab tu shes so //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyi kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i sems can rnams rab tu shes so //
translated: and how they go to good or bad rebirths according to their good or bad color, whether inferior or excellent.

original: sems can gyi lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang / sems kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa rnams la skur pa btab pa dang / yang dag par lta ba dang ldan pa'i legs par spyad pa'i rgyu des lus zhig nas shi ba'i rjes la bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lhar skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang / sems kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa rnams la skur pa btab pa dang / yang dag par lta ba dang ldan pa'i legs par spyad pa'i rgyu des lus zhig nas shi ba'i rjes la bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lhar skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen sentient beings possess physical, verbal, and mental good conduct, and when they have the right view and do not denigrate the noble ones, then, due to the cause of such good conduct, when their bodies disintegrate, after death they will be born in a happy realm, in the world of the gods.

original: sems can rnams kyi lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang / sems kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa rnams la skur pa btab pa dang / log par lta ba can /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang / sems kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa rnams la skur pa btab pa dang / log par lta ba can /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen sentient beings possess physical, verbal, and mental bad conduct, and when they denigrate the noble ones and have wrong views,

original: log par lta ba kun tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu des lus zhig nas shi ba'i rjes la ngan song log par ltung ba'i dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par lta ba kun tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu des lus zhig nas shi ba'i rjes la ngan song log par ltung ba'i dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, due to the cause of such wrong views, when their bodies disintegrate, after death they will be born in the lower realms, in the hells.‚Äù

original: zhes lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar gtugs pa'i /
analyzed: zhes lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar gtugs pa'i /
translated: With the divine eye, he sees the worlds of the ten directions, extending to the limits of space.üîΩ

original: 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: With the divine eye, he knows the deaths and rebirths of beings in the world systems of the ten directions, as far as the end of the world system.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas zag pa zad pa'i shes pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas zag pa zad pa'i shes pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The superknowledge of the extinction of the impurities is the concentration and wisdom, and the mind and mental factors associated with them, based on the absorptions, that are applied to the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa yang dag par 'byor pa ni thabs gang gis zag pa zad par 'gyur ba dang gang zag bzad pa shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa yang dag par 'byor pa ni thabs gang gis zag pa zad par 'gyur ba dang gang zag bzad pa shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The application to the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities is the method by which the impurities are extinguished and the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities.

original: de la zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni sa brgyad pa la thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni sa brgyad pa la thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The superknowledge of the extinction of the impurities is attained on the eighth stage,

original: rnam par rtog pa mngon du rgyu ba med pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mngon du rgyu ba med pas so //
translated: because the manifestation of conceptualization is absent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: On the Buddha stage, it is completely perfected,

original: bag chags su gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa zad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: bag chags su gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa zad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because the conceptual thoughts that are habitual tendencies are exhausted.

original: mi zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rtsol ba med par 'jug pa yin pas sems bskyed pa bdun pa mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig tu gyur bar bstan no //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rtsol ba med par 'jug pa yin pas sems bskyed pa bdun pa mngon par shes pa dang lhan cig tu gyur bar bstan no //
translated: Since the uncontaminated superknowledges function effortlessly, the seventh generation of the thought of enlightenment is taught as being associated with the superknowledges.

original: sems bskyed @44b pa 'di ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed @44b pa 'di ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu ste /
translated: This generation of the thought is like a wish-granting gem,

original: ji ltar smon pa bzhin du 'bras bu yang dag par 'byor pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar smon pa bzhin du 'bras bu yang dag par 'byor pas so //
translated: because it brings about the fruit just as it was wished for.

original: sems bskyed pa brgyad pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa brgyad pa ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The eighth generation of the thought is associated with the perfection of power and with the four means of gathering disciples.

original: de la so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the perfection of power is called the power that cannot be overcome by adverse elements, which is the power of discernment and the power of cultivation.

original: de la so sor brtags pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Discernment is wisdom.

original: bsgom pa ni dge ba'i chos goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni dge ba'i chos goms pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the practice of wholesome dharmas.

original: gnyis po de dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since these two are not overcome by adverse elements, they are called perfections of power.

original: de'i las ni skad cig ma so so la nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i las ni skad cig ma so so la nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Their function is to engage in the realization of liberation, etc., in every moment.

original: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mi non pas so //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mi non pas so //
translated: For one who possesses the power of discernment and cultivation, the adverse elements of generosity, etc., are not overwhelming.

original: mdo gzhan du gsungs pa'i stobs kyang 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo gzhan du gsungs pa'i stobs kyang 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: The powers mentioned in other scriptures should be understood in this way.

original: 'di ltar bsams pa'i stobs yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams pa'i stobs yod do //
translated: There is the power of reflection,

original: nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba med pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba med pas so //
translated: because there is no manifestation of the passions.

original: lhag pa'i bsams pa'i stobs kyang yod de /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsams pa'i stobs kyang yod de /

original: sa'i shes pa yongs su sbyangs pas so //
analyzed: sa'i shes pa yongs su sbyangs pas so //
translated: because of the purification of knowledge of the stages.

original: gzungs kyi stobs kyang yod de /
analyzed: gzungs kyi stobs kyang yod de /
translated: There is the power of retention,

original: mi brjed pa'i chos can yin pas so //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i chos can yin pas so //
translated: because one possesses the Dharma without forgetting it.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyang yod de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyang yod de /
translated: There is also the power of concentration,

original: rtag tu rnam par mi g-yeng bas so //
analyzed: rtag tu rnam par mi g-yeng bas so //
translated: because he is always undistracted.

original: yang dag par 'byor ba'i stobs kyang yod de /
analyzed: yang dag par 'byor ba'i stobs kyang yod de /
translated: There is also the power of right attainment,

original: mtha' yas shing mthar thug pa med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi spyod pa'i bye brag la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: mtha' yas shing mthar thug pa med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi spyod pa'i bye brag la mkhas pas so //
translated: because he is skilled in the infinite and endless varieties of worldly behavior.

original: dbang nyid kyi stobs kyang yod de /
analyzed: dbang nyid kyi stobs kyang yod de /
translated: There is also the power of mastery,

original: mngon par 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas so //
translated: because he fulfills all his wishes.

original: spobs pa'i stobs kyang yod de /
analyzed: spobs pa'i stobs kyang yod de /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas par gyur pas so //

translated: The ninth generation of the Mind is accompanied by the perfection of knowledge and by the four analytical knowledges.

original: de la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad du theg pa chen po'i chos la sgra ji bzhin du kun du rmongs pa dang bral ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad du theg pa chen po'i chos la sgra ji bzhin du kun du rmongs pa dang bral ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Therein, the perfection of knowledge is the knowledge everywhere free from misunderstanding the teachings of the Great Vehicle just as they are.

original: sgra ji bzhin du kun du rmongs pa ni gang gis dgongs pa can gyi don dor nas sgra ji bzhin du don rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du kun du rmongs pa ni gang gis dgongs pa can gyi don dor nas sgra ji bzhin du don rtogs pa'o //
translated: Literal understanding is the understanding of the meaning of a text literally, without regard to the intention of the speaker.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'i phrin las ni chos la longs spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'i phrin las ni chos la longs spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: The activity of the perfection of knowledge is the enjoyment of the Dharma and the maturation of sentient beings.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: The perfection of knowledge and its activity have been explained.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The analytical knowledges are four in number.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //üîΩde la chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //üîΩde la chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
translated: The analytical knowledge of the teaching, the analytical knowledge of meaning, the analytical knowledge of languages, and the analytical knowledge of brilliance.üîΩThe analytical knowledge of the teaching is the knowledge of the names and divisions of the teachings.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams la thogs pa med par yang yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams la thogs pa med par yang yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Mastery over the various kinds of preternatural knowledge is the ability to manifest any kind of preternatural knowledge at will.üîΩThe various kinds of preternatural knowledge are the knowledge of magical powers, the knowledge of divine ear, the knowledge of others‚Äô minds, the knowledge of past lives, the knowledge of death and rebirth, and the knowledge of the termination of contaminations.

original: rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩma rig pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor ba ni 'di lta ste / ma rig pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The knowledge of magical powers is the ability to perform miracles, such as multiplying oneself, passing unhindered through walls, and so forth.üîΩThe knowledge of divine ear is the ability to hear sounds, both divine and human, both near and far.üîΩThe knowledge of others‚Äô minds is the ability to know the minds of other beings and persons.üîΩThe knowledge of past lives is the ability to remember one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô previous lives.

original: mi shes pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩdon so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / dgongs pa la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa la sogs pa'o // don so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / dgongs pa la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of death and rebirth is the ability to see beings dying in one place and being reborn in another.

original: dgongs pa ni don gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni don gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the termination of contaminations is the ability to know the termination of the contaminations.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas yul gyi skad dang / chos kyi nges pa'i tshig la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas yul gyi skad dang / chos kyi nges pa'i tshig la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The analytical knowledge of the etymological interpretation is the concentration, etc. which are the unhindered analytical knowledges of the language of the country and the etymological interpretation of the Dharma, based on the absorptions.

original: yul gyi skad ni ji ltar yul so so rang rang gi ming gzhan dang gzhan gyi tha snyad do //üîΩchos kyi nges pa'i tshig @46a * //
analyzed: yul gyi skad ni ji ltar yul so so rang rang gi ming gzhan dang gzhan gyi tha snyad do // chos kyi nges pa'i tshig @46a * //
translated: The language of the country is the other and other conventions of the names of each of the individual countries.

original: ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The etymological interpretation of the Dharma is as follows:

original: 'jig pas na 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig rten no //
translated: The world is worldly because it is destroyed.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas chos rab tu 'byed pa la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas chos rab tu 'byed pa la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The analytical knowledge of ready speech is the concentration, etc. which are the unhindered analytical knowledges of the discernment of phenomena, based on the absorptions.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rdzas su yod pa dang btags par yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa ni rdzas su yod pa dang btags par yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The discernment of phenomena is the substantial existence, the imputed existence, the conventional existence, the ultimate existence, etc.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: The six perfections together with the analytical knowledges have been explained.

original: sems bskyed pa 'di ni dri za'i glu snyan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa 'di ni dri za'i glu snyan pa lta bu ste /
translated: This generation of the thought is like the sweet song of the gandharvas,

original: mi zad pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis gdul bya gdul bar byed pa'i chos ston par byed bas so //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis gdul bya gdul bar byed pa'i chos ston par byed bas so //
translated: because it teaches the Dharma which tames the disciples by means of the four inexhaustible analytical knowledges.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa drug pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa drug pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with the sixth generation of the thought,

original: sems bskyed pa bcu bzhi'i bar sa dgu'i rang bzhin sems bskyed pa dgu 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu'i gnyen po nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bcu bzhi'i bar sa dgu'i rang bzhin sems bskyed pa dgu 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu'i gnyen po nyid du bstan to //
translated: nine generations of the thought, which are of the nature of the nine stages, are taught as the antidotes to the nine categories of the afflictions which are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the desire realm.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa bcu bzhi bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa bcu bzhi bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the fourteen generations of the thought have been explained.

original: sems bskyed pa bco lnga pa nas sems bskyed pa nyi shu'i bar sems bskyed pa drug ni sa bcu'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bco lnga pa nas sems bskyed pa nyi shu'i bar sems bskyed pa drug ni sa bcu'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par te /
translated: The six generations of the thought from the fifteenth to the twentieth are the distinctive states of the ten stages,

original: khyad par gyi lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam zhes bya'o //
translated: and are called the path of distinction.

original: de la sems bskyed pa dang po lnga po rnams la so so dbye ba rnam pa bcu bzhi byas pas rnam pa bdun cur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa dang po lnga po rnams la so so dbye ba rnam pa bcu bzhi byas pas rnam pa bdun cur 'gyur te /
translated: The first five of the ten stages of generating the Thought are each divided into fourteen parts, making seventy parts.

original: 'di ltar sems bskyed pa lnga po rnams la so sor sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes kyi rnam pa gsum gsum du 'gyur la dngos gzhi la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi bzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems bskyed pa lnga po rnams la so sor sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes kyi rnam pa gsum gsum du 'gyur la dngos gzhi la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi bzhir 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, each of the five stages of generating the Thought is divided into three parts: the preparatory practice, the actual practice, and the subsequent practice. And each of the actual practices is divided into four parts: small, medium, great, and great-great.

original: yang chung ngu la sogs pa so so la chung ngu la sogs pa gsum gsum du phye na so so la rnam pa bcu bzhi bcu bzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang chung ngu la sogs pa so so la chung ngu la sogs pa gsum gsum du phye na so so la rnam pa bcu bzhi bcu bzhir 'gyur la /
translated: And each of the small, etc., is divided into three parts, small, etc., making fourteen parts each.

original: des na sems bskyed pa lnga po rnams la dbye ba bdun cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sems bskyed pa lnga po rnams la dbye ba bdun cur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are seventy divisions of the five stages of generating the Thought.

original: de la sgom pas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi nang nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam pa dgu pa bcu pa'i bar gyis rab tu spangs so //
analyzed: de la sgom pas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi nang nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam pa dgu pa bcu pa'i bar gyis rab tu spangs so //
translated: Of the eighty-one [degrees of] the discards by means of the path of cultivation, the first nine aspects of the Desire Realm, up to the tenth, are thoroughly discarded.

original: lhag ma lus pa ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: lhag ma lus pa ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The remaining are seventy-two.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi po rnams la so sor rnam pa dgu dgu dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnas gsum po rnams kyi so sor dgu dgu dang / gnas bzhi pa'i rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi po rnams la so sor rnam pa dgu dgu dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnas gsum po rnams kyi so sor dgu dgu dang / gnas bzhi pa'i rnam pa bdun te /
translated: In the form realm, the four concentrations are each divided into nine types, and in the formless realm, the three abodes are each divided into nine types, and the fourth abode has seven types.

original: sgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs @46b pa bdun cu'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa sems bskyed pa lnga'i rnam pa bdun cus rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs @46b pa bdun cu'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa sems bskyed pa lnga'i rnam pa bdun cus rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These seventy-two types of mental states that are antidotes to the seventy afflictions to be abandoned by cultivation completely eliminate them.

original: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa ste /
translated: The sixth mental state has seventy-one types.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: Up to the uninterrupted path of the buddha stage.

original: des srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It completely eliminates the seventy-first type of affliction of the peak of existence.

original: sems bskyed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa'i rab kyi mtha'i gnas skabs dang phra rgyas thams cad gzhig par nus pas rdo rje lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa'i rab kyi mtha'i gnas skabs dang phra rgyas thams cad gzhig par nus pas rdo rje lta bu'o //
translated: This generation of the thought is like a diamond, because it is the occasion of the ultimate of the meditation on the true meaning, and because it is able to destroy all the propensities.

original: rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa 'di kho na la dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes rnam gzhag bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig pa 'di kho na la dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes rnam gzhag bya'o //
translated: It is only in this one, the seventy-first, that the designation of ‚Äúcandidate for the fruit of Arhatship‚Äù is made.

original: de la rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig gi nang nas rnam pa dang po sum cu dor ba'i lhag ma rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa gcig la nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i rnam gzhag bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gcig gi nang nas rnam pa dang po sum cu dor ba'i lhag ma rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa gcig la nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i rnam gzhag bya ste /
translated: Of these seventy-one, the first thirty aspects are set aside, and the remaining forty-one aspects are the establishment of the ‚Äúcandidate for emancipation.‚Äù

original: 'di rnams kyis ma rgyal ba las rgyal ba thob ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ma rgyal ba las rgyal ba thob ste /
translated: Because of these, one obtains victory over what has not been conquered,

original: nges par 'byung bas 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bas 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur bas so //
translated: and because of emancipation, one obtains the ultimate of the fruits.

original: de la sems bskyed pa drug gi nang nas sems bskyed pa dang po ni nges par rton pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa drug gi nang nas sems bskyed pa dang po ni nges par rton pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Of the six generations of the thought, the first generation of the thought is accompanied by the ‚Äúfour certainties.‚Äù

original: de la nges par rton pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la nges par rton pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four certainties:

original: don la rton par bya'i legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa tshig 'bru la ni ma yin pa dang / chos de rigs pa la rton par bya'i gang zag ste gnas brtan la sogs pa la ma yin pa dang / ye shes te bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab de la rton par bya'i /
analyzed: don la rton par bya'i legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa tshig 'bru la ni ma yin pa dang / chos de rigs pa la rton par bya'i gang zag ste gnas brtan la sogs pa la ma yin pa dang / ye shes te bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab de la rton par bya'i /
translated: One should rely on the Dharma, not on the person, such as the elder, etc.üîΩOne should rely on the wisdom, which is the knowledge born of meditation, not on the consciousness, which is the knowledge born of hearing and reflection.

original: rnam par shes pa ste thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la ni ma yin pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mchog tu tshad ma yin pas des gang nges pa'i don gyi mdo gsungs pa de la rton par bya'i /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ste thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la ni ma yin pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mchog tu tshad ma yin pas des gang nges pa'i don gyi mdo gsungs pa de la rton par bya'i /
translated: One should rely on the Buddha Bhagavat, who is the supreme authority, and on the sutras of definitive meaning that he has taught.

original: drang ba'i don la ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: drang ba'i don la ma yin pa ste /
translated: One should not rely on the provisional meaning.

original: yang dag par rton pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rton pa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four right reliances.

original: sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyal po chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyal po chen po lta bu ste /
translated: This production of the thought is like a great king,

original: thogs pa med pa'i mthu nyid kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i mthu nyid kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pas so //
translated: because it accomplishes the welfare of others by the power of its unobstructed might.

original: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The second production of the thought is accompanied by the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: de la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Among these, the two perfections of giving and morality are the accumulation of merit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //üîΩbzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsod nams @47a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so // bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsod nams @47a * //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the accumulation of knowledge.

original: dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The perfections of patience, effort, and meditation are the accumulation of both merit and knowledge.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Thus, the patience of not retaliating against harm done by others and the patience of accepting suffering are the accumulation of merit.

original: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The patience of being certain about the Dharma is the accumulation of knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang gis sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The effort by which one cares for sentient beings is the accumulation of merit.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rdzogs par byed pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rdzogs par byed pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The effort by which one perfects nonconceptual intuition is the equipment of intuition.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gang gis sems can yongs su 'dzin par byed pa de bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gang gis sems can yongs su 'dzin par byed pa de bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The meditative concentration by which one benefits sentient beings is the equipment of merit.

original: bsam gtan gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rdzogs par byed pa de ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rdzogs par byed pa de ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The meditative concentration by which one perfects nonconceptual intuition is the equipment of intuition.

original: yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa lnga char ye shes kyi tshogs kyang yin te /
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa la sogs pa lnga char ye shes kyi tshogs kyang yin te /
translated: Or else, the five beginning with giving are the equipment of intuition,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas so //
translated: because they are dedicated to unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni 'khor bar bde ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs ni 'khor bar bde ba'i don du'o //
translated: Therein, the equipment of merit is for the sake of happiness in cyclic existence.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'khor ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'khor ba'i don du ste /
translated: The equipment of intuition is for the sake of the cyclic existence of the bodhisattva who is free from addictions.

original: sems can gyi don du bsam pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du bsam pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: This is because the bodhisattva, with a prior intention,

original: srid par skye ba yongs su gzung yang 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pas so //
analyzed: srid par skye ba yongs su gzung yang 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pas so //
translated: Even though they take up birth in existence, they are not soiled by the defects of cyclic existence.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la chung ngu dang gnyis pa la 'bring dang / gsum pa la chen po zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la chung ngu dang gnyis pa la 'bring dang / gsum pa la chen po zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should know that the bodhisattvas‚Äô accumulations of merit and wisdom are small in the first incalculable eon, middling in the second, and great in the third.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: The accumulations of merit and wisdom have been explained as being concomitant with the generation of bodhicitta.

original: de yang mdzod lta bu ste /
analyzed: de yang mdzod lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a treasury,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi gnas yin pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi gnas yin pas so //
translated: because it is the basis of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: sems bskyed pa gsum pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gsum pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang /
translated: The third generation of bodhicitta is the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, which are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four thorough abandonings, the four legs of manifestation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the eight branches of the noble path.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //üîΩde la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do // de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste /

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar nyi shu rtsa dgu bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar nyi shu rtsa dgu bshad zin to //
translated: Among these, the four foundations of mindfulness, up to the seven factors of enlightenment, have already been explained.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad ni phyis 'chad bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad ni phyis 'chad bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The eightfold noble path will be explained later.

original: de yang lam chen po lta bu ste /
analyzed: de yang lam chen po lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a great road,

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams @47b cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams @47b cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pas so //
translated: because all noble persons have gone and are going on it.

original: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bzhi pa ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //

original: de la rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa'i sems gnas pa gang yin pa de zhi gnas so //
analyzed: de la rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa'i sems gnas pa gang yin pa de zhi gnas so //
translated: Among them, serenity is the ninefold dwelling of the mind.

original: de la rnam pa dgu ni nang nyid du sems 'jog pa dang / rgyun du 'jog pa dang / blan nas 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / 'dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / rnam par zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de la rnam pa dgu ni nang nyid du sems 'jog pa dang / rgyun du 'jog pa dang / blan nas 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / 'dul bar byed pa dang / zhi bar byed pa dang / rnam par zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: The nine are: the mind rests within, is continuously placed, is placed with restraint, is placed with nearness, is disciplined, is pacified, is thoroughly pacified, is one-pointed, and is concentrated.
