original: 'dul bar byed pa ni dang po nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu mtshan gzugs la sogs pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes bskyed pa'i sgo nas 'phro bar mi byed pa gang yin pa'o//
analyzed: 'dul bar byed pa ni dang po nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu mtshan gzugs la sogs pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes bskyed pa'i sgo nas 'phro bar mi byed pa gang yin pa'o//
translated: The subduer is that which, at the very outset, does not allow distraction to occur by means of the perception of form, etc. as suffering.

original: zhi bar byed pa ni sems 'khrug par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sdug bsngal bar mthong bas rab tu 'phro bar mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhi bar byed pa ni sems 'khrug par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sdug bsngal bar mthong bas rab tu 'phro bar mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The pacifier is that which, by seeing the secondary mental afflictions such as discursive thought as suffering, does not allow the mind to be disturbed.

original: rnam par zhi bar byed pa ni dran pa nyams pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mngon du rgyu bar gyur na de zhi bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par zhi bar byed pa ni dran pa nyams pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mngon du rgyu bar gyur na de zhi bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The complete pacifier is that which, when discursive thought, etc. arise due to the loss of mindfulness, causes them to be pacified.

original: rtse gcig tu byed pa ni mngon par 'du byed pas bar dang mtshams med par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig tu byed pa ni mngon par 'du byed pas bar dang mtshams med par ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The concentrator is that which, by means of application, establishes the stream of samƒÅdhi without interruption.

original: mnyam par 'jog pa ni legs par goms pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog pa ni legs par goms pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /
translated: The meditator is that which, by means of thorough training, does not apply itself.

original: mi rtsol bas sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun rnam par mi g-yeng ba rab tu 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtsol bas sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun rnam par mi g-yeng ba rab tu 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-distraction of the stream of mental concentration due to non-exertion.

original: lhag mthong ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Insight is fourfold:

original: chos la rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos la rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: analysis of phenomena, full analysis, thorough examination, and close investigation.

original: de la spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa nyid kyi dmigs pa @48a * //üîΩphung po la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ste ji snyed yod pa nyid shes pa de la rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa nyid kyi dmigs pa @48a * // phung po la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ste ji snyed yod pa nyid shes pa de la rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of purification of conduct and the object of skillüîΩare the aggregates, etc. The object of purification of the defilements is the knowledge of the diversity of all things. That is called analysis.

original: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma'i gnyen po nyid kyi dbang du byas nas dmigs pa de rnams ji ltar yod pa bzhin du shes pa de la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma'i gnyen po nyid kyi dbang du byas nas dmigs pa de rnams ji ltar yod pa bzhin du shes pa de la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In regard to the object of the antidote to the signs of depravity, the knowledge of things as they are is called full analysis.

original: shes rab dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas dmigs pa de la yongs su rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas dmigs pa de la yongs su rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thorough examination of that object by a non-conceptual intuition which is accompanied by insight is called thorough examination.

original: phyin ci log thams cad las 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci log ma yin pa la sems 'jog pa gang yin pa de la yongs su dpyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log thams cad las 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas phyin ci log ma yin pa la sems 'jog pa gang yin pa de la yongs su dpyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thorough analysis of that object by a non-conceptual intuition which is accompanied by serenity is called thorough analysis.

original: zhig nas dang lhag mthong dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //üîΩsems bskyed pa 'di ni bzhon pa bzang po lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhig nas dang lhag mthong dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to // sems bskyed pa 'di ni bzhon pa bzang po lta bu ste /
translated: The fifth and sixth productions of the thought of enlightenment have already been explained as being accompanied by serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung bar mi ltung bar bde bar 'khyer bas so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung bar mi ltung bar bde bar 'khyer bas so //
translated: This production of the thought is like a good vehicle, for it easily carries one to either nirvana or the cyclical flow, without falling into either extreme, by means of the union of serenity and insight which proceeds spontaneously.

original: sems bskyed pa lnga pa ni gzungs dang spobs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa lnga pa ni gzungs dang spobs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The fifth production of the thought is accompanied by retention and eloquence.

original: de la dran pa dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi gzungs ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi gzungs ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four retentions which are of the nature of memory and wisdom.

original: bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: bzod pa'i gzungs dang / chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs so //
translated: the dharani of patience, the dharani of the Dharma, the dharani of meaning, and the dharani of spells.

original: de la bzod pa'i gzungs ni aa ra pa tsa na la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la de'i don de kho na nyid sgro btags nas sgom par byed pa rnams la bsgom pa rdzogs par gyur na yi ge'i don dam pa la bzod pa gang skyes pa ste
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i gzungs ni aa ra pa tsa na la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams la de'i don de kho na nyid sgro btags nas sgom par byed pa rnams la bsgom pa rdzogs par gyur na yi ge'i don dam pa la bzod pa gang skyes pa ste
translated: The dharani of patience is the patience that arises in one who has completed the meditation on the letters arapacana, etc., by superimposing their meaning, reality, on them.

original: / shes rab kyi rang bzhin bzod pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / shes rab kyi rang bzhin bzod pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is patience that has the nature of wisdom.

original: de ltar chos thams cad yi ge aa'i sgo can te /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad yi ge aa'i sgo can te /
translated: Thus, all dharmas have the door of the letter a,

original: gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are originally unborn.

original: de la sgo ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i thabs aa'o //
analyzed: de la sgo ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i thabs aa'o //
translated: The door is the means of realizing the nature of all dharmas just as it is, namely, the letter a.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad dang po nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad dang po nyid de /
translated: Because all dharmas are originally that.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na ma skyes pa de'i phyir ma skyes pa'i don yi ge aa la sgro btags nas bsgoms pas goms pa'i stobs kyis yi ge aa tsam legs par goms par gyur na chos thams cad la skye ba med pa'i bzod pa skyeüîΩbar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na ma skyes pa de'i phyir ma skyes pa'i don yi ge aa la sgro btags nas bsgoms pas goms pa'i stobs kyis yi ge aa tsam legs par goms par gyur na chos thams cad la skye ba med pa'i bzod pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is unborn in the state of being with defilements, by meditating on the meaning of non-arising, which is superimposed on the letter A, through the power of familiarity, when one becomes well-acquainted with the mere letter A, one will give rise to the acceptance that all phenomena are unborn.

original: de ltar ma skyes pa de nyid ni aa'i don no //
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa de nyid ni aa'i don no //
translated: That very non-arising is the meaning of A.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo'i yi ger te ra dza zhes bya ba rdul te de dang bral bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo'i yi ger te ra dza zhes bya ba rdul te de dang bral bas so //
translated: Similarly, the letter Ra, which is the door of all phenomena, is Rajas, which is dust, because it is free from that.

original: ji ltar nam @48b mkha' rdul gyis mi gos pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyang nyon mongs pa'i rdul gyis mi gos so zhes pa ni ra'i don no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam @48b mkha' rdul gyis mi gos pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyang nyon mongs pa'i rdul gyis mi gos so zhes pa ni ra'i don no //
translated: Just as space is not soiled by dust, so suchness is not soiled by the dust of afflictions. This is the meaning of Ra.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo yi ge pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo yi ge pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the letter Pa, which is the door of all phenomena,

original: par ma aartha zhes bya ba don dam pa ste /
analyzed: par ma aartha zhes bya ba don dam pa ste /
translated: is Paramartha, which is the ultimate,

original: don dam par chos thams cad la khyad par med pas so //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad la khyad par med pas so //
translated: because ultimately all phenomena are without distinction.

original: don dam pa de yang de kho na nyid do zhes pa ni yi ge pa'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa de yang de kho na nyid do zhes pa ni yi ge pa'i don to //
translated: The ultimate is thatness. This is the meaning of the syllable ta.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo yi ge tsa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo yi ge tsa ste /
translated: Similarly, the syllable tsa is the gateway to all dharmas.

original: byo ba na zhes bya ba 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ste /
analyzed: byo ba na zhes bya ba 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ste /
translated: The word cyuti means death and rebirth.

original: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of that.

original: de bzhin nyid la skye ba'i srid pa dang / 'chi 'pho'i srid pa med pa gang yin pa de ni yi ge tsa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la skye ba'i srid pa dang / 'chi 'pho'i srid pa med pa gang yin pa de ni yi ge tsa'i don to //
translated: The nonexistence of the existence of birth and the existence of death in suchness is the meaning of the syllable tsa.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo yi ge na ste n'a ma zhes bya ba ni ming yin la de dang bral bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgo yi ge na ste n'a ma zhes bya ba ni ming yin la de dang bral bas so //
translated: Similarly, the syllable na is the gateway to all dharmas. The word nƒÅma means name. Because it is free from that.

original: de bzhin nyid la ming med pa ni yi ge na'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ming med pa ni yi ge na'i don to //
translated: The nonexistence of a name in suchness is the meaning of the syllable na.

original: 'di nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is just an illustration.

original: yi ge ji snyed yod pa de snyed gzungs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge ji snyed yod pa de snyed gzungs kyi tshig go //
translated: As many syllables as there are, that is the extent of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ words.

original: bzod pa'i gzungs bstan zin to //
analyzed: bzod pa'i gzungs bstan zin to //
translated: The dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of acceptance has been explained.

original: chos kyi gzungs ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos kyi phung po 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi gzungs ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos kyi phung po 'dzin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ste /
translated: The dharani of Dharma is the cause of retaining the aggregates of Dharma taught by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions.

original: dpag tu med pa'i chos rnams thos pa tsam gyis dus dpag tu med pa 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i chos rnams thos pa tsam gyis dus dpag tu med pa 'dzin pas so //
translated: It is the retention of immeasurable Dharma for immeasurable time through merely hearing immeasurable Dharma.

original: des na de'i don 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni don gyi gzungs so //
analyzed: des na de'i don 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni don gyi gzungs so //
translated: Therefore, the cause of retaining its meaning is the dharani of meaning.

original: de nas sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sngags la dbang ba nyid ni sngags kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: de nas sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sngags la dbang ba nyid ni sngags kyi gzungs so //
translated: Then, the power over the mantra that takes on the appearance of the retention of sentient beings is the dharani of mantra.

original: de la bzod pa'i gzungs ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i gzungs ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: Among these, the dharani of forbearance is on the stage of action from faith.

original: lhag ma gsum ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The remaining three are on the Joyous and so on.

original: gzungs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: gzungs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: The dharani together with these has been explained.

original: ma thos pa'i chos rnams mi zad par ston pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de la spobs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma thos pa'i chos rnams mi zad par ston pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de la spobs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the cause of teaching the inexhaustible Dharma not heard before is called eloquence.

original: spobs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: spobs pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: Eloquence together with these has been explained.

original: sems bskyed pa 'di ni bkod ma'i chu lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa 'di ni bkod ma'i chu lta bu ste /
translated: This generation of the Thought is like a spring of water.

original: chu 'dzin pa dang / mi zad par skye ba dang 'dra bar thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos dang don 'dzin pa dang zad pa med pa'i chos ston pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: chu 'dzin pa dang / mi zad par skye ba dang 'dra bar thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos dang don 'dzin pa dang zad pa med pa'i chos ston pa 'byung bas so //
translated: Just as the water-holder and the inexhaustible arising are similar, so the holding of the Dharma and its meaning, heard and not heard, and the arising of the inexhaustible Dharma teaching.

original: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni chos kyi dga' ston dang lan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa drug pa ni chos kyi dga' ston dang lan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The sixth generation of the Thought is the one-time festival of the Dharma.

original: de la chos kyi dga' ston ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la chos kyi dga' ston ni bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, the festival of the Dharma is fourfold.

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
translated: It is the discrimination that all compounded things are impermanent.

original: zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is the discrimination that all that is associated with the outflows is suffering.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is the discrimination that all dharmas are without self.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad zhi ba'o zhes so sor rtog pa gang @49a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad zhi ba'o zhes so sor rtog pa gang @49a * //
translated: It is the discrimination that all of Nirvana is peace.

original: yin pa'o // de la mi rtog pa ni rtag tu med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yin pa'o // de la mi rtog pa ni rtag tu med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Therein, the non-discrimination is the non-existence of permanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i don med pa yin pas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don med pa yin pas so //
translated: It is the meaning of impermanence, because of non-existence.

original: kun rdzob tu ni skad cig ma 'jig pa'i don la yang mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni skad cig ma 'jig pa'i don la yang mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And, conventionally, it is also called ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù in the sense of moment-by-moment destruction.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas na mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas na mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Nirvana is called ‚Äúpeace‚Äù because all discursive thought is completely pacified.

original: chos kyi dga' ston dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ston dang lhan cig tu gyur pa bstan zin to //
translated: The feast of Dharma has been explained together with that.

original: de yang rab tu snyan pa'i sgra lta bu ste /
analyzed: de yang rab tu snyan pa'i sgra lta bu ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like a very pleasant sound.

original: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan par sgrogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan par sgrogs par byed pas so //
translated: It is proclaimed as pleasant to those disciples who desire liberation.

original: de ltar drug pa nas sems bskyed pa bco lnga'i bar bsgom pa'i lam nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar drug pa nas sems bskyed pa bco lnga'i bar bsgom pa'i lam nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, the sixth through the fifteenth generation of the thought of enlightenment are taught as the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam de'i yang grogs lam gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam de'i yang grogs lam gyi yan lag go //
translated: The limbs of the path are the aids to that path of cultivation.

original: de la lam gyi yan lag ni brgyad de /
analyzed: de la lam gyi yan lag ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight limbs of the path:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: 'di rnams la rnam gzhag lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams la rnam gzhag lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: These should be known as the five topics:

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo dang / grogs dang / sgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: object, nature, aid, meditation, and result of meditation.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba ste /
translated: The object is the reality of the four noble truths.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis phyis kyi dus su ji ltar mthong ba'i bden pa rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid ci lta ba de kho na lam gyi yan lag gi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis phyis kyi dus su ji ltar mthong ba'i bden pa rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid ci lta ba de kho na lam gyi yan lag gi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the branches of the path is the reality of the truths as they are seen, just as they were seen during the path of seeing.

original: sngar bstan pa'i yan lag brgyad ni ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i yan lag brgyad ni ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature is the previously explained eight branches.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right view is the branch of discernment.

original: des ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i de kho na nyid nges par byed pa ste /
analyzed: des ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i de kho na nyid nges par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the ascertainment of reality as it was experienced.

original: gang gis mthong ba'i lam gyis rtogs pa'i de kho na nyid du yongs su gcod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba'i lam gyis rtogs pa'i de kho na nyid du yongs su gcod pa ste /
translated: It is the ascertainment of reality as it was realized by the path of seeing.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin no zhes pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin no zhes pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the words right view.

original: lam la snyoms par zhugs pa la yang de'i skye ba'i nus pa yod pas de rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: lam la snyoms par zhugs pa la yang de'i skye ba'i nus pa yod pas de rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Also, one who enters the path of meditative equipoise possesses the potential to generate those, and thus they are posited as branches.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang ; yang dag pa'i ngag ni gzhan gyis go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang ; yang dag pa'i ngag ni gzhan gyis go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right thought and right speech are the branches that cause others to understand.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas rtogs pa'i de kho na nyid yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag gis gzhan la go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas rtogs pa'i de kho na nyid yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag gis gzhan la go bar byed pa ste /
translated: One causes others to understand reality tattva that is realized by right view through right thought and right speech.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa dang / rnam par mi dpyad pa'i tshig mi smra'i zhes gsungs pas @49b so ;
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa dang / rnam par mi dpyad pa'i tshig mi smra'i zhes gsungs pas @49b so ;
translated: One does not speak words that are not examined and analyzed.

original: / mnyam par gzhag pa la 'di gnyis yod de /
analyzed: / mnyam par gzhag pa la 'di gnyis yod de /
translated: These two exist in meditative equipoise.

original: de gnyis skye ba'i nus pa thob pas so //
analyzed: de gnyis skye ba'i nus pa thob pas so //
translated: One obtains the potential to generate those two.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag par mi rtog pa dang / yang dag par mi brjod pas so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag par mi rtog pa dang / yang dag par mi brjod pas so //
translated: Meditative equipoise is not right thought and not right speech because it is nonconceptual and inexpressible.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right speech, right action and right livelihood are the branches that cause others to have faith.

original: de rnams kyi ma rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa po lta ba la sogs pa yang dag par nges par byed pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ma rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa po lta ba la sogs pa yang dag par nges par byed pas so //
translated: The one who realizes them in the proper sequence is the one who ascertains the view and so on.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag ni rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgrib pa dang / lung ston pa 'phel ba'i gtam nges pas de'i lta ba rnam par dag pa yin no zhes shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag ni rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgrib pa dang / lung ston pa 'phel ba'i gtam nges pas de'i lta ba rnam par dag pa yin no zhes shes pa yin no //
translated: Correct speech is the ascertainment of the speech that accords with the view, and it is the ascertainment of the speech that increases the teaching of the scriptures.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas tshul khrims yongs su dag par shes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas tshul khrims yongs su dag par shes te /
translated: Correct action is the perfect conduct of going and coming and so on, and it is the ascertainment of pure ethics.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni nyes par spyod pa dang 'gal ba yin pas de dang ldan pa la srog gi phyir yang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pas tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i gzhan dag la nges pa skye ba
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni nyes par spyod pa dang 'gal ba yin pas de dang ldan pa la srog gi phyir yang bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pas tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa'i gzhan dag la nges pa skye ba
translated: Correct action is the opposite of negative action. Therefore others ascertain that one who possesses it possesses ethics, since one who possesses it does not engage in nonvirtue even for the sake of one's life.üîΩCorrect livelihood is the ascertainment of the perfect means of acquiring robes and so on.

original: yin no // yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni ji ltar gnas pa'i chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba yin pas yo byad la 'dod pa chung ba yin no snyam du nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yin no // yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni ji ltar gnas pa'i chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba yin pas yo byad la 'dod pa chung ba yin no snyam du nges par 'gyur te /
translated: One should understand that right livelihood is the desire for few things in terms of requisites, since it seeks the Dharma robes and so on that are appropriate for one's status.

original: 'di ltar tshul 'chos la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i srog gnas pa tsam gyi ched du lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul 'chos la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i srog gnas pa tsam gyi ched du lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba yin pas so //
translated: Right livelihood is the conduct of body and speech for the sake of merely maintaining life, free from the faults of hypocrisy and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right effort is the branch that purifies the obscurations of the afflictions.
